Ext.AbstractComponent.doc: An abstract base class which provides shared methods for Components across the Sencha product line.

configs.name: autoEl
configs.doc: A tag name or DomHelper spec used to create the Element which will encapsulate this Component.

configs.name: autoRender
configs.doc: This config is intended mainly for non-floating Components which may or may not be shown. Instead of using renderTo in the configuration, and rendering upon construction, this allows a Component to render itself upon first show. If floating is true, the value of this config is omited as if it is true.

configs.name: autoShow
configs.doc: True to automatically show the component upon creation. This config option may only be used for floating components or components that use autoRender. Defaults to false.

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class to apply to this components's element. This will also be prepended to elements within this component like Panel's body will get a class x-panel-body. This means that if you create a subclass of Panel, and you want it to get all the Panels styling for the element and the body, you leave the baseCls x-panel and use componentCls to add specific styling for this component.

configs.name: border
configs.doc: Specifies the border for this component. The border can be a single numeric value to apply to all sides or it can be a CSS style specification for each style, for example: '10 5 3 10'.

configs.name: childEls
configs.doc: An array describing the child elements of the Component.

configs.name: cls
configs.doc: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's Element. This can be useful for adding customized styles to the component or any of its children using standard CSS rules.

configs.name: componentCls
configs.doc: CSS Class to be added to a components root level element to give distinction to it via styling.

configs.name: componentLayout
configs.doc: The sizing and positioning of a Component's internal Elements is the responsibility of the Component's layout manager which sizes a Component's internal structure in response to the Component being sized.

configs.name: contentEl
configs.doc: Specify an existing HTML element, or the id of an existing HTML element to use as the content for this component.

configs.name: data
configs.doc: The initial set of data to apply to the tpl to update the content area of the Component.

configs.name: disabled
configs.doc: True to disable the component.

configs.name: disabledCls
configs.doc: CSS class to add when the Component is disabled. Defaults to 'x-item-disabled'.

configs.name: draggable
configs.doc: Allows the component to be dragged.

configs.name: floating
configs.doc: Create the Component as a floating and use absolute positioning.

configs.name: frame
configs.doc: Specify as true to have the Component inject framing elements within the Component at render time to provide a graphical rounded frame around the Component content.

configs.name: height
configs.doc: The height of this component in pixels.

configs.name: hidden
configs.doc: True to hide the component.

configs.name: hideMode
configs.doc: A String which specifies how this Component's encapsulating DOM element will be hidden.

configs.name: html
configs.doc: An HTML fragment, or a DomHelper specification to use as the layout element content. The HTML content is added after the component is rendered, so the document will not contain this HTML at the time the render event is fired. This content is inserted into the body before any configured contentEl is appended.

configs.name: id
configs.doc: The unique id of this component instance.

configs.name: itemId
configs.doc: An itemId can be used as an alternative way to get a reference to a component when no object reference is available. Instead of using an id with Ext.getCmp, use itemId with Ext.container.Container.getComponent which will retrieve itemId's or id's. Since itemId's are an index to the container's internal MixedCollection, the itemId is scoped locally to the container -- avoiding potential conflicts with Ext.ComponentManager which requires a unique id.

configs.name: loader
configs.doc: A configuration object or an instance of a Ext.ComponentLoader to load remote content for this Component.

configs.name: margin
configs.doc: Specifies the margin for this component. The margin can be a single numeric value to apply to all sides or it can be a CSS style specification for each style, for example: '10 5 3 10'.

configs.name: maxHeight
configs.doc: The maximum value in pixels which this Component will set its height to.

configs.name: maxWidth
configs.doc: The maximum value in pixels which this Component will set its width to.

configs.name: minHeight
configs.doc: The minimum value in pixels which this Component will set its height to.

configs.name: minWidth
configs.doc: The minimum value in pixels which this Component will set its width to.

configs.name: overCls
configs.doc: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's Element when the mouse moves over the Element, and removed when the mouse moves out. This can be useful for adding customized 'active' or 'hover' styles to the component or any of its children using standard CSS rules.

configs.name: padding
configs.doc: Specifies the padding for this component. The padding can be a single numeric value to apply to all sides or it can be a CSS style specification for each style, for example: '10 5 3 10'.

configs.name: plugins
configs.doc: An object or array of objects that will provide custom functionality for this component. The only requirement for a valid plugin is that it contain an init method that accepts a reference of type Ext.Component. When a component is created, if any plugins are available, the component will call the init method on each plugin, passing a reference to itself. Each plugin can then call methods or respond to events on the component as needed to provide its functionality.

configs.name: renderData
configs.doc: The data used by renderTpl in addition to the following property values of the component: id, ui, uiCls, baseCls, componentCls, frame.

configs.name: renderSelectors
configs.doc: An object containing properties specifying DomQuery selectors which identify child elements created by the render process.

configs.name: renderTo
configs.doc: Specify the id of the element, a DOM element or an existing Element that this component will be rendered into.

configs.name: renderTpl
configs.doc: An XTemplate used to create the internal structure inside this Component's encapsulating Element.

configs.name: style
configs.doc: A custom style specification to be applied to this component's Element. Should be a valid argument to Ext.Element.applyStyles.

configs.name: styleHtmlCls
configs.doc: The class that is added to the content target when you set styleHtmlContent to true.

configs.name: styleHtmlContent
configs.doc: True to automatically style the html inside the content target of this component (body for panels).

configs.name: tpl
configs.doc: An Ext.Template, Ext.XTemplate or an array of strings to form an Ext.XTemplate. Used in conjunction with the data and tplWriteMode configurations.

configs.name: tplWriteMode
configs.doc: The Ext.(X)Template method to use when updating the content area of the Component. See Ext.XTemplate.overwrite for information on default mode.

configs.name: ui
configs.doc: A set style for a component. Can be a string or an Array of multiple strings (UIs)

configs.name: uiCls
configs.doc: An array of of classNames which are currently applied to this component

configs.name: width
configs.doc: The width of this component in pixels.

configs.name: xtype
configs.doc: The xtype configuration option can be used to optimize Component creation and rendering. It serves as a shortcut to the full componet name. For example, the component Ext.button.Button has an xtype of button.

events.name: activate
events.doc: Fires after a Component has been visually activated.

events.name: added
events.doc: Fires after a Component had been added to a Container.

events.name: afterrender
events.doc: Fires after the component rendering is finished.

events.name: beforeactivate
events.doc: Fires before a Component has been visually activated. Returning false from an event listener can prevent the activate from occurring.

events.name: beforedeactivate
events.doc: Fires before a Component has been visually deactivated. Returning false from an event listener can prevent the deactivate from occurring.

events.name: beforedestroy
events.doc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false from an event handler to stop the destroy.

events.name: beforehide
events.doc: Fires before the component is hidden when calling the hide method. Return false from an event handler to stop the hide.

events.name: beforerender
events.doc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false from an event handler to stop the render.

events.name: beforeshow
events.doc: Fires before the component is shown when calling the show method. Return false from an event handler to stop the show.

events.name: deactivate
events.doc: Fires after a Component has been visually deactivated.

events.name: destroy
events.doc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.name: disable
events.doc: Fires after the component is disabled.

events.name: enable
events.doc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.name: hide
events.doc: Fires after the component is hidden. Fires after the component is hidden when calling the hide method.

events.name: move
events.doc: Fires after the component is moved.

events.name: removed
events.doc: Fires when a component is removed from an Ext.container.Container

events.name: render
events.doc: Fires after the component markup is rendered.

events.name: resize
events.doc: Fires after the component is resized.

events.name: show
events.doc: Fires after the component is shown when calling the show method.

Ext.AbstractPlugin.doc: The AbstractPlugin class is the base class from which user-implemented plugins should inherit.

Ext.Action.doc: An Action is a piece of reusable functionality that can be abstracted out of any particular component so that it can be usefully shared among multiple components. Actions let you share handlers, configuration options and UI updates across any components that support the Action interface (primarily Ext.toolbar.Toolbar, Ext.button.Button and Ext.menu.Menu components).

configs.name: disabled
configs.doc: True to disable all components configured by this Action, false to enable them.

configs.name: hidden
configs.doc: True to hide all components configured by this Action, false to show them.

configs.name: iconCls
configs.doc: The CSS class selector that specifies a background image to be used as the header icon for all components configured by this Action.

configs.name: itemId
configs.doc: See Ext.Component.itemId.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler is executed. Defaults to the browser window.

configs.name: text
configs.doc: The text to set for all components configured by this Action.

Ext.Ajax.doc: A singleton instance of an Ext.data.Connection. This class is used to communicate with your server side code. It can be used as follows:

Ext.app.Application.doc: Represents an Ext JS 4 application, which is typically a single page app using a Viewport. A typical Ext.app.Application might look like this:

configs.name: appFolder
configs.doc: The path to the directory which contains all application's classes. This path will be registered via Ext.Loader.setPath for the namespace specified in the name config.

configs.name: autoCreateViewport
configs.doc: True to automatically load and instantiate AppName.view.Viewport before firing the launch function.

configs.name: defaultUrl
configs.doc: When the app is first loaded, this url will be redirected to.

configs.name: enableQuickTips
configs.doc: True to automatically set up Ext.tip.QuickTip support.

configs.name: name
configs.doc: The name of your application. This will also be the namespace for your views, controllers models and stores. Don't use spaces or special characters in the name.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope to execute the launch function in. Defaults to the Application instance.

Ext.app.Controller.doc: Controllers are the glue that binds an application together. All they really do is listen for events (usually from views) and take some action. Here's how we might create a Controller to manage Users:

configs.name: id
configs.doc: The id of this controller. You can use this id when dispatching.

configs.name: models
configs.doc: Array of models to require from AppName.model namespace.

configs.name: stores
configs.doc: Array of stores to require from AppName.store namespace.

configs.name: views
configs.doc: Array of views to require from AppName.view namespace.

Ext.Array.doc: A set of useful static methods to deal with arrays; provide missing methods for older browsers.

Ext.Base.doc: The root of all classes created with Ext.define.

Ext.button.Button.doc: Create simple buttons with this component. Customisations include aligned icons, dropdown menus, tooltips and sizing options. Specify a handler to run code when a user clicks the button, or use listeners for other events such as mouseover.

configs.name: allowDepress
configs.doc: False to not allow a pressed Button to be depressed. Only valid when enableToggle is true.

configs.name: arrowAlign
configs.doc: The side of the Button box to render the arrow if the button has an associated menu.

configs.name: arrowCls
configs.doc: The className used for the inner arrow element if the button has a menu.

configs.name: autoWidth
configs.doc: By default, if a width is not specified the button will attempt to stretch horizontally to fit its content. If the button is being managed by a width sizing layout (hbox, fit, anchor), set this to false to prevent the button from doing this automatic sizing.

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class to add to all buttons.

configs.name: baseParams
configs.doc: An object literal of parameters to pass to the url when the href property is specified.

configs.name: clickEvent
configs.doc: The DOM event that will fire the handler of the button. This can be any valid event name (dblclick, contextmenu).

configs.name: cls
configs.doc: A CSS class string to apply to the button's main element.

configs.name: disabled
configs.doc: True to start disabled.

configs.name: enableToggle
configs.doc: True to enable pressed/not pressed toggling.

configs.name: focusCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to add to a button when it is in the focussed state.

configs.name: handleMouseEvents
configs.doc: False to disable visual cues on mouseover, mouseout and mousedown.

configs.name: hidden
configs.doc: True to start hidden.

configs.name: href
configs.doc: The URL to visit when the button is clicked.

configs.name: icon
configs.doc: The path to an image to display in the button (the image will be set as the background-image CSS property of the button by default, so if you want a mixed icon/text button, set cls:'x-btn-text-icon')

configs.name: iconAlign
configs.doc: The side of the Button box to render the icon.

configs.name: iconCls
configs.doc: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon for this button.

configs.name: menu
configs.doc: Standard menu attribute consisting of a reference to a menu object, a menu id or a menu config blob.

configs.name: menuActiveCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to add to a button when it's menu is active.

configs.name: menuAlign
configs.doc: The position to align the menu to (see Ext.Element.alignTo for more details).

configs.name: minWidth
configs.doc: The minimum width for this button (used to give a set of buttons a common width). See also Ext.panel.Panel.minButtonWidth.

configs.name: overCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to add to a button when it is in the over (hovered) state.

configs.name: overflowText
configs.doc: If used in a Toolbar, the text to be used if this item is shown in the overflow menu. See also Ext.toolbar.Item.overflowText.

configs.name: params
configs.doc: An object literal of parameters to pass to the url when the href property is specified. Any params override baseParams. New params can be set using the setParams method.

configs.name: pressed
configs.doc: True to start pressed (only if enableToggle = true)

configs.name: pressedCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to add to a button when it is in the pressed state.

configs.name: preventDefault
configs.doc: True to prevent the default action when the clickEvent is processed.

configs.name: repeat
configs.doc: True to repeat fire the click event while the mouse is down. This can also be a ClickRepeater config object.

configs.name: scale
configs.doc: The size of the Button.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler and toggleHandler is executed. Defaults to this Button.

configs.name: tabIndex
configs.doc: Set a DOM tabIndex for this button.

configs.name: text
configs.doc: The button text to be used as innerHTML (html tags are accepted).

configs.name: textAlign
configs.doc: The text alignment for this button (center, left, right).

configs.name: toggleGroup
configs.doc: The group this toggle button is a member of (only 1 per group can be pressed)

configs.name: tooltip
configs.doc: The tooltip for the button - can be a string to be used as innerHTML (html tags are accepted) or QuickTips config object.

configs.name: tooltipType
configs.doc: The type of tooltip to use. Either 'qtip' for QuickTips or 'title' for title attribute.

configs.name: type
configs.doc: The type of <input> to create: submit, reset or button.

events.name: click
events.doc: Fires when this button is clicked

events.name: menuhide
events.doc: If this button has a menu, this event fires when it is hidden

events.name: menushow
events.doc: If this button has a menu, this event fires when it is shown

events.name: menutriggerout
events.doc: If this button has a menu, this event fires when the mouse leaves the menu triggering element

events.name: menutriggerover
events.doc: If this button has a menu, this event fires when the mouse enters the menu triggering element

events.name: mouseout
events.doc: Fires when the mouse exits the button

events.name: mouseover
events.doc: Fires when the mouse hovers over the button

events.name: toggle
events.doc: Fires when the 'pressed' state of this button changes (only if enableToggle = true)

Ext.button.Cycle.doc: A specialized SplitButton that contains a menu of Ext.menu.CheckItem elements. The button automatically cycles through each menu item on click, raising the button's change event for the active menu item.

configs.name: forceIcon
configs.doc: A css class which sets an image to be used as the static icon for this button. This icon will always be displayed regardless of which item is selected in the dropdown list. This overrides the default behavior of changing the button's icon to match the selected item's icon on change.

configs.name: items
configs.doc: An array of Ext.menu.CheckItem config objects to be used when creating the button's menu items (e.g., {text:'Foo', iconCls:'foo-icon'})

configs.name: prependText
configs.doc: A static string to prepend before the active item's text when displayed as the button's text (only applies when showText = true).

configs.name: showText
configs.doc: True to display the active item's text as the button text. The Button will show its configured text if this config is omitted.

events.name: change
events.doc: Fires after the button's active menu item has changed. Note that if a changeHandler function is set on this CycleButton, it will be called instead on active item change and this change event will not be fired.

Ext.button.Split.doc: A split button that provides a built-in dropdown arrow that can fire an event separately from the default click event of the button.

configs.name: arrowTooltip
configs.doc: The title attribute of the arrow

events.name: arrowclick
events.doc: Fires when this button's arrow is clicked.

Ext.chart.axis.Axis.doc: Defines axis for charts. The axis position, type, style can be configured. The axes are defined in an axes array of configuration objects where the type, field, grid and other configuration options can be set. To know more about how to create a Chart please check the Chart class documentation. Here's an example for the axes part: An example of axis for a series (in this case for an area chart that has multiple layers of yFields) could be:

configs.name: dashSize
configs.doc: The size of the dash marker. Default's 3.

configs.name: grid
configs.doc: The grid configuration enables you to set a background grid for an axis. If set to true on a vertical axis, vertical lines will be drawn. If set to true on a horizontal axis, horizontal lines will be drawn. If both are set, a proper grid with horizontal and vertical lines will be drawn.

configs.name: length
configs.doc: Offset axis position. Default's 0.

configs.name: majorTickSteps
configs.doc: If minimum and maximum are specified it forces the number of major ticks to the specified value.

configs.name: minorTickSteps
configs.doc: The number of small ticks between two major ticks. Default is zero.

configs.name: position
configs.doc: Where to set the axis. Available options are left, bottom, right, top. Default's bottom.

configs.name: title
configs.doc: The title for the Axis

configs.name: width
configs.doc: Offset axis width. Default's 0.

Ext.chart.axis.Category.doc: A type of axis that displays items in categories. This axis is generally used to display categorical information like names of items, month names, quarters, etc. but no quantitative values. For that other type of information Number axis are more suitable.

Ext.chart.axis.Gauge.doc: Gauge Axis is the axis to be used with a Gauge series. The Gauge axis displays numeric data from an interval defined by the minimum, maximum and step configuration properties.

configs.name: margin
configs.doc: The offset positioning of the tick marks and labels in pixels.

configs.name: maximum
configs.doc: The maximum value of the interval to be displayed in the axis.

configs.name: minimum
configs.doc: The minimum value of the interval to be displayed in the axis.

configs.name: steps
configs.doc: The number of steps and tick marks to add to the interval.

configs.name: title
configs.doc: The title for the Axis.

Ext.chart.axis.Numeric.doc: An axis to handle numeric values. This axis is used for quantitative data as opposed to the category axis. You can set mininum and maximum values to the axis so that the values are bound to that. If no values are set, then the scale will auto-adjust to the values.

Ext.chart.axis.Time.doc: A type of axis whose units are measured in time values. Use this axis for listing dates that you will want to group or dynamically change. If you just want to display dates as categories then use the Category class for axis instead.

configs.name: aggregateOp
configs.doc: Aggregation operation when grouping. Possible options are 'sum', 'avg', 'max', 'min'. Default's 'sum'.

configs.name: constrain
configs.doc: If true, the values of the chart will be rendered only if they belong between the fromDate and toDate. If false, the time axis will adapt to the new values by adding/removing steps.

configs.name: dateFormat
configs.doc: Indicates the format the date will be rendered on. For example: 'M d' will render the dates as 'Jan 30', etc. For a list of possible format strings see Date

configs.name: fromDate
configs.doc: The starting date for the time axis.

configs.name: groupBy
configs.doc: Indicates the time unit to use for each step. Can be 'day', 'month', 'year' or a comma-separated combination of all of them. Default's 'year,month,day'.

configs.name: step
configs.doc: An array with two components: The first is the unit of the step (day, month, year, etc). The second one is the number of units for the step (1, 2, etc.). Defaults to [Ext.Date.DAY, 1].

configs.name: toDate
configs.doc: The ending date for the time axis.

Ext.chart.Callout.doc: A mixin providing callout functionality for Ext.chart.series.Series.

Ext.chart.Chart.doc: Charts provide a flexible way to achieve a wide range of data visualization capablitities. Each Chart gets its data directly from a Store, and automatically updates its display whenever data in the Store changes.

configs.name: animate
configs.doc: True for the default animation (easing: 'ease' and duration: 500) or a standard animation config object to be used for default chart animations. Defaults to false.

configs.name: axes
configs.doc: Array of Axis instances or config objects.

configs.name: background
configs.doc: The chart background. This can be a gradient object, image, or color. Defaults to false for no background. For example, if background were to be a color we could set the object as

configs.name: enginePriority
configs.doc: Defines the priority order for which Surface implementation to use. The first one supported by the current environment will be used. Defaults to ['Svg', 'Vml'].

configs.name: gradients
configs.doc: Define a set of gradients that can be used as fill property in sprites.

configs.name: insetPadding
configs.doc: The amount of inset padding in pixels for the chart. Defaults to 10.

configs.name: legend
configs.doc: True for the default legend display or a legend config object. Defaults to false.

configs.name: series
configs.doc: Array of Series instances or config objects.

configs.name: store
configs.doc: The store that supplies data to this chart.

configs.name: theme
configs.doc: The name of the theme to be used. A theme defines the colors and other visual displays of tick marks on axis, text, title text, line colors, marker colors and styles, etc. Possible theme values are 'Base', 'Green', 'Sky', 'Red', 'Purple', 'Blue', 'Yellow' and also six category themes 'Category1' to 'Category6'. Default value is 'Base'.

events.name: beforerefresh
events.doc: Fires before a refresh to the chart data is called. If the beforerefresh handler returns false the refresh action will be cancelled.

events.name: refresh
events.doc: Fires after the chart data has been refreshed.

Ext.chart.Highlight.doc: A mixin providing highlight functionality for Ext.chart.series.Series.

Ext.chart.Label.doc: Labels is a mixin to the Series class. Labels methods are implemented in each of the Series (Pie, Bar, etc) for label creation and placement.

configs.name: label
configs.doc: Object with the following properties: display, color, contrast, field, minMargin, font, orientation, renderer.

Ext.chart.Legend.doc: Defines a legend for a chart's series. The 'chart' member must be set prior to rendering. The legend class displays a list of legend items each of them related with a series being rendered.

configs.name: boxFill
configs.doc: Fill style for the legend box

configs.name: boxStroke
configs.doc: Style of the stroke for the legend box

configs.name: boxStrokeWidth
configs.doc: Width of the stroke for the legend box

configs.name: boxZIndex
configs.doc: Sets the z-index for the legend. Defaults to 100.

configs.name: itemSpacing
configs.doc: Amount of space between legend items

configs.name: labelFont
configs.doc: Font to be used for the legend labels, eg '12px Helvetica'

configs.name: padding
configs.doc: Amount of padding between the legend box's border and its items

configs.name: position
configs.doc: The position of the legend in relation to the chart. One of: top, bottom, left, right, or float. If set to float, then the legend box will be positioned at the point denoted by the x and y parameters.

configs.name: visible
configs.doc: Whether or not the legend should be displayed.

configs.name: x
configs.doc: X-position of the legend box. Used directly if position is set to float, otherwise it will be calculated dynamically.

configs.name: y
configs.doc: Y-position of the legend box. Used directly if position is set to float, otherwise it will be calculated dynamically.

Ext.chart.LegendItem.doc: A single item of a legend (marker plus label)

Ext.chart.Mask.doc: Defines a mask for a chart's series. The 'chart' member must be set prior to rendering.

Ext.chart.series.Area.doc: Creates a Stacked Area Chart. The stacked area chart is useful when displaying multiple aggregated layers of information. As with all other series, the Area Series must be appended in the series Chart array configuration.

configs.name: style
configs.doc: Append styling properties to this object for it to override theme properties.

Ext.chart.series.Bar.doc: Creates a Bar Chart. A Bar Chart is a useful visualization technique to display quantitative information for different categories that can show some progression (or regression) in the dataset.

configs.name: column
configs.doc: Whether to set the visualization as column chart or horizontal bar chart.

configs.name: groupGutter
configs.doc: The gutter space between groups of bars, as a percentage of the bar width

configs.name: gutter
configs.doc: The gutter space between single bars, as a percentage of the bar width

configs.name: style
configs.doc: Style properties that will override the theming series styles.

configs.name: xPadding
configs.doc: Padding between the left/right axes and the bars

configs.name: yPadding
configs.doc: Padding between the top/bottom axes and the bars

Ext.chart.series.Cartesian.doc: Common base class for series implementations which plot values using x/y coordinates.

configs.name: axis
configs.doc: The position of the axis to bind the values to. Possible values are 'left', 'bottom', 'top' and 'right'. You must explicitly set this value to bind the values of the line series to the ones in the axis, otherwise a relative scale will be used.

Ext.chart.series.Column.doc: Creates a Column Chart. Much of the methods are inherited from Bar. A Column Chart is a useful visualization technique to display quantitative information for different categories that can show some progression (or regression) in the data set.

configs.name: xPadding
configs.doc: Padding between the left/right axes and the bars

configs.name: yPadding
configs.doc: Padding between the top/bottom axes and the bars

Ext.chart.series.Gauge.doc: Creates a Gauge Chart. Gauge Charts are used to show progress in a certain variable. There are two ways of using the Gauge chart. One is setting a store element into the Gauge and selecting the field to be used from that store.

configs.name: angleField
configs.doc: The store record field name to be used for the pie angles. The values bound to this field name must be positive real numbers.

configs.name: donut
configs.doc: Use the entire disk or just a fraction of it for the gauge. Default's false.

configs.name: highlightDuration
configs.doc: The duration for the pie slice highlight effect.

configs.name: needle
configs.doc: Use the Gauge Series as an area series or add a needle to it. Default's false.

configs.name: showInLegend
configs.doc: Whether to add the pie chart elements as legend items. Default's false.

configs.name: style
configs.doc: An object containing styles for overriding series styles from Theming.

Ext.chart.series.Line.doc: Creates a Line Chart. A Line Chart is a useful visualization technique to display quantitative information for different categories or other real values (as opposed to the bar chart), that can show some progression (or regression) in the dataset.

configs.name: axis
configs.doc: The position of the axis to bind the values to. Possible values are 'left', 'bottom', 'top' and 'right'. You must explicitly set this value to bind the values of the line series to the ones in the axis, otherwise a relative scale will be used.

configs.name: fill
configs.doc: If true, the area below the line will be filled in using the eefill and opacity config properties. Defaults to false.

configs.name: markerConfig
configs.doc: The display style for the markers. Only used if showMarkers is true. The markerConfig is a configuration object containing the same set of properties defined in the Sprite class.

configs.name: selectionTolerance
configs.doc: The offset distance from the cursor position to the line series to trigger events (then used for highlighting series, etc).

configs.name: showMarkers
configs.doc: Whether markers should be displayed at the data points along the line. If true, then the markerConfig config item will determine the markers' styling.

configs.name: smooth
configs.doc: If set to true or a non-zero number, the line will be smoothed/rounded around its points; otherwise straight line segments will be drawn.

configs.name: style
configs.doc: An object containing style properties for the visualization lines and fill. These styles will override the theme styles.

Ext.chart.series.Pie.doc: Creates a Pie Chart. A Pie Chart is a useful visualization technique to display quantitative information for different categories that also have a meaning as a whole. As with all other series, the Pie Series must be appended in the series Chart array configuration.

configs.name: angleField
configs.doc: The store record field name to be used for the pie angles. The values bound to this field name must be positive real numbers.

configs.name: colorSet
configs.doc: An array of color values which will be used, in order, as the pie slice fill colors.

configs.name: donut
configs.doc: Whether to set the pie chart as donut chart. Default's false. Can be set to a particular percentage to set the radius of the donut chart.

configs.name: highlightDuration
configs.doc: The duration for the pie slice highlight effect.

configs.name: lengthField
configs.doc: The store record field name to be used for the pie slice lengths. The values bound to this field name must be positive real numbers.

configs.name: showInLegend
configs.doc: Whether to add the pie chart elements as legend items. Default's false.

configs.name: style
configs.doc: An object containing styles for overriding series styles from Theming.

Ext.chart.series.Radar.doc: Creates a Radar Chart. A Radar Chart is a useful visualization technique for comparing different quantitative values for a constrained number of categories.

configs.name: style
configs.doc: An object containing styles for overriding series styles from Theming.

Ext.chart.series.Scatter.doc: Creates a Scatter Chart. The scatter plot is useful when trying to display more than two variables in the same visualization. These variables can be mapped into x, y coordinates and also to an element's radius/size, color, etc.

configs.name: axis
configs.doc: The position of the axis to bind the values to. Possible values are 'left', 'bottom', 'top' and 'right'. You must explicitly set this value to bind the values of the line series to the ones in the axis, otherwise a relative scale will be used. If multiple axes are being used, they should both be specified in in the configuration.

configs.name: markerConfig
configs.doc: The display style for the scatter series markers.

configs.name: style
configs.doc: Append styling properties to this object for it to override theme properties.

Ext.chart.series.Series.doc: Series is the abstract class containing the common logic to all chart series. Series includes methods from Labels, Highlights, Tips and Callouts mixins. This class implements the logic of handling mouse events, animating, hiding, showing all elements and returning the color of the series to be used as a legend item.

configs.name: highlight
configs.doc: If set to true it will highlight the markers or the series when hovering with the mouse. This parameter can also be an object with the same style properties you would apply to a Ext.draw.Sprite to apply custom styles to markers and series.

configs.name: listeners
configs.doc: An (optional) object with event callbacks. All event callbacks get the target item as first parameter.

configs.name: shadowAttributes
configs.doc: An array with shadow attributes

configs.name: showInLegend
configs.doc: Whether to show this series in the legend.

configs.name: tips
configs.doc: Add tooltips to the visualization's markers. The options for the tips are the same configuration used with Ext.tip.ToolTip.

configs.name: title
configs.doc: The human-readable name of the series.

configs.name: type
configs.doc: The type of series. Set in subclasses.

events.name: titlechange
events.doc: Fires when the series title is changed via setTitle.

Ext.Class.doc: Handles class creation throughout the framework. This is a low level factory that is used by Ext.ClassManager and generally should not be used directly. If you choose to use Ext.Class you will lose out on the namespace, aliasing and depency loading features made available by Ext.ClassManager. The only time you would use Ext.Class directly is to create an anonymous class.

configs.name: alias
configs.doc: List of short aliases for class names.

configs.name: alternateClassName
configs.doc: Defines alternate names for this class.

configs.name: config
configs.doc: List of configuration options with their default values, for which automatically accessor methods are generated.

configs.name: extend
configs.doc: The parent class that this class extends.

configs.name: inheritableStatics
configs.doc: List of inheritable static methods for this class. Otherwise just like statics but subclasses inherit these methods.

configs.name: mixins
configs.doc: List of classes to mix into this class.

configs.name: override
configs.doc: Defines an override applied to a class. Note that overrides can only be created using Ext.define. Ext.ClassManager.create only creates classes.

configs.name: requires
configs.doc: List of classes that have to be loaded before instantiating this class.

configs.name: singleton
configs.doc: When set to true, the class will be instantiated as singleton.

configs.name: statics
configs.doc: List of static methods for this class.

configs.name: uses
configs.doc: List of classes to load together with this class. These aren't neccessarily loaded before this class is instantiated.

Ext.ClassManager.doc: Ext.ClassManager manages all classes and handles mapping from string class name to actual class objects throughout the whole framework. It is not generally accessed directly, rather through these convenient shorthands:

Ext.Component.doc: Base class for all Ext components. All subclasses of Component may participate in the automated Ext component lifecycle of creation, rendering and destruction which is provided by the Container class.

configs.name: autoScroll
configs.doc: true to use overflow:'auto' on the components layout element and show scroll bars automatically when necessary, false to clip any overflowing content.

configs.name: draggable
configs.doc: Specify as true to make a floating Component draggable using the Component's encapsulating element as the drag handle.

configs.name: floating
configs.doc: Specify as true to float the Component outside of the document flow using CSS absolute positioning.

configs.name: maintainFlex
configs.doc: Only valid when a sibling element of a Splitter within a VBox or HBox layout.

configs.name: resizable
configs.doc: Specify as true to apply a Resizer to this Component after rendering.

configs.name: resizeHandles
configs.doc: A valid Ext.resizer.Resizer handles config string. Only applies when resizable = true.

configs.name: toFrontOnShow
configs.doc: True to automatically call toFront when the show method is called on an already visible, floating component.

Ext.ComponentLoader.doc: This class is used to load content via Ajax into a Ext.Component. In general this class will not be instanced directly, rather a loader configuration will be passed to the constructor of the Ext.Component.

configs.name: loadMask
configs.doc: True or a Ext.LoadMask configuration to enable masking during loading.

configs.name: renderer
configs.doc: The type of content that is to be loaded into, which can be one of 3 types: html, data and component

configs.name: scripts
configs.doc: True to parse any inline script tags in the response. This only used when using the html renderer.

configs.name: target
configs.doc: The target Ext.Component for the loader. If a string is passed it will be looked up via the id.

Ext.ComponentManager.doc: Provides a registry of all Components (instances of Ext.Component or any subclass thereof) on a page so that they can be easily accessed by component id (see get, or the convenience method Ext.getCmp).

Ext.ComponentQuery.doc: Provides searching of Components within Ext.ComponentManager (globally) or a specific Ext.container.Container on the document with a similar syntax to a CSS selector.

Ext.CompositeElement.doc: This class encapsulates a collection of DOM elements, providing methods to filter members, or to perform collective actions upon the whole set.

Ext.CompositeElementLite.doc: This class encapsulates a collection of DOM elements, providing methods to filter members, or to perform collective actions upon the whole set.

Ext.container.AbstractContainer.doc: An abstract base class which provides shared methods for Containers across the Sencha product line.

configs.name: activeItem
configs.doc: A string component id or the numeric index of the component that should be initially activated within the container's layout on render. For example, activeItem: 'item-1' or activeItem: 0 (index 0 = the first item in the container's collection). activeItem only applies to layout styles that can display items one at a time (like Ext.layout.container.Card and Ext.layout.container.Fit).

configs.name: autoDestroy
configs.doc: If true the container will automatically destroy any contained component that is removed from it, else destruction must be handled manually. Defaults to true.

configs.name: bubbleEvents
configs.doc: An array of events that, when fired, should be bubbled to any parent container. See Ext.util.Observable.enableBubble. Defaults to ['add', 'remove'].

configs.name: defaultType
configs.doc: The default xtype of child Components to create in this Container when a child item is specified as a raw configuration object, rather than as an instantiated Component.

configs.name: defaults
configs.doc: This option is a means of applying default settings to all added items whether added through the items config or via the add or insert methods.

configs.name: items
configs.doc: A single item, or an array of child Components to be added to this container

configs.name: layout
configs.doc: Important: In order for child items to be correctly sized and positioned, typically a layout manager must be specified through the layout configuration option.

configs.name: suspendLayout
configs.doc: If true, suspend calls to doLayout. Useful when batching multiple adds to a container and not passing them as multiple arguments or an array.

events.name: add
events.doc: @bubbles Fires after any Ext.Component is added or inserted into the container.

events.name: afterlayout
events.doc: Fires when the components in this container are arranged by the associated layout manager.

events.name: beforeadd
events.doc: Fires before any Ext.Component is added or inserted into the container. A handler can return false to cancel the add.

events.name: beforeremove
events.doc: Fires before any Ext.Component is removed from the container. A handler can return false to cancel the remove.

events.name: remove
events.doc: @bubbles Fires after any Ext.Component is removed from the container.

Ext.container.ButtonGroup.doc: Provides a container for arranging a group of related Buttons in a tabular manner.

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: Defaults to 'x-btn-group'. See Ext.panel.Panel.baseCls.

configs.name: columns
configs.doc: The columns configuration property passed to the configured layout manager. See Ext.layout.container.Table.columns.

configs.name: frame
configs.doc: Defaults to true. See Ext.panel.Panel.frame.

configs.name: layout
configs.doc: Defaults to 'table'. See Ext.container.Container.layout.

Ext.container.Container.doc: Base class for any Ext.Component that may contain other Components. Containers handle the basic behavior of containing items, namely adding, inserting and removing items.

Ext.container.Viewport.doc: A specialized container representing the viewable application area (the browser viewport).

configs.name: allowDomMove
configs.doc: Not applicable.

configs.name: applyTo
configs.doc: Not applicable.

configs.name: autoHeight
configs.doc: Not applicable.

configs.name: autoWidth
configs.doc: Not applicable.

configs.name: deferHeight
configs.doc: Not applicable.

configs.name: height
configs.doc: Not applicable. Sets itself to viewport width.

configs.name: hideParent
configs.doc: Not applicable.

configs.name: monitorResize
configs.doc: Not applicable.

configs.name: renderTo
configs.doc: Not applicable. Always renders to document body.

configs.name: width
configs.doc: Not applicable. Sets itself to viewport height.

Ext.data.AbstractStore.doc: AbstractStore is a superclass of Ext.data.Store and Ext.data.TreeStore. It's never used directly, but offers a set of methods used by both of those subclasses.

configs.name: autoLoad
configs.doc: If data is not specified, and if autoLoad is true or an Object, this store's load method is automatically called after creation. If the value of autoLoad is an Object, this Object will be passed to the store's load method. Defaults to false.

configs.name: autoSync
configs.doc: True to automatically sync the Store with its Proxy after every edit to one of its Records. Defaults to false.

configs.name: fields
configs.doc: This may be used in place of specifying a model configuration. The fields should be a set of Ext.data.Field configuration objects. The store will automatically create a Ext.data.Model with these fields. In general this configuration option should be avoided, it exists for the purposes of backwards compatibility. For anything more complicated, such as specifying a particular id property or assocations, a Ext.data.Model should be defined and specified for the model config.

configs.name: model
configs.doc: Name of the Model associated with this store. The string is used as an argument for Ext.ModelManager.getModel.

configs.name: proxy
configs.doc: The Proxy to use for this Store. This can be either a string, a config object or a Proxy instance - see setProxy for details.

configs.name: storeId
configs.doc: Unique identifier for this store. If present, this Store will be registered with the Ext.data.StoreManager, making it easy to reuse elsewhere. Defaults to undefined.

events.name: add
events.doc: Fired when a Model instance has been added to this Store

events.name: beforeload
events.doc: Fires before a request is made for a new data object. If the beforeload handler returns false the load action will be canceled.

events.name: beforesync
events.doc: Fired before a call to sync is executed. Return false from any listener to cancel the synv

events.name: clear
events.doc: Fired after the removeAll method is called.

events.name: datachanged
events.doc: Fires whenever the records in the Store have changed in some way - this could include adding or removing records, or updating the data in existing records

events.name: load
events.doc: Fires whenever the store reads data from a remote data source.

events.name: remove
events.doc: Fired when a Model instance has been removed from this Store

events.name: update
events.doc: Fires when a Model instance has been updated

events.name: write
events.doc: Fires whenever a successful write has been made via the configured Proxy

Ext.data.ArrayStore.doc: Small helper class to make creating Ext.data.Stores from Array data easier. An ArrayStore will be automatically configured with a Ext.data.reader.Array.

Ext.data.Association.doc: Associations enable you to express relationships between different Models. Let's say we're writing an ecommerce system where Users can make Orders - there's a relationship between these Models that we can express like this:

configs.name: associatedModel
configs.doc: The string name of the model that is being associated with.

configs.name: associationKey
configs.doc: The name of the property in the data to read the association from. Defaults to the name of the associated model.

configs.name: ownerModel
configs.doc: The string name of the model that owns the association.

configs.name: primaryKey
configs.doc: The name of the primary key on the associated model. In general this will be the Ext.data.Model.idProperty of the Model.

configs.name: reader
configs.doc: A special reader to read associated data

Ext.data.Batch.doc: Provides a mechanism to run one or more operations in a given order. Fires the 'operationcomplete' event after the completion of each Operation, and the 'complete' event when all Operations have been successfully executed. Fires an 'exception' event if any of the Operations encounter an exception.

events.name: complete
events.doc: Fired when all operations of this batch have been completed

events.name: exception
events.doc: Fired when a operation encountered an exception

events.name: operationcomplete
events.doc: Fired when each operation of the batch completes

Ext.data.BelongsToAssociation.doc: Represents a many to one association with another model. The owner model is expected to have a foreign key which references the primary key of the associated model:

configs.name: foreignKey
configs.doc: The name of the foreign key on the owner model that links it to the associated model. Defaults to the lowercased name of the associated model plus _id, e.g. an association with a model called Product would set up a product_id foreign key.

configs.name: getterName
configs.doc: The name of the getter function that will be added to the local model's prototype. Defaults to 'get' + the name of the foreign model, e.g. getCategory

configs.name: setterName
configs.doc: The name of the setter function that will be added to the local model's prototype. Defaults to 'set' + the name of the foreign model, e.g. setCategory

configs.name: type
configs.doc: The type configuration can be used when creating associations using a configuration object. Use 'belongsTo' to create a HasManyAssocation

Ext.data.Connection.doc: The Connection class encapsulates a connection to the page's originating domain, allowing requests to be made either to a configured URL, or to a URL specified at request time.

configs.name: cors
configs.doc: True to enable CORS support on the XHR object. Currently the only effect of this option is to use the XDomainRequest object instead of XMLHttpRequest if the browser is IE8 or above.

configs.name: disableCaching
configs.doc: True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests.

configs.name: disableCachingParam
configs.doc: Change the parameter which is sent went disabling caching through a cache buster.

configs.name: extraParams
configs.doc: Any parameters to be appended to the request.

configs.name: timeout
configs.doc: The timeout in milliseconds to be used for requests.

configs.name: withCredentials
configs.doc: True to set withCredentials = true on the XHR object

events.name: beforerequest
events.doc: Fires before a network request is made to retrieve a data object.

events.name: requestcomplete
events.doc: Fires if the request was successfully completed.

events.name: requestexception
events.doc: Fires if an error HTTP status was returned from the server. See HTTP Status Code Definitions for details of HTTP status codes.

Ext.data.DirectStore.doc: Small helper class to create an Ext.data.Store configured with an Ext.data.proxy.Direct and Ext.data.reader.Json to make interacting with an Ext.direct.Manager server-side Provider easier.

Ext.data.Errors.doc: Wraps a collection of validation error responses and provides convenient functions for accessing and errors for specific fields.

Ext.data.Field.doc: Fields are used to define what a Model is. They aren't instantiated directly - instead, when we create a class that extends Ext.data.Model, it will automatically create a Field instance for each field configured in a Model.

configs.name: allowBlank
configs.doc: Used for validating a model. Defaults to true. An empty value here will cause Ext.data.Model.isValid to evaluate to false.

configs.name: dateFormat
configs.doc: Used when converting received data into a Date when the type is specified as date.

configs.name: defaultValue
configs.doc: The default value used when a Model is being created by a Reader when the item referenced by the mapping does not exist in the data object (i.e. undefined). Defaults to .

configs.name: mapping
configs.doc: (Optional) A path expression for use by the Ext.data.reader.Reader implementation that is creating the Model to extract the Field value from the data object. If the path expression is the same as the field name, the mapping may be omitted.

configs.name: name
configs.doc: The name by which the field is referenced within the Model. This is referenced by, for example, the dataIndex property in column definition objects passed to Ext.grid.property.HeaderContainer.

configs.name: persist
configs.doc: False to exclude this field from the Ext.data.Model.modified fields in a model. This will also exclude the field from being written using a Ext.data.writer.Writer. This option is useful when model fields are used to keep state on the client but do not need to be persisted to the server. Defaults to true.

configs.name: sortDir
configs.doc: Initial direction to sort (ASC or DESC). Defaults to ASC.

configs.name: type
configs.doc: The data type for automatic conversion from received data to the stored value if convert has not been specified. This may be specified as a string value. Possible values are

configs.name: useNull
configs.doc: Use when converting received data into a Number type (either int or float). If the value cannot be parsed, null will be used if useNull is true, otherwise the value will be 0. Defaults to false.

Ext.data.HasManyAssociation.doc: Represents a one-to-many relationship between two models. Usually created indirectly via a model definition:

configs.name: autoLoad
configs.doc: True to automatically load the related store from a remote source when instantiated. Defaults to false.

configs.name: filterProperty
configs.doc: Optionally overrides the default filter that is set up on the associated Store. If this is not set, a filter is automatically created which filters the association based on the configured foreignKey. See intro docs for more details. Defaults to undefined

configs.name: foreignKey
configs.doc: The name of the foreign key on the associated model that links it to the owner model. Defaults to the lowercased name of the owner model plus _id, e.g. an association with a where a model called Group hasMany Users would create 'group_id' as the foreign key. When the remote store is loaded, the store is automatically filtered so that only records with a matching foreign key are included in the resulting child store. This can be overridden by specifying the filterProperty.

configs.name: name
configs.doc: The name of the function to create on the owner model to retrieve the child store. If not specified, the pluralized name of the child model is used.

configs.name: storeConfig
configs.doc: Optional configuration object that will be passed to the generated Store. Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: type
configs.doc: The type configuration can be used when creating associations using a configuration object. Use 'hasMany' to create a HasManyAssocation

Ext.data.IdGenerator.doc: This class is a base for all id generators. It also provides lookup of id generators by their id.

configs.name: id
configs.doc: The id by which to register a new instance. This instance can be found using the get static method.

Ext.data.JsonP.doc: This class is used to create JSONP requests. JSONP is a mechanism that allows for making requests for data cross domain. More information is available here.

Ext.data.JsonPStore.doc: Small helper class to make creating Ext.data.Stores from different domain JSON data easier. A JsonPStore will be automatically configured with a Ext.data.reader.Json and a JsonPProxy.

Ext.data.Model.doc: A Model represents some object that your application manages. For example, one might define a Model for Users, Products, Cars, or any other real-world object that we want to model in the system.

configs.name: associations
configs.doc: An array of associations for this model.

configs.name: belongsTo
configs.doc: One or more BelongsTo associations for this model.

configs.name: defaultProxyType
configs.doc: The string type of the default Model Proxy. Defaults to 'ajax'.

configs.name: fields
configs.doc: The fields for this model.

configs.name: hasMany
configs.doc: One or more HasMany associations for this model.

configs.name: idProperty
configs.doc: The name of the field treated as this Model's unique id. Defaults to 'id'.

configs.name: idgen
configs.doc: The id generator to use for this model. The default id generator does not generate values for the idProperty.

configs.name: persistenceProperty
configs.doc: The property on this Persistable object that its data is saved to. Defaults to 'data' (e.g. all persistable data resides in this.data.)

configs.name: proxy
configs.doc: The proxy to use for this model.

configs.name: validations
configs.doc: An array of validations for this model.

Ext.data.NodeInterface.doc: This class is used as a set of methods that are applied to the prototype of a Model to decorate it with a Node API. This means that models used in conjunction with a tree will have all of the tree related methods available on the model. In general this class will not be used directly by the developer. This class also creates extra fields on the model if they do not exist, to help maintain the tree state and UI. These fields are documented as config options.

configs.name: allowDrag
configs.doc: Set to false to deny dragging of this node.

configs.name: allowDrop
configs.doc: Set to false to deny dropping on this node.

configs.name: checked
configs.doc: Set to true or false to show a checkbox alongside this node.

configs.name: children
configs.doc: Array of child nodes.

configs.name: cls
configs.doc: CSS class to apply for this node.

configs.name: depth
configs.doc: The number of parents this node has. A root node has depth 0, a child of it depth 1, and so on...

configs.name: expandable
configs.doc: Set to true to allow for expanding/collapsing of this node.

configs.name: expanded
configs.doc: True if the node is expanded.

configs.name: href
configs.doc: An URL for a link that's created when this config is specified.

configs.name: hrefTarget
configs.doc: Target for link. Only applicable when href also specified.

configs.name: icon
configs.doc: URL for this node's icon.

configs.name: iconCls
configs.doc: CSS class to apply for this node's icon.

configs.name: index
configs.doc: The position of the node inside its parent. When parent has 4 children and the node is third amongst them, index will be 2.

configs.name: isFirst
configs.doc: True if this is the first node.

configs.name: isLast
configs.doc: True if this is the last node.

configs.name: leaf
configs.doc: Set to true to indicate that this child can have no children. The expand icon/arrow will then not be rendered for this node.

configs.name: loaded
configs.doc: True if the node has finished loading.

configs.name: loading
configs.doc: True if the node is currently loading.

configs.name: parentId
configs.doc: ID of parent node.

configs.name: qtip
configs.doc: Tooltip text to show on this node.

configs.name: qtitle
configs.doc: Tooltip title.

configs.name: root
configs.doc: True if this is the root node.

configs.name: text
configs.doc: The text for to show on node label.

events.name: append
events.doc: Fires when a new child node is appended

events.name: beforeappend
events.doc: Fires before a new child is appended, return false to cancel the append.

events.name: beforecollapse
events.doc: Fires before this node is collapsed.

events.name: beforeexpand
events.doc: Fires before this node is expanded.

events.name: beforeinsert
events.doc: Fires before a new child is inserted, return false to cancel the insert.

events.name: beforemove
events.doc: Fires before this node is moved to a new location in the tree. Return false to cancel the move.

events.name: beforeremove
events.doc: Fires before a child is removed, return false to cancel the remove.

events.name: collapse
events.doc: Fires when this node is collapsed.

events.name: expand
events.doc: Fires when this node is expanded.

events.name: insert
events.doc: Fires when a new child node is inserted.

events.name: move
events.doc: Fires when this node is moved to a new location in the tree

events.name: remove
events.doc: Fires when a child node is removed

events.name: sort
events.doc: Fires when this node's childNodes are sorted.

Ext.data.Operation.doc: Represents a single read or write operation performed by a Proxy. Operation objects are used to enable communication between Stores and Proxies. Application developers should rarely need to interact with Operation objects directly.

configs.name: action
configs.doc: The action being performed by this Operation. Should be one of 'create', 'read', 'update' or 'destroy'.

configs.name: batch
configs.doc: The batch that this Operation is a part of.

configs.name: filters
configs.doc: Optional array of filter objects. Only applies to 'read' actions.

configs.name: group
configs.doc: Optional grouping configuration. Only applies to 'read' actions where grouping is desired.

configs.name: limit
configs.doc: The number of records to load. Used on 'read' actions when paging is being used.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: Scope for the callback function.

configs.name: sorters
configs.doc: Optional array of sorter objects. Only applies to 'read' actions.

configs.name: start
configs.doc: The start index (offset), used in paging when running a 'read' action.

configs.name: synchronous
configs.doc: True if this Operation is to be executed synchronously. This property is inspected by a Batch to see if a series of Operations can be executed in parallel or not.

Ext.data.proxy.Ajax.doc: AjaxProxy is one of the most widely-used ways of getting data into your application. It uses AJAX requests to load data from the server, usually to be placed into a Store.

configs.name: headers
configs.doc: Any headers to add to the Ajax request. Defaults to undefined.

Ext.data.proxy.Client.doc: Base class for any client-side storage. Used as a superclass for Memory and Web Storage proxies. Do not use directly, use one of the subclasses instead.

Ext.data.proxy.Direct.doc: This class is used to send requests to the server using Ext.Direct. When a request is made, the transport mechanism is handed off to the appropriate Provider to complete the call.

configs.name: api
configs.doc: The same as Ext.data.proxy.Server.api, however instead of providing urls, you should provide a direct function call.

configs.name: directFn
configs.doc: Function to call when executing a request. directFn is a simple alternative to defining the api configuration-parameter for Store's which will not implement a full CRUD api. The directFn may also be a string reference to the fully qualified name of the function, for example: 'MyApp.company.GetProfile'. This can be useful when using dynamic loading. The string will be looked up when the proxy is created.

configs.name: extraParams
configs.doc: Extra parameters that will be included on every read request. Individual requests with params of the same name will override these params when they are in conflict.

configs.name: paramOrder
configs.doc: Defaults to undefined. A list of params to be executed server side. Specify the params in the order in which they must be executed on the server-side as either (1) an Array of String values, or (2) a String of params delimited by either whitespace, comma, or pipe.

configs.name: paramsAsHash
configs.doc: Send parameters as a collection of named arguments. Providing a paramOrder nullifies this configuration.

Ext.data.proxy.JsonP.doc: The JsonP proxy is useful when you need to load data from a domain other than the one your application is running on.

configs.name: autoAppendParams
configs.doc: True to automatically append the request's params to the generated url. Defaults to true

configs.name: callbackKey
configs.doc: See Ext.data.JsonP.callbackKey.

configs.name: recordParam
configs.doc: The param name to use when passing records to the server (e.g. 'records=someEncodedRecordString'). Defaults to 'records'

events.name: exception
events.doc: Fires when the server returns an exception

Ext.data.proxy.LocalStorage.doc: The LocalStorageProxy uses the new HTML5 localStorage API to save Model data locally on the client browser. HTML5 localStorage is a key-value store (e.g. cannot save complex objects like JSON)

Ext.data.proxy.Memory.doc: In-memory proxy. This proxy simply uses a local variable for data storage/retrieval, so its contents are lost on every page refresh.

configs.name: data
configs.doc: Optional array of Records to load into the Proxy

Ext.data.proxy.Proxy.doc: Proxies are used by Stores to handle the loading and saving of Model data. Usually developers will not need to create or interact with proxies directly.

configs.name: batchActions
configs.doc: True to batch actions of a particular type when synchronizing the store. Defaults to true.

configs.name: batchOrder
configs.doc: Comma-separated ordering 'create', 'update' and 'destroy' actions when batching. Override this to set a different order for the batched CRUD actions to be executed in. Defaults to 'create,update,destroy'.

configs.name: defaultReaderType
configs.doc: The default registered reader type. Defaults to 'json'.

configs.name: defaultWriterType
configs.doc: The default registered writer type. Defaults to 'json'.

configs.name: model
configs.doc: The name of the Model to tie to this Proxy. Can be either the string name of the Model, or a reference to the Model constructor. Required.

configs.name: reader
configs.doc: The Ext.data.reader.Reader to use to decode the server's response or data read from client. This can either be a Reader instance, a config object or just a valid Reader type name (e.g. 'json', 'xml').

configs.name: writer
configs.doc: The Ext.data.writer.Writer to use to encode any request sent to the server or saved to client. This can either be a Writer instance, a config object or just a valid Writer type name (e.g. 'json', 'xml').

Ext.data.proxy.Rest.doc: The Rest proxy is a specialization of the AjaxProxy which simply maps the four actions (create, read, update and destroy) to RESTful HTTP verbs.

configs.name: appendId
configs.doc: True to automatically append the ID of a Model instance when performing a request based on that single instance. See Rest proxy intro docs for more details. Defaults to true.

configs.name: batchActions
configs.doc: True to batch actions of a particular type when synchronizing the store. Defaults to false.

configs.name: format
configs.doc: Optional data format to send to the server when making any request (e.g. 'json'). See the Rest proxy intro docs for full details. Defaults to undefined.

Ext.data.proxy.Server.doc: ServerProxy is a superclass of JsonPProxy and AjaxProxy, and would not usually be used directly.

configs.name: api
configs.doc: Specific urls to call on CRUD action methods create, read, update and destroy.

configs.name: cacheString
configs.doc: The name of the cache param added to the url when using noCache. Defaults to _dc.

configs.name: directionParam
configs.doc: The name of the direction parameter to send in a request. This is only used when simpleSortMode is set to true. Defaults to 'dir'.

configs.name: extraParams
configs.doc: Extra parameters that will be included on every request. Individual requests with params of the same name will override these params when they are in conflict.

configs.name: filterParam
configs.doc: The name of the 'filter' parameter to send in a request. Defaults to 'filter'. Set this to undefined if you don't want to send a filter parameter.

configs.name: groupParam
configs.doc: The name of the 'group' parameter to send in a request. Defaults to 'group'. Set this to undefined if you don't want to send a group parameter.

configs.name: limitParam
configs.doc: The name of the 'limit' parameter to send in a request. Defaults to 'limit'. Set this to undefined if you don't want to send a limit parameter.

configs.name: noCache
configs.doc: Disable caching by adding a unique parameter name to the request. Set to false to allow caching. Defaults to true.

configs.name: pageParam
configs.doc: The name of the 'page' parameter to send in a request. Defaults to 'page'. Set this to undefined if you don't want to send a page parameter.

configs.name: simpleSortMode
configs.doc: Enabling simpleSortMode in conjunction with remoteSort will only send one sort property and a direction when a remote sort is requested. The directionParam and sortParam will be sent with the property name and either 'ASC' or 'DESC'.

configs.name: sortParam
configs.doc: The name of the 'sort' parameter to send in a request. Defaults to 'sort'. Set this to undefined if you don't want to send a sort parameter.

configs.name: startParam
configs.doc: The name of the 'start' parameter to send in a request. Defaults to 'start'. Set this to undefined if you don't want to send a start parameter.

configs.name: timeout
configs.doc: The number of milliseconds to wait for a response. Defaults to 30000 milliseconds (30 seconds).

configs.name: url
configs.doc: The URL from which to request the data object.

events.name: exception
events.doc: Fires when the server returns an exception

Ext.data.proxy.SessionStorage.doc: Proxy which uses HTML5 session storage as its data storage/retrieval mechanism. A session storage proxy requires a unique ID which is used as a key in which all record data are stored in the session storage object.

Ext.data.proxy.WebStorage.doc: WebStorageProxy is simply a superclass for the LocalStorage and SessionStorage proxies. It uses the new HTML5 key/value client-side storage objects to save model instances for offline use.

configs.name: id
configs.doc: The unique ID used as the key in which all record data are stored in the local storage object.

Ext.data.reader.Array.doc: Data reader class to create an Array of Ext.data.Model objects from an Array. Each element of that Array represents a row of data fields.

Ext.data.reader.Json.doc: The JSON Reader is used by a Proxy to read a server response that is sent back in JSON format.

configs.name: record
configs.doc: The optional location within the JSON response that the record data itself can be found at. See the JsonReader intro docs for more details. This is not often needed.

configs.name: useSimpleAccessors
configs.doc: True to ensure that field names/mappings are treated as literals when reading values. Defalts to false. For example, by default, using the mapping foo.bar.baz will try and read a property foo from the root, then a property bar from foo, then a property baz from bar. Setting the simple accessors to true will read the property with the name foo.bar.baz direct from the root object.

Ext.data.reader.Reader.doc: Readers are used to interpret data to be loaded into a Model instance or a Store - often in response to an AJAX request. In general there is usually no need to create a Reader instance directly, since a Reader is almost always used together with a Proxy, and is configured using the Proxy's reader configuration property:

configs.name: idProperty
configs.doc: Name of the property within a row object that contains a record identifier value. Defaults to The id of the model. If an idProperty is explicitly specified it will override that of the one specified on the model

configs.name: implicitIncludes
configs.doc: True to automatically parse models nested within other models in a response object. See the Ext.data.reader.Reader intro docs for full explanation. Defaults to true.

configs.name: messageProperty
configs.doc: The name of the property which contains a response message. This property is optional.

configs.name: root
configs.doc: The name of the property which contains the Array of row objects. For JSON reader it's dot-separated list of property names. For XML reader it's a CSS selector. For array reader it's not applicable.

configs.name: successProperty
configs.doc: Name of the property from which to retrieve the success attribute. Defaults to success. See Ext.data.proxy.Server.exception for additional information.

configs.name: totalProperty
configs.doc: Name of the property from which to retrieve the total number of records in the dataset. This is only needed if the whole dataset is not passed in one go, but is being paged from the remote server. Defaults to total.

Ext.data.reader.Xml.doc: The XML Reader is used by a Proxy to read a server response that is sent back in XML format. This usually happens as a result of loading a Store.

configs.name: record
configs.doc: The DomQuery path to the repeated element which contains record information.

Ext.data.Request.doc: Simple class that represents a Request that will be made by any Ext.data.proxy.Server subclass. All this class does is standardize the representation of a Request as used by any ServerProxy subclass, it does not contain any actual logic or perform the request itself.

configs.name: action
configs.doc: The name of the action this Request represents. Usually one of 'create', 'read', 'update' or 'destroy'.

configs.name: method
configs.doc: The HTTP method to use on this Request. Should be one of 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT' or 'DELETE'.

configs.name: params
configs.doc: HTTP request params. The Proxy and its Writer have access to and can modify this object.

configs.name: url
configs.doc: The url to access on this Request

Ext.data.ResultSet.doc: Simple wrapper class that represents a set of records returned by a Proxy.

configs.name: count
configs.doc: The number of records in this ResultSet. Note that total may differ from this number.

configs.name: loaded
configs.doc: True if the records have already been loaded. This is only meaningful when dealing with SQL-backed proxies.

configs.name: records
configs.doc: The array of record instances.

configs.name: success
configs.doc: True if the ResultSet loaded successfully, false if any errors were encountered.

configs.name: total
configs.doc: The total number of records reported by the data source. This ResultSet may form a subset of those records (see count).

Ext.data.SequentialIdGenerator.doc: This class is a sequential id generator. A simple use of this class would be like so:

configs.name: prefix
configs.doc: The string to place in front of the sequential number for each generated id. The default is blank.

configs.name: seed
configs.doc: The number at which to start generating sequential id's. The default is 1.

Ext.data.SortTypes.doc: This class defines a series of static methods that are used on a Ext.data.Field for performing sorting. The methods cast the underlying values into a data type that is appropriate for sorting on that particular field. If a Ext.data.Field.type is specified, the sortType will be set to a sane default if the sortType is not explicitly defined on the field. The sortType will make any necessary modifications to the value and return it.

Ext.data.Store.doc: The Store class encapsulates a client side cache of Model objects. Stores load data via a Proxy, and also provide functions for sorting, filtering and querying the model instances contained within it.

configs.name: buffered
configs.doc: Allow the store to buffer and pre-fetch pages of records. This is to be used in conjunction with a view will tell the store to pre-fetch records ahead of a time.

configs.name: clearOnPageLoad
configs.doc: True to empty the store when loading another page via loadPage, nextPage or previousPage. Setting to false keeps existing records, allowing large data sets to be loaded one page at a time but rendered all together.

configs.name: data
configs.doc: Optional array of Model instances or data objects to load locally. See Inline data above for details.

configs.name: pageSize
configs.doc: The number of records considered to form a 'page'. This is used to power the built-in paging using the nextPage and previousPage functions. Defaults to 25.

configs.name: proxy
configs.doc: The Proxy to use for this Store. This can be either a string, a config object or a Proxy instance - see setProxy for details.

configs.name: purgePageCount
configs.doc: The number of pages to keep in the cache before purging additional records. A value of 0 indicates to never purge the prefetched data. This option is only relevant when the buffered option is set to true.

configs.name: remoteFilter
configs.doc: True to defer any filtering operation to the server. If false, filtering is done locally on the client. Defaults to false.

configs.name: remoteGroup
configs.doc: True if the grouping should apply on the server side, false if it is local only. If the grouping is local, it can be applied immediately to the data. If it is remote, then it will simply act as a helper, automatically sending the grouping information to the server.

configs.name: remoteSort
configs.doc: True to defer any sorting operation to the server. If false, sorting is done locally on the client. Defaults to false.

configs.name: sortOnFilter
configs.doc: For local filtering only, causes sort to be called whenever filter is called, causing the sorters to be reapplied after filtering. Defaults to true

events.name: beforeprefetch
events.doc: Fires before a prefetch occurs. Return false to cancel.

events.name: groupchange
events.doc: Fired whenever the grouping in the grid changes

events.name: load
events.doc: Fires whenever records have been prefetched

Ext.data.StoreManager.doc: Contains a collection of all stores that are created that have an identifier. An identifier can be assigned by setting the storeId property. When a store is in the StoreManager, it can be referred to via it's identifier:

Ext.data.Tree.doc: This class is used as a container for a series of nodes. The nodes themselves maintain the relationship between parent/child. The tree itself acts as a manager. It gives functionality to retrieve a node by its identifier: getNodeById.

events.name: append
events.doc: Fires when a new child node is appended

events.name: beforeappend
events.doc: Fires before a new child is appended, return false to cancel the append.

events.name: beforecollapse
events.doc: Fires before this node is collapsed.

events.name: beforeexpand
events.doc: Fires before this node is expanded.

events.name: beforeinsert
events.doc: Fires before a new child is inserted, return false to cancel the insert.

events.name: beforemove
events.doc: Fires before this node is moved to a new location in the tree. Return false to cancel the move.

events.name: beforeremove
events.doc: Fires before a child is removed, return false to cancel the remove.

events.name: collapse
events.doc: Fires when this node is collapsed.

events.name: expand
events.doc: Fires when this node is expanded.

events.name: insert
events.doc: Fires when a new child node is inserted.

events.name: move
