events.doc: Fires when this node is moved to a new location in the tree

events.name: remove
events.doc: Fires when a child node is removed

events.name: rootchange
events.doc: Fires whenever the root node is changed in the tree.

Ext.data.TreeStore.doc: The TreeStore is a store implementation that is backed by by an Ext.data.Tree. It provides convenience methods for loading nodes, as well as the ability to use the hierarchical tree structure combined with a store.

configs.name: clearOnLoad
configs.doc: Remove previously existing child nodes before loading. Default to true.

configs.name: defaultRootId
configs.doc: The default root id. Defaults to 'root'

configs.name: defaultRootProperty
configs.doc: The root property to specify on the reader if one is not explicitly defined.

configs.name: folderSort
configs.doc: Set to true to automatically prepend a leaf sorter. Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: nodeParam
configs.doc: The name of the parameter sent to the server which contains the identifier of the node. Defaults to 'node'.

configs.name: root
configs.doc: The root node for this store.

events.name: append
events.doc: Fires when a new child node is appended

events.name: beforeappend
events.doc: Fires before a new child is appended, return false to cancel the append.

events.name: beforecollapse
events.doc: Fires before this node is collapsed.

events.name: beforeexpand
events.doc: Fires before this node is expanded.

events.name: beforeinsert
events.doc: Fires before a new child is inserted, return false to cancel the insert.

events.name: beforemove
events.doc: Fires before this node is moved to a new location in the tree. Return false to cancel the move.

events.name: beforeremove
events.doc: Fires before a child is removed, return false to cancel the remove.

events.name: collapse
events.doc: Fires when this node is collapsed.

events.name: expand
events.doc: Fires when this node is expanded.

events.name: insert
events.doc: Fires when a new child node is inserted.

events.name: load
events.doc: Fires whenever the store reads data from a remote data source.

events.name: move
events.doc: Fires when this node is moved to a new location in the tree

events.name: remove
events.doc: Fires when a child node is removed

events.name: rootchange
events.doc: Fires whenever the root node is changed in the tree.

events.name: sort
events.doc: Fires when this TreeStore is sorted.

Ext.data.Types.doc:
This is a static class containing the system-supplied data types which may be given to a Field.

The properties in this class are used as type indicators in the Field class, so to test whether a Field is of a certain type, compare the type property against properties of this class.

Ext.data.UuidGenerator.doc: This class generates UUID's according to RFC 4122. This class has a default id property. This means that a single instance is shared unless the id property is overridden.

configs.name: version
configs.doc: The Version of UUID.

Ext.data.validations.doc: This singleton contains a set of validation functions that can be used to validate any type of data. They are most often used in Models, where they are automatically set up and executed.

Ext.data.writer.Json.doc: This class is used to write Ext.data.Model data to the server in a JSON format. The allowSingle configuration can be set to false to force the records to always be encoded in an array, even if there is only a single record being sent.

configs.name: allowSingle
configs.doc: False to ensure that records are always wrapped in an array, even if there is only one record being sent. When there is more than one record, they will always be encoded into an array. Defaults to true.

configs.name: encode
configs.doc: True to use Ext.encode() on the data before sending. Defaults to false. The encode option should only be set to true when a root is defined, because the values will be sent as part of the request parameters as opposed to a raw post. The root will be the name of the parameter sent to the server.

configs.name: root
configs.doc: The key under which the records in this Writer will be placed. Defaults to undefined.

Ext.data.writer.Writer.doc: Base Writer class used by most subclasses of Ext.data.proxy.Server. This class is responsible for taking a set of Ext.data.Operation objects and a Ext.data.Request object and modifying that request based on the Operations.

configs.name: nameProperty
configs.doc: This property is used to read the key for each value that will be sent to the server.

configs.name: writeAllFields
configs.doc: True to write all fields from the record to the server. If set to false it will only send the fields that were modified. Note that any fields that have Ext.data.Field.persist set to false will still be ignored.

Ext.data.writer.Xml.doc: This class is used to write Ext.data.Model data to the server in an XML format. The documentRoot property is used to specify the root element in the XML document.

configs.name: defaultDocumentRoot
configs.doc: The root to be used if documentRoot is empty and a root is required to form a valid XML document.

configs.name: documentRoot
configs.doc: The name of the root element of the document. Defaults to 'xmlData'. If there is more than 1 record and the root is not specified, the default document root will still be used to ensure a valid XML document is created.

configs.name: header
configs.doc: A header to use in the XML document (such as setting the encoding or version). Defaults to ''.

configs.name: record
configs.doc: The name of the node to use for each record. Defaults to 'record'.

Ext.Date.doc: A set of useful static methods to deal with date Note that if Ext.Date is required and loaded, it will copy all methods / properties to this object for convenience

Ext.dd.DD.doc: A DragDrop implementation where the linked element follows the mouse cursor during a drag.

Ext.dd.DDProxy.doc: A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into the document that follows the cursor during drag operations. At the time of the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.

Ext.dd.DDTarget.doc: A DragDrop implementation that does not move, but can be a drop target. You would get the same result by simply omitting implementation for the event callbacks, but this way we reduce the processing cost of the event listener and the callbacks.

Ext.dd.DragDrop.doc: Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets. It was designed to be extended, overriding the event handlers for startDrag, onDrag, onDragOver and onDragOut. Up to three html elements can be associated with a DragDrop instance:

Ext.dd.DragDropManager.doc: DragDropManager is a singleton that tracks the element interaction for all DragDrop items in the window. Generally, you will not call this class directly, but it does have helper methods that could be useful in your DragDrop implementations.

Ext.dd.DragSource.doc: A simple class that provides the basic implementation needed to make any element draggable.

configs.name: animRepair
configs.doc: If true, animates the proxy element back to the position of the handle element used to trigger the drag.

configs.name: ddGroup
configs.doc: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group.

configs.name: dropAllowed
configs.doc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed.

configs.name: dropNotAllowed
configs.doc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed.

configs.name: repairHighlightColor
configs.doc: The color to use when visually highlighting the drag source in the afterRepair method after a failed drop (defaults to light blue). The color must be a 6 digit hex value, without a preceding '#'.

Ext.dd.DragTracker.doc: A DragTracker listens for drag events on an Element and fires events at the start and end of the drag, as well as during the drag. This is useful for components such as Ext.slider.Multi, where there is an element that can be dragged around to change the Slider's value. DragTracker provides a series of template methods that should be overridden to provide functionality in response to detected drag operations. These are onBeforeStart, onStart, onDrag and onEnd. See Ext.slider.Multi's initEvents function for an example implementation.

configs.name: autoStart
configs.doc: Defaults to false. Specify true to defer trigger start by 1000 ms. Specify a Number for the number of milliseconds to defer trigger start.

configs.name: constrainTo
configs.doc: A Region (Or an element from which a Region measurement will be read) which is used to constrain the result of the getOffset call.

configs.name: delegate
configs.doc:
Optional.

A DomQuery selector which identifies child elements within the DragTracker's encapsulating Element which are the tracked elements. This limits tracking to only begin when the matching elements are mousedowned.

configs.name: overCls
configs.doc: A CSS class to add to the DragTracker's target element when the element (or, if the delegate option is used, when a delegate element) is mouseovered.

configs.name: preventDefault
configs.doc: Specify false to enable default actions on onMouseDown events. Defaults to true.

configs.name: stopEvent
configs.doc: Specify true to stop the mousedown event from bubbling to outer listeners from the target element (or its delegates). Defaults to false.

configs.name: tolerance
configs.doc: Number of pixels the drag target must be moved before dragging is considered to have started. Defaults to 5.

configs.name: trackOver
configs.doc: Defaults to false. Set to true to fire mouseover and mouseout events when the mouse enters or leaves the target element.

events.name: beforestart
drag
dragend
dragstart
mousedown
events.doc: Fires when the mouse button is pressed down, but before a drag operation begins. The drag operation begins after either the mouse has been moved by tolerance pixels, or after the autoStart timer fires.

events.name: mousemove
events.doc: Fired when the mouse is moved. Returning false cancels the drag operation.

events.name: mouseout
events.doc: Only available when trackOver is true

events.name: mouseover
events.doc: Only available when trackOver is true

events.name: mouseup

Ext.dd.DragZone.doc: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dragging of multiple child source nodes.

configs.name: containerScroll
configs.doc: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations.

Ext.dd.DropTarget.doc: A simple class that provides the basic implementation needed to make any element a drop target that can have draggable items dropped onto it. The drop has no effect until an implementation of notifyDrop is provided.

configs.name: ddGroup
configs.doc: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group.

configs.name: dropAllowed
configs.doc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed.

configs.name: dropNotAllowed
configs.doc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed.

configs.name: overClass
configs.doc: The CSS class applied to the drop target element while the drag source is over it.

Ext.dd.DropZone.doc: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dropping on multiple child target nodes.

Ext.dd.Registry.doc: Provides easy access to all drag drop components that are registered on a page. Items can be retrieved either directly by DOM node id, or by passing in the drag drop event that occurred and looking up the event target.

Ext.dd.ScrollManager.doc: Provides automatic scrolling of overflow regions in the page during drag operations.

Ext.dd.StatusProxy.doc: A specialized drag proxy that supports a drop status icon, Ext.Layer styles and auto-repair. This is the default drag proxy used by all Ext.dd components.

configs.name: dropAllowed
configs.doc: The CSS class to apply to the status element when drop is allowed.

configs.name: dropNotAllowed
configs.doc: The CSS class to apply to the status element when drop is not allowed.

Ext.direct.Event.doc: A base class for all Ext.direct events. An event is created after some kind of interaction with the server. The event class is essentially just a data structure to hold a Direct response.

Ext.direct.ExceptionEvent.doc: An event that is fired when an exception is received from a Ext.direct.RemotingProvider

Ext.direct.JsonProvider.doc: A base provider for communicating using JSON. This is an abstract class and should not be instanced directly.

Ext.direct.Manager.doc: Ext.Direct aims to streamline communication between the client and server by providing a single interface that reduces the amount of common code typically required to validate data and handle returned data packets (reading data, error conditions, etc).

events.name: event
events.doc: Fires after an event.

events.name: exception
events.doc: Fires after an event exception.

Ext.direct.PollingProvider.doc: Provides for repetitive polling of the server at distinct intervals. The initial request for data originates from the client, and then is responded to by the server.

configs.name: baseParams
configs.doc: An object containing properties which are to be sent as parameters on every polling request

configs.name: interval
configs.doc: How often to poll the server-side in milliseconds. Defaults to every 3 seconds.

configs.name: url
configs.doc: The url which the PollingProvider should contact with each request. This can also be an imported Ext.Direct method which will accept the baseParams as its only argument.

events.name: beforepoll
events.doc: Fired immediately before a poll takes place, an event handler can return false in order to cancel the poll.

events.name: poll
events.doc: This event has not yet been implemented.

Ext.direct.Provider.doc: Ext.direct.Provider is an abstract class meant to be extended.

configs.name: id
configs.doc: The unique id of the provider (defaults to an auto-assigned id). You should assign an id if you need to be able to access the provider later and you do not have an object reference available,

events.name: connect
events.doc: Fires when the Provider connects to the server-side

events.name: data
events.doc: Fires when the Provider receives data from the server-side

events.name: disconnect
events.doc: Fires when the Provider disconnects from the server-side

events.name: exception
events.doc: Fires when the Provider receives an exception from the server-side

Ext.direct.RemotingEvent.doc: An event that is fired when data is received from a Ext.direct.RemotingProvider. Contains a method to the related transaction for the direct request, see getTransaction

Ext.direct.RemotingProvider.doc: The RemotingProvider exposes access to server side methods on the client (a remote procedure call (RPC) type of connection where the client can initiate a procedure on the server).

configs.name: actions
configs.doc: Object literal defining the server side actions and methods.

configs.name: enableBuffer
configs.doc: true or false to enable or disable combining of method calls. If a number is specified this is the amount of time in milliseconds to wait before sending a batched request.

configs.name: enableUrlEncode
configs.doc: Specify which param will hold the arguments for the method. Defaults to 'data'.

configs.name: maxRetries
configs.doc: Number of times to re-attempt delivery on failure of a call.

configs.name: namespace
configs.doc: Namespace for the Remoting Provider (defaults to the browser global scope of window). Explicitly specify the namespace Object, or specify a String to have a namespace created implicitly.

configs.name: timeout
configs.doc: The timeout to use for each request.

configs.name: url
configs.doc: Required. The url to connect to the Ext.direct.Manager server-side router.

events.name: beforecall
events.doc: Fires immediately before the client-side sends off the RPC call. By returning false from an event handler you can prevent the call from executing.

events.name: call
events.doc: Fires immediately after the request to the server-side is sent. This does NOT fire after the response has come back from the call.

Ext.direct.Transaction.doc: Supporting Class for Ext.Direct (not intended to be used directly).

Ext.DomHelper.doc: The DomHelper class provides a layer of abstraction from DOM and transparently supports creating elements via DOM or using HTML fragments. It also has the ability to create HTML fragment templates from your DOM building code.

Ext.DomQuery.doc: Provides high performance selector/xpath processing by compiling queries into reusable functions. New pseudo classes and matchers can be plugged. It works on HTML and XML documents (if a content node is passed in).

Ext.draw.Color.doc: Represents an RGB color and provides helper functions get color components in HSL color space.

configs.name: lightnessFactor
configs.doc: The default factor to compute the lighter or darker color. Defaults to 0.2.

Ext.draw.Component.doc: The Draw Component is a surface in which sprites can be rendered. The Draw Component manages and holds a Surface instance: an interface that has an SVG or VML implementation depending on the browser capabilities and where Sprites can be appended.

configs.name: autoSize
configs.doc: Turn on autoSize support which will set the bounding div's size to the natural size of the contents. Defaults to false.

configs.name: enginePriority
configs.doc: Defines the priority order for which Surface implementation to use. The first one supported by the current environment will be used.

configs.name: gradients
configs.doc: (optional) Define a set of gradients that can be used as fill property in sprites.

configs.name: viewBox
configs.doc: Turn on view box support which will scale and position items in the draw component to fit to the component while maintaining aspect ratio. Note that this scaling can override other sizing settings on yor items. Defaults to true.

Ext.draw.CompositeSprite.doc: A composite Sprite handles a group of sprites with common methods to a sprite such as hide, show, setAttributes. These methods are applied to the set of sprites added to the group.

Ext.draw.Draw.doc: Base Drawing class. Provides base drawing functions.

Ext.draw.engine.Svg.doc: Provides specific methods to draw with SVG.

Ext.draw.engine.Vml.doc: Provides specific methods to draw with VML.

Ext.draw.Sprite.doc: A Sprite is an object rendered in a Drawing surface.

configs.name: draggable
configs.doc: True to make the sprite draggable.

configs.name: fill
configs.doc: The fill color

configs.name: font
configs.doc: Used with text type sprites. The full font description. Uses the same syntax as the CSS font parameter

configs.name: group
configs.doc: The group that this sprite belongs to, or an array of groups. Only relevant when added to a Ext.draw.Surface

configs.name: height
configs.doc: Used in rectangle sprites, the height of the rectangle

configs.name: opacity
configs.doc: The opacity of the sprite

configs.name: path
configs.doc: Used in path sprites, the path of the sprite written in SVG-like path syntax

configs.name: radius
configs.doc: Used in circle sprites, the radius of the circle

configs.name: size
configs.doc: Used in square sprites, the dimension of the square

configs.name: stroke
configs.doc: The stroke color

configs.name: stroke-width
configs.doc: The width of the stroke

configs.name: text
configs.doc: Used with text type sprites. The text itself

configs.name: type
configs.doc: The type of the sprite. Possible options are 'circle', 'path', 'rect', 'text', 'square', 'image'

configs.name: width
configs.doc: Used in rectangle sprites, the width of the rectangle

configs.name: x
configs.doc: The position along the x-axis

configs.name: y
configs.doc: The position along the y-axis

Ext.draw.Surface.doc: A Surface is an interface to render methods inside a draw Ext.draw.Component. A Surface contains methods to render sprites, get bounding boxes of sprites, add sprites to the canvas, initialize other graphic components, etc. One of the most used methods for this class is the add method, to add Sprites to the surface.

configs.name: height
configs.doc: The height of this component in pixels (defaults to auto).

configs.name: width
configs.doc: The width of this component in pixels (defaults to auto).

Ext.Editor.doc:
The Editor class is used to provide inline editing for elements on the page. The editor is backed by a Ext.form.field.Field that will be displayed to edit the underlying content. The editor is a floating Component, when the editor is shown it is automatically aligned to display over the top of the bound element it is editing. The Editor contains several options for how to handle key presses:

  • completeOnEnter
  • cancelOnEsc
  • swallowKeys
It also has options for how to use the value once the editor has been activated:
  • revertInvalid
  • ignoreNoChange
  • updateEl
Sample usage:

configs.name: alignment
configs.doc: The position to align to (see Ext.Element.alignTo for more details).

configs.name: allowBlur
configs.doc: True to complete the editing process if in edit mode when the field is blurred.

configs.name: autoSize
configs.doc: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

configs.name: cancelOnEsc
configs.doc: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed.

configs.name: completeOnEnter
configs.doc: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed.

configs.name: constrain
configs.doc: True to constrain the editor to the viewport

configs.name: field
configs.doc: The Field object (or descendant) or config object for field

configs.name: hideEl
configs.doc: False to keep the bound element visible while the editor is displayed

configs.name: ignoreNoChange
configs.doc: True to skip the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and the value has not changed. Applies only to string values - edits for other data types will never be ignored.

configs.name: offsets
configs.doc: The offsets to use when aligning (see Ext.Element.alignTo for more details.

configs.name: parentEl
configs.doc: An element to render to. Defaults to the document.body.

configs.name: revertInvalid
configs.doc: True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field validation fails

configs.name: shadow
configs.doc: sides for sides/bottom only, frame for 4-way shadow, and drop for bottom-right shadow.

configs.name: swallowKeys
configs.doc: Handle the keydown/keypress events so they don't propagate

configs.name: updateEl
configs.doc: True to update the innerHTML of the bound element when the update completes

configs.name: value
configs.doc: The data value of the underlying field

events.name: beforecomplete
events.doc: Fires after a change has been made to the field, but before the change is reflected in the underlying field. Saving the change to the field can be canceled by returning false from the handler of this event. Note that if the value has not changed and ignoreNoChange = true, the editing will still end but this event will not fire since no edit actually occurred.

events.name: beforestartedit
events.doc: Fires when editing is initiated, but before the value changes. Editing can be canceled by returning false from the handler of this event.

events.name: canceledit
events.doc: Fires after editing has been canceled and the editor's value has been reset.

events.name: complete
events.doc: Fires after editing is complete and any changed value has been written to the underlying field.

events.name: specialkey
events.doc: Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed. You can check Ext.EventObject.getKey to determine which key was pressed.

events.name: startedit
events.doc: Fires when this editor is displayed

Ext.Element.doc: Encapsulates a DOM element, adding simple DOM manipulation facilities, normalizing for browser differences.

events.name: DOMActivate
events.doc: Where supported. Fires when an element is activated, for instance, through a mouse click or a keypress.

events.name: DOMAttrModified
events.doc: Where supported. Fires when an attribute has been modified.

events.name: DOMCharacterDataModified
events.doc: Where supported. Fires when the character data has been modified.

events.name: DOMFocusIn
events.doc: Where supported. Similar to HTML focus event, but can be applied to any focusable element.

events.name: DOMFocusOut
events.doc: Where supported. Similar to HTML blur event, but can be applied to any focusable element.

events.name: DOMNodeInserted
events.doc: Where supported. Fires when a node has been added as a child of another node.

events.name: DOMNodeInsertedIntoDocument
events.doc: Where supported. Fires when a node is being inserted into a document.

events.name: DOMNodeRemoved
events.doc: Where supported. Fires when a descendant node of the element is removed.

events.name: DOMNodeRemovedFromDocument
events.doc: Where supported. Fires when a node is being removed from a document.

events.name: DOMSubtreeModified
events.doc: Where supported. Fires when the subtree is modified.

events.name: abort
events.doc: Fires when an object/image is stopped from loading before completely loaded.

events.name: blur
events.doc: Fires when an element loses focus either via the pointing device or by tabbing navigation.

events.name: change
events.doc: Fires when a control loses the input focus and its value has been modified since gaining focus.

events.name: click
events.doc: Fires when a mouse click is detected within the element.

events.name: contextmenu
events.doc: Fires when a right click is detected within the element.

events.name: dblclick
events.doc: Fires when a mouse double click is detected within the element.

events.name: error
events.doc: Fires when an object/image/frame cannot be loaded properly.

events.name: focus
events.doc: Fires when an element receives focus either via the pointing device or by tab navigation.

events.name: keydown
events.doc: Fires when a keydown is detected within the element.

events.name: keypress
events.doc: Fires when a keypress is detected within the element.

events.name: keyup
events.doc: Fires when a keyup is detected within the element.

events.name: load
events.doc: Fires when the user agent finishes loading all content within the element. Only supported by window, frames, objects and images.

events.name: mousedown
events.doc: Fires when a mousedown is detected within the element.

events.name: mouseenter
events.doc: Fires when the mouse enters the element.

events.name: mouseleave
events.doc: Fires when the mouse leaves the element.

events.name: mousemove
events.doc: Fires when a mousemove is detected with the element.

events.name: mouseout
events.doc: Fires when a mouseout is detected with the element.

events.name: mouseover
events.doc: Fires when a mouseover is detected within the element.

events.name: mouseup
events.doc: Fires when a mouseup is detected within the element.

events.name: reset
events.doc: Fires when a form is reset.

events.name: resize
events.doc: Fires when a document view is resized.

events.name: scroll
events.doc: Fires when a document view is scrolled.

events.name: select
events.doc: Fires when a user selects some text in a text field, including input and textarea.

events.name: submit
events.doc: Fires when a form is submitted.

events.name: unload
events.doc: Fires when the user agent removes all content from a window or frame. For elements, it fires when the target element or any of its content has been removed.

Ext.ElementLoader.doc: A class used to load remote content to an Element. Sample usage:

configs.name: ajaxOptions
configs.doc: Any additional options to be passed to the request, for example timeout or headers.

configs.name: autoLoad
configs.doc: True to have the loader make a request as soon as it is created. This argument can also be a set of options that will be passed to load is called.

configs.name: baseParams
configs.doc: Params that will be attached to every request. These parameters will not be overridden by any params in the load options.

configs.name: loadMask
configs.doc: True or a string to show when the element is loading.

configs.name: params
configs.doc: Any params to be attached to the Ajax request. These parameters will be overridden by any params in the load options.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope to execute the success and failure functions in.

configs.name: scripts
configs.doc: True to parse any inline script tags in the response.

configs.name: target
configs.doc: The target element for the loader. It can be the DOM element, the id or an Ext.Element.

configs.name: url
configs.doc: The url to retrieve the content from.

events.name: beforeload
events.doc: Fires before a load request is made to the server. Returning false from an event listener can prevent the load from occurring.

events.name: exception
events.doc: Fires after an unsuccessful load.

events.name: load
events.doc: Fires after a successful load.

Ext.env.Browser.doc: Provides useful information about the current browser. Should not be manually instantiated unless for unit-testing; access the global instance stored in Ext.browser instead. Example:

Ext.env.FeatureDetector.doc: Provides useful information about the current browser features. Don't instantiate directly, but use the Ext.features property instead.

Ext.env.OS.doc: Provides useful information about the current operating system environment. Access the global instance stored in Ext.os. Example:

Ext.Error.doc: A wrapper class for the native JavaScript Error object that adds a few useful capabilities for handling errors in an Ext application. When you use Ext.Error to raise an error from within any class that uses the Ext 4 class system, the Error class can automatically add the source class and method from which the error was raised. It also includes logic to automatically log the eroor to the console, if available, with additional metadata about the error. In all cases, the error will always be thrown at the end so that execution will halt.

Ext.EventManager.doc: Registers event handlers that want to receive a normalized EventObject instead of the standard browser event and provides several useful events directly. See Ext.EventObject for more details on normalized event objects.

Ext.EventObject.doc: Just as Ext.Element wraps around a native DOM node, Ext.EventObject wraps the browser's native event-object normalizing cross-browser differences, such as which mouse button is clicked, keys pressed, mechanisms to stop event-propagation along with a method to prevent default actions from taking place.

Ext.flash.Component.doc: A simple Component for displaying an Adobe Flash SWF movie. The movie will be sized and can participate in layout like any other Component.

configs.name: backgroundColor
configs.doc: The background color of the SWF movie. Defaults to '#ffffff'.

configs.name: expressInstall
configs.doc: True to prompt the user to install flash if not installed. Note that this uses Ext.FlashComponent.EXPRESS_INSTALL_URL, which should be set to the local resource. Defaults to false.

configs.name: flashAttributes
configs.doc: A set of key value pairs to be passed to the flash object as attributes. Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: flashParams
configs.doc: A set of key value pairs to be passed to the flash object as parameters. Possible parameters can be found here: http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/127/tn_12701.html Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: flashVars
configs.doc: A set of key value pairs to be passed to the flash object as flash variables. Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: flashVersion
configs.doc: Indicates the version the flash content was published for. Defaults to '9.0.115'.

configs.name: swfHeight
configs.doc: The height of the embedded SWF movie inside the component. Defaults to 100% so that the movie matches the height of the component.

configs.name: swfWidth
configs.doc: The width of the embedded SWF movie inside the component. Defaults to 100% so that the movie matches the width of the component.

configs.name: url
configs.doc: The URL of the SWF file to include. Required.

configs.name: wmode
configs.doc: The wmode of the flash object. This can be used to control layering. Defaults to 'opaque'. Set to 'transparent' to ignore the backgroundColor and make the background of the Flash movie transparent.

events.name: failure
events.doc: Fired when the Flash movie embedding fails

events.name: success
events.doc: Fired when the Flash movie has been successfully embedded

events.name: beforecomponentfocus
events.doc: Fires before a component becomes focused. Return false to prevent the component from gaining focus.

events.name: componentfocus
events.doc: Fires after a component becomes focused.

events.name: disable
events.doc: Fires when the FocusManager is disabled

events.name: enable
events.doc: Fires when the FocusManager is enabled

Ext.form.action.Action.doc: The subclasses of this class provide actions to perform upon Forms.

configs.name: form
configs.doc: The BasicForm instance that is invoking this Action. Required.

configs.name: headers
configs.doc: Extra headers to be sent in the AJAX request for submit and load actions. See Ext.data.proxy.Ajax.headers.

configs.name: method
configs.doc: The HTTP method to use to access the requested URL. Defaults to the BasicForm's method, or 'POST' if not specified.

configs.name: params
configs.doc: Extra parameter values to pass. These are added to the Form's Ext.form.Basic.baseParams and passed to the specified URL along with the Form's input fields.

configs.name: reset
configs.doc: When set to true, causes the Form to be reset on Action success. If specified, this happens before the success callback is called and before the Form's actioncomplete event fires.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope in which to call the configured success and failure callback functions (the this reference for the callback functions).

configs.name: submitEmptyText
configs.doc: If set to true, the emptyText value will be sent with the form when it is submitted. Defaults to true.

configs.name: timeout
configs.doc: The number of seconds to wait for a server response before failing with the failureType as CONNECT_FAILURE. If not specified, defaults to the configured timeout of the form.

configs.name: url
configs.doc: The URL that the Action is to invoke. Will default to the url configured on the form.

configs.name: waitMsg
configs.doc: The message to be displayed by a call to Ext.window.MessageBox.wait during the time the action is being processed.

configs.name: waitTitle
configs.doc: The title to be displayed by a call to Ext.window.MessageBox.wait during the time the action is being processed.

Ext.form.action.DirectLoad.doc: Provides Ext.direct.Manager support for loading form data.

Ext.form.action.DirectSubmit.doc: Provides Ext.direct support for submitting form data.

Ext.form.action.Load.doc: A class which handles loading of data from a server into the Fields of an Ext.form.Basic.

Ext.form.action.StandardSubmit.doc: A class which handles submission of data from Forms using a standard <form> element submit. It does not handle the response from the submit.

configs.name: target
configs.doc: Optional target attribute to be used for the form when submitting. If not specified, the target will be the current window/frame.

Ext.form.action.Submit.doc: A class which handles submission of data from Forms and processes the returned response.

configs.name: clientValidation
configs.doc: Determines whether a Form's fields are validated in a final call to isValid prior to submission. Pass false in the Form's submit options to prevent this. Defaults to true.

Ext.form.Basic.doc: Provides input field management, validation, submission, and form loading services for the collection of Field instances within a Ext.container.Container. It is recommended that you use a Ext.form.Panel as the form container, as that has logic to automatically hook up an instance of Ext.form.Basic (plus other conveniences related to field configuration.)

configs.name: api
configs.doc: (Optional) If specified, load and submit actions will be handled with Ext.form.action.DirectLoad and Ext.form.action.DirectLoad. Methods which have been imported by Ext.direct.

configs.name: baseParams
configs.doc: Parameters to pass with all requests. e.g. baseParams: {id: '123', foo: 'bar'}.

configs.name: errorReader
configs.doc: An Ext.data.DataReader (e.g. Ext.data.reader.Xml) to be used to read field error messages returned from 'submit' actions. This is optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON responses.

configs.name: method
configs.doc: The request method to use (GET or POST) for form actions if one isn't supplied in the action options.

configs.name: paramOrder
configs.doc: A list of params to be executed server side. Defaults to undefined. Only used for the api load configuration.

configs.name: paramsAsHash
configs.doc: Only used for the api load configuration. If true, parameters will be sent as a single hash collection of named arguments. Providing a paramOrder nullifies this configuration.

configs.name: reader
configs.doc: An Ext.data.DataReader (e.g. Ext.data.reader.Xml) to be used to read data when executing 'load' actions. This is optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON responses.

configs.name: standardSubmit
configs.doc: If set to true, a standard HTML form submit is used instead of a XHR (Ajax) style form submission. All of the field values, plus any additional params configured via baseParams and/or the options to submit, will be included in the values submitted in the form.

configs.name: timeout
configs.doc: Timeout for form actions in seconds (default is 30 seconds).

configs.name: trackResetOnLoad
configs.doc: If set to true, reset() resets to the last loaded or setValues() data instead of when the form was first created.

configs.name: url
configs.doc: The URL to use for form actions if one isn't supplied in the doAction options.

configs.name: waitMsgTarget
configs.doc: By default wait messages are displayed with Ext.MessageBox.wait. You can target a specific element by passing it or its id or mask the form itself by passing in true.

configs.name: waitTitle
configs.doc: The default title to show for the waiting message box

events.name: actioncomplete
events.doc: Fires when an action is completed.

events.name: actionfailed
events.doc: Fires when an action fails.

events.name: beforeaction
events.doc: Fires before any action is performed. Return false to cancel the action.

events.name: dirtychange
events.doc: Fires when the dirty state of the entire form changes.

events.name: validitychange
events.doc: Fires when the validity of the entire form changes.

Ext.form.CheckboxGroup.doc: A field container which has a specialized layout for arranging Ext.form.field.Checkbox controls into columns, and provides convenience Ext.form.field.Field methods for getting, setting, and validating the group of checkboxes as a whole.

configs.name: allowBlank
configs.doc: False to validate that at least one item in the group is checked. If no items are selected at validation time, blankText will be used as the error text.

configs.name: blankText
configs.doc: Error text to display if the allowBlank validation fails
configs.default: You must select at least one item in this group

configs.name: columns
configs.doc: Specifies the number of columns to use when displaying grouped checkbox/radio controls using automatic layout.

configs.name: fieldBodyCls
configs.doc: An extra CSS class to be applied to the body content element in addition to baseBodyCls. Defaults to 'x-form-checkboxgroup-body'.

configs.name: items
configs.doc: An Array of Checkboxes or Checkbox config objects to arrange in the group.

configs.name: vertical
configs.doc: True to distribute contained controls across columns, completely filling each column top to bottom before starting on the next column. The number of controls in each column will be automatically calculated to keep columns as even as possible. The default value is false, so that controls will be added to columns one at a time, completely filling each row left to right before starting on the next row.

Ext.form.CheckboxManager.doc: Private utility class for managing all Ext.form.field.Checkbox fields grouped by name.

Ext.form.field.Base.doc: Base class for form fields that provides default event handling, rendering, and other common functionality needed by all form field types. Utilizes the Ext.form.field.Field mixin for value handling and validation, and the Ext.form.Labelable mixin to provide label and error message display.

configs.name: checkChangeBuffer
configs.doc: Defines a timeout in milliseconds for buffering checkChangeEvents that fire in rapid succession. Defaults to 50 milliseconds.

configs.name: checkChangeEvents
configs.doc: A list of event names that will be listened for on the field's input element, which will cause the field's value to be checked for changes. If a change is detected, the change event will be fired, followed by validation if the validateOnChange option is enabled.

configs.name: dirtyCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to use when the field value is dirty.

configs.name: fieldCls
configs.doc: The default CSS class for the field input

configs.name: fieldStyle
configs.doc: Optional CSS style(s) to be applied to the field input element. Should be a valid argument to Ext.Element.applyStyles. Defaults to undefined. See also the setFieldStyle method for changing the style after initialization.

configs.name: fieldSubTpl
configs.doc: The content of the field body is defined by this config option.
configs.default: [<input id={id} type={type} , <tpl if=name>name={name} </tpl>, <tpl if=size>size={size} </tpl>, <tpl if=tabIdx>tabIndex={tabIdx} </tpl>, class={fieldCls} {typeCls} autocomplete=off />, {compiled: true, disableFormats: true}]

configs.name: focusCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus

configs.name: inputId
configs.doc: The id that will be given to the generated input DOM element. Defaults to an automatically generated id. If you configure this manually, you must make sure it is unique in the document.

configs.name: inputType
configs.doc: The type attribute for input fields -- e.g. radio, text, password, file. The extended types supported by HTML5 inputs (url, email, etc.) may also be used, though using them will cause older browsers to fall back to 'text'.

configs.name: invalidText
configs.doc: The error text to use when marking a field invalid and no message is provided
configs.default: The value in this field is invalid

configs.name: name
configs.doc: The name of the field. This is used as the parameter name when including the field value in a form submit(). If no name is configured, it falls back to the inputId. To prevent the field from being included in the form submit, set submitValue to false.

configs.name: readOnly
configs.doc: true to mark the field as readOnly in HTML.

configs.name: readOnlyCls
configs.doc: The CSS class applied to the component's main element when it is readOnly.

configs.name: tabIndex
configs.doc: The tabIndex for this field. Note this only applies to fields that are rendered, not those which are built via applyTo

configs.name: validateOnBlur
configs.doc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus. This will cause fields to be validated as the user steps through the fields in the form regardless of whether they are making changes to those fields along the way. See also validateOnChange.

events.name: blur
events.doc: Fires when this field loses input focus.

events.name: focus
events.doc: Fires when this field receives input focus.

events.name: specialkey
events.doc: Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed. To handle other keys see Ext.util.KeyMap. You can check Ext.EventObject.getKey to determine which key was pressed.

Ext.form.field.Checkbox.doc: Single checkbox field. Can be used as a direct replacement for traditional checkbox fields. Also serves as a parent class for radio buttons.

configs.name: boxLabel
configs.doc: An optional text label that will appear next to the checkbox. Whether it appears before or after the checkbox is determined by the boxLabelAlign config.

configs.name: boxLabelAlign
configs.doc: The position relative to the checkbox where the boxLabel should appear. Recognized values are 'before' and 'after'.

configs.name: boxLabelCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to be applied to the boxLabel element

configs.name: checked
configs.doc: true if the checkbox should render initially checked

configs.name: checkedCls
configs.doc: The CSS class added to the component's main element when it is in the checked state.

configs.name: fieldBodyCls
configs.doc: An extra CSS class to be applied to the body content element in addition to fieldBodyCls. .

configs.name: fieldCls
configs.doc: The default CSS class for the checkbox

configs.name: focusCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to use when the checkbox receives focus

configs.name: inputValue
configs.doc: The value that should go into the generated input element's value attribute and should be used as the parameter value when submitting as part of a form.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: An object to use as the scope ('this' reference) of the handler function (defaults to this Checkbox).

configs.name: uncheckedValue
configs.doc: If configured, this will be submitted as the checkbox's value during form submit if the checkbox is unchecked. By default this is undefined, which results in nothing being submitted for the checkbox field when the form is submitted (the default behavior of HTML checkboxes).

Ext.form.field.ComboBox.doc: A combobox control with support for autocomplete, remote loading, and many other features.

configs.name: allQuery
configs.doc: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering

configs.name: autoSelect
configs.doc: true to automatically highlight the first result gathered by the data store in the dropdown list when it is opened. A false value would cause nothing in the list to be highlighted automatically, so the user would have to manually highlight an item before pressing the enter or tab key to select it (unless the value of (typeAhead) were true), or use the mouse to select a value.

configs.name: defaultListConfig
configs.doc: Set of options that will be used as defaults for the user-configured listConfig object.
configs.default: {emptyText: , loadingText: Loading..., loadingHeight: 70, minWidth: 70, maxHeight: 300, shadow: sides}

configs.name: delimiter
configs.doc: The character(s) used to separate the display values of multiple selected items when multiSelect = true.

configs.name: displayField
configs.doc: The underlying data field name to bind to this ComboBox.

configs.name: forceSelection
configs.doc: true to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field.

configs.name: hiddenDataCls
configs.doc: CSS class used to find the hiddenDataEl

configs.name: listConfig
configs.doc: An optional set of configuration properties that will be passed to the Ext.view.BoundList's constructor. Any configuration that is valid for BoundList can be included.

configs.name: minChars
configs.doc: The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeAhead activate (defaults to 4 if queryMode = 'remote' or 0 if queryMode = 'local', does not apply if editable = false).

configs.name: multiSelect
configs.doc: If set to true, allows the combo field to hold more than one value at a time, and allows selecting multiple items from the dropdown list. The combo's text field will show all selected values separated by the delimiter.

configs.name: pageSize
configs.doc: If greater than 0, a Ext.toolbar.Paging is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the filter queries will execute with page start and limit parameters. Only applies when queryMode = 'remote'.

configs.name: queryDelay
configs.doc: The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending the query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if queryMode = 'remote' or 10 if queryMode = 'local')

configs.name: queryMode
configs.doc: The mode in which the ComboBox uses the configured Store.

configs.name: queryParam
configs.doc: Name of the parameter used by the Store to pass the typed string when the ComboBox is configured with queryMode: 'remote'. If explicitly set to a falsy value it will not be sent.

configs.name: selectOnTab
configs.doc: Whether the Tab key should select the currently highlighted item.

configs.name: store
configs.doc: The data source to which this combo is bound.

configs.name: transform
configs.doc: The id, DOM node or Ext.Element of an existing HTML <select> element to convert into a ComboBox. The target select's options will be used to build the options in the ComboBox dropdown; a configured store will take precedence over this.

configs.name: triggerAction
configs.doc: The action to execute when the trigger is clicked.

configs.name: triggerCls
configs.doc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the triggerBaseCls by default and triggerCls will be appended if specified.

configs.name: typeAhead
configs.doc: true to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value.

configs.name: typeAheadDelay
configs.doc: The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed if typeAhead = true

configs.name: valueField
configs.doc: The underlying data value name to bind to this ComboBox (defaults to match the value of the displayField config).

configs.name: valueNotFoundText
configs.doc: When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined. If this default text is used, it means there is no value set and no validation will occur on this field.

events.name: beforedeselect
events.doc: Fires before the deselected item is removed from the collection

events.name: beforequery
events.doc: Fires before all queries are processed. Return false to cancel the query or set the queryEvent's cancel property to true.

events.name: beforeselect
events.doc: Fires before the selected item is added to the collection

events.name: select
events.doc: Fires when at least one list item is selected.

Ext.form.field.Date.doc: Provides a date input field with a date picker dropdown and automatic date validation.

configs.name: altFormats
configs.doc: Multiple date formats separated by | to try when parsing a user input value and it does not match the defined format.

configs.name: disabledDates
configs.doc: An array of dates to disable, as strings. These strings will be used to build a dynamic regular expression so they are very powerful.

configs.name: disabledDatesText
configs.doc: The tooltip text to display when the date falls on a disabled date.

configs.name: disabledDays
configs.doc: An array of days to disable, 0 based.

configs.name: disabledDaysText
configs.doc: The tooltip to display when the date falls on a disabled day.

configs.name: format
configs.doc: The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support. The format must be valid according to Ext.Date.parse.

configs.name: invalidText
configs.doc: The error text to display when the date in the field is invalid.
configs.default: {0} is not a valid date - it must be in the format {1}

configs.name: maxText
configs.doc: The error text to display when the date in the cell is after maxValue.
configs.default: The date in this field must be equal to or before {0}

configs.name: maxValue
configs.doc: The maximum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a valid format.

configs.name: minText
configs.doc: The error text to display when the date in the cell is before minValue.
configs.default: The date in this field must be equal to or after {0}

configs.name: minValue
configs.doc: The minimum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a valid format.

configs.name: showToday
configs.doc: false to hide the footer area of the Date picker containing the Today button and disable the keyboard handler for spacebar that selects the current date.

configs.name: startDay
configs.doc: Day index at which the week should begin, 0-based (defaults to Sunday)

configs.name: submitFormat
configs.doc: The date format string which will be submitted to the server. The format must be valid according to Ext.Date.parse (defaults to format).

configs.name: triggerCls
configs.doc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the class 'x-form-trigger' and triggerCls will be appended if specified (default class displays a calendar icon).

Ext.form.field.Display.doc: A display-only text field which is not validated and not submitted. This is useful for when you want to display a value from a form's loaded data but do not want to allow the user to edit or submit that value.

configs.name: fieldCls
configs.doc: The default CSS class for the field.

configs.name: htmlEncode
configs.doc: false to skip HTML-encoding the text when rendering it. This might be useful if you want to include tags in the field's innerHTML rather than rendering them as string literals per the default logic.

Ext.form.field.Field.doc: This mixin provides a common interface for the logical behavior and state of form fields, including:

configs.name: disabled
configs.doc: True to disable the field. Disabled Fields will not be submitted.

configs.name: name
configs.doc: The name of the field. By default this is used as the parameter name when including the field value in a form submit(). To prevent the field from being included in the form submit, set submitValue to false.

configs.name: submitValue
configs.doc: Setting this to false will prevent the field from being submitted even when it is not disabled.

configs.name: validateOnChange
configs.doc: Specifies whether this field should be validated immediately whenever a change in its value is detected. If the validation results in a change in the field's validity, a validitychange event will be fired. This allows the field to show feedback about the validity of its contents immediately as the user is typing.

configs.name: value
configs.doc: A value to initialize this field with.

events.name: change
events.doc: Fires when a user-initiated change is detected in the value of the field.

events.name: dirtychange
events.doc: Fires when a change in the field's isDirty state is detected.

events.name: validitychange
events.doc: Fires when a change in the field's validity is detected.

Ext.form.field.File.doc: A file upload field. It uses a hidden file input element behind the scenes to allow user selection of a file and to perform the actual upload during form submit.

configs.name: buttonConfig
configs.doc: A standard Ext.button.Button config object.

configs.name: buttonMargin
configs.doc: The number of pixels of space reserved between the button and the text field. Note that this only applies if buttonOnly = false.

configs.name: buttonOnly
configs.doc: True to display the file upload field as a button with no visible text field. If true, all inherited Text members will still be available.

configs.name: buttonText
configs.doc: The button text to display on the upload button. Note that if you supply a value for buttonConfig, the buttonConfig.text value will be used instead if available.

configs.name: fieldBodyCls
configs.doc: An extra CSS class to be applied to the body content element in addition to fieldBodyCls.

configs.name: readOnly
configs.doc: Unlike with other form fields, the readOnly config defaults to true in File field.

events.name: change
events.doc: Fires when the underlying file input field's value has changed from the user selecting a new file from the system file selection dialog.

Ext.form.field.Hidden.doc: A basic hidden field for storing hidden values in forms that need to be passed in the form submit.

Ext.form.field.HtmlEditor.doc: Provides a lightweight HTML Editor component. Some toolbar features are not supported by Safari and will be automatically hidden when needed. These are noted in the config options where appropriate.

configs.name: createLinkText
configs.doc: The default text for the create link prompt
configs.default: Please enter the URL for the link:

configs.name: defaultLinkValue
configs.doc: The default value for the create link prompt

configs.name: defaultValue
configs.doc: A default value to be put into the editor to resolve focus issues (defaults to (Non-breaking space) in Opera and IE6, (Zero-width space) in all other browsers).

configs.name: enableAlignments
configs.doc: Enable the left, center, right alignment buttons

configs.name: enableColors
configs.doc: Enable the fore/highlight color buttons

configs.name: enableFont
configs.doc: Enable font selection. Not available in Safari.

configs.name: enableFontSize
configs.doc: Enable the increase/decrease font size buttons

configs.name: enableFormat
configs.doc: Enable the bold, italic and underline buttons

configs.name: enableLinks
configs.doc: Enable the create link button. Not available in Safari.

configs.name: enableLists
configs.doc: Enable the bullet and numbered list buttons. Not available in Safari.

configs.name: enableSourceEdit
configs.doc: Enable the switch to source edit button. Not available in Safari.

configs.name: fontFamilies
configs.doc: An array of available font families
configs.default: [Arial, Courier New, Tahoma, Times New Roman, Verdana]

events.name: activate
events.doc: Fires when the editor is first receives the focus. Any insertion must wait until after this event.

events.name: beforepush
events.doc: Fires before the iframe editor is updated with content from the textarea. Return false to cancel the push.

events.name: beforesync
events.doc: Fires before the textarea is updated with content from the editor iframe. Return false to cancel the sync.

events.name: editmodechange
events.doc: Fires when the editor switches edit modes

events.name: initialize
events.doc: Fires when the editor is fully initialized (including the iframe)

events.name: push
events.doc: Fires when the iframe editor is updated with content from the textarea.

events.name: sync
events.doc: Fires when the textarea is updated with content from the editor iframe.

Ext.form.field.Number.doc: A numeric text field that provides automatic keystroke filtering to disallow non-numeric characters, and numeric validation to limit the value to a range of valid numbers.

configs.name: allowDecimals
configs.doc: False to disallow decimal values

configs.name: autoStripChars
configs.doc: True to automatically strip not allowed characters from the field.

configs.name: baseChars
configs.doc: The base set of characters to evaluate as valid numbers.

configs.name: decimalPrecision
configs.doc: The maximum precision to display after the decimal separator

configs.name: decimalSeparator
configs.doc: Character(s) to allow as the decimal separator

configs.name: maxText
configs.doc: Error text to display if the maximum value validation fails.
configs.default: The maximum value for this field is {0}

configs.name: maxValue
configs.doc: The maximum allowed value (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE). Will be used by the field's validation logic, and for enabling/disabling the up spinner button.

configs.name: minText
configs.doc: Error text to display if the minimum value validation fails.
configs.default: The minimum value for this field is {0}

configs.name: minValue
configs.doc: The minimum allowed value (defaults to Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY). Will be used by the field's validation logic, and for enabling/disabling the down spinner button.

configs.name: nanText
configs.doc: Error text to display if the value is not a valid number. For example, this can happen if a valid character like '.' or '-' is left in the field with no number.

configs.name: negativeText
configs.doc: Error text to display if the value is negative and minValue is set to 0. This is used instead of the minText in that circumstance only.

configs.name: step
configs.doc: Specifies a numeric interval by which the field's value will be incremented or decremented when the user invokes the spinner.

Ext.form.field.Picker.doc: An abstract class for fields that have a single trigger which opens a picker popup below the field, e.g. a combobox menu list or a date picker. It provides a base implementation for toggling the picker's visibility when the trigger is clicked, as well as keyboard navigation and some basic events. Sizing and alignment of the picker can be controlled via the matchFieldWidth and pickerAlign/pickerOffset config properties respectively.

configs.name: editable
configs.doc: False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field; the field can only have its value set via selecting a value from the picker. In this state, the picker can also be opened by clicking directly on the input field itself.

configs.name: matchFieldWidth
configs.doc: Whether the picker dropdown's width should be explicitly set to match the width of the field. Defaults to true.

configs.name: openCls
configs.doc: A class to be added to the field's bodyEl element when the picker is opened. Defaults to 'x-pickerfield-open'.

configs.name: pickerAlign
configs.doc: The alignment position with which to align the picker. Defaults to tl-bl?

configs.name: pickerOffset
configs.doc: An offset [x,y] to use in addition to the pickerAlign when positioning the picker. Defaults to undefined.

events.name: collapse
events.doc: Fires when the field's picker is collapsed.

events.name: expand
events.doc: Fires when the field's picker is expanded.

events.name: select
events.doc: Fires when a value is selected via the picker.

Ext.form.field.Radio.doc: Single radio field. Similar to checkbox, but automatically handles making sure only one radio is checked at a time within a group of radios with the same name.

Ext.form.field.Spinner.doc: A field with a pair of up/down spinner buttons. This class is not normally instantiated directly, instead it is subclassed and the onSpinUp and onSpinDown methods are implemented to handle when the buttons are clicked. A good example of this is the Ext.form.field.Number field which uses the spinner to increment and decrement the field's value by its step config value.

configs.name: keyNavEnabled
configs.doc: Specifies whether the up and down arrow keys should trigger spinning up and down. Defaults to true.

configs.name: mouseWheelEnabled
configs.doc: Specifies whether the mouse wheel should trigger spinning up and down while the field has focus. Defaults to true.

configs.name: repeatTriggerClick
configs.doc: Whether a click repeater should be attached to the spinner buttons. Defaults to true.

configs.name: spinDownEnabled
configs.doc: Specifies whether the down spinner button is enabled. Defaults to true. To change this after the component is created, use the setSpinDownEnabled method.

configs.name: spinUpEnabled
configs.doc: Specifies whether the up spinner button is enabled. Defaults to true. To change this after the component is created, use the setSpinUpEnabled method.

events.name: spin
events.doc: Fires when the spinner is made to spin up or down.

events.name: spindown
events.doc: Fires when the spinner is made to spin down.

events.name: spinup
events.doc: Fires when the spinner is made to spin up.

Ext.form.field.Text.doc: A basic text field. Can be used as a direct replacement for traditional text inputs, or as the base class for more sophisticated input controls (like Ext.form.field.TextArea and Ext.form.field.ComboBox).

configs.name: allowBlank
configs.doc: Specify false to validate that the value's length is > 0

configs.name: blankText
configs.doc: The error text to display if the allowBlank validation fails

configs.name: disableKeyFilter
configs.doc: Specify true to disable input keystroke filtering

configs.name: emptyCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to apply to an empty field to style the emptyText. This class is automatically added and removed as needed depending on the current field value.

configs.name: emptyText
configs.doc: The default text to place into an empty field.

configs.name: enableKeyEvents
configs.doc: true to enable the proxying of key events for the HTML input field

configs.name: enforceMaxLength
configs.doc: True to set the maxLength property on the underlying input field. Defaults to false

configs.name: grow
configs.doc: true if this field should automatically grow and shrink to its content

configs.name: growAppend
configs.doc: A string that will be appended to the field's current value for the purposes of calculating the target field size. Only used when the grow config is true. Defaults to a single capital W (the widest character in common fonts) to leave enough space for the next typed character and avoid the field value shifting before the width is adjusted.

configs.name: growMax
configs.doc: The maximum width to allow when grow = true

configs.name: growMin
configs.doc: The minimum width to allow when grow = true

configs.name: maskRe
configs.doc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes (character being typed) that do not match. Note: It dose not filter characters already in the input.

configs.name: maxLength
configs.doc: Maximum input field length allowed by validation (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE). This behavior is intended to provide instant feedback to the user by improving usability to allow pasting and editing or overtyping and back tracking. To restrict the maximum number of characters that can be entered into the field use the enforceMaxLength option.

configs.name: maxLengthText
configs.doc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails
configs.default: The maximum length for this field is {0}

configs.name: minLength
configs.doc: Minimum input field length required

configs.name: minLengthText
configs.doc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails.
configs.default: The minimum length for this field is {0}

configs.name: regex
configs.doc: A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation. If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using either regexText or invalidText.

configs.name: regexText
configs.doc: The error text to display if regex is used and the test fails during validation

configs.name: selectOnFocus
configs.doc: true to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus

configs.name: size
configs.doc: An initial value for the 'size' attribute on the text input element. This is only used if the field has no configured width and is not given a width by its container's layout. Defaults to 20.

configs.name: stripCharsRe
configs.doc: A JavaScript RegExp object used to strip unwanted content from the value before validation. If stripCharsRe is specified, every character matching stripCharsRe will be removed before fed to validation. This does not change the value of the field.

configs.name: vtype
configs.doc: A validation type name as defined in Ext.form.field.VTypes

configs.name: vtypeText
configs.doc: A custom error message to display in place of the default message provided for the vtype currently set for this field. Note: only applies if vtype is set, else ignored.

events.name: autosize
events.doc: Fires when the autoSize function is triggered and the field is resized according to the grow/growMin/growMax configs as a result. This event provides a hook for the developer to apply additional logic at runtime to resize the field if needed.

events.name: keydown
events.doc: Keydown input field event. This event only fires if enableKeyEvents is set to true.

events.name: keypress
events.doc: Keypress input field event. This event only fires if enableKeyEvents is set to true.

events.name: keyup
events.doc: Keyup input field event. This event only fires if enableKeyEvents is set to true.

Ext.form.field.TextArea.doc: This class creates a multiline text field, which can be used as a direct replacement for traditional textarea fields. In addition, it supports automatically growing the height of the textarea to fit its content.

configs.name: cols
configs.doc: An initial value for the 'cols' attribute on the textarea element. This is only used if the component has no configured width and is not given a width by its container's layout.

configs.name: enterIsSpecial
configs.doc: True if you want the enter key to be classed as a special key. Special keys are generally navigation keys (arrows, space, enter). Setting the config property to true would mean that you could not insert returns into the textarea.

configs.name: growAppend
configs.doc: A string that will be appended to the field's current value for the purposes of calculating the target field size. Only used when the grow config is true. Defaults to a newline for TextArea to ensure there is always a space below the current line.

configs.name: growMax
configs.doc: The maximum height to allow when grow=true

configs.name: growMin
configs.doc: The minimum height to allow when grow=true

configs.name: preventScrollbars
configs.doc: true to prevent scrollbars from appearing regardless of how much text is in the field. This option is only relevant when grow is true. Equivalent to setting overflow: hidden.

Ext.form.field.Time.doc: Provides a time input field with a time dropdown and automatic time validation.

configs.name: altFormats
configs.doc: Multiple date formats separated by | to try when parsing a user input value and it doesn't match the defined format.
configs.default: g:ia|g:iA|g:i a|g:i A|h:i|g:i|H:i|ga|ha|gA|h a|g a|g A|gi|hi|gia|hia|g|H|gi a|hi a|giA|hiA|gi A|hi A

configs.name: format
configs.doc: The default time format string which can be overriden for localization support. The format must be valid according to Ext.Date.parse (defaults to 'g:i A', e.g., '3:15 PM'). For 24-hour time format try 'H:i' instead.

configs.name: increment
configs.doc: The number of minutes between each time value in the list.

configs.name: invalidText
configs.doc: The error text to display when the time in the field is invalid.

configs.name: maxText
configs.doc: The error text to display when the entered time is after maxValue.
configs.default: The time in this field must be equal to or before {0}

configs.name: maxValue
configs.doc: The maximum allowed time. Can be either a Javascript date object with a valid time value or a string time in a valid format -- see format and altFormats.

configs.name: minText
configs.doc: The error text to display when the entered time is before minValue.
configs.default: The time in this field must be equal to or after {0}

configs.name: minValue
configs.doc: The minimum allowed time. Can be either a Javascript date object with a valid time value or a string time in a valid format -- see format and altFormats.

configs.name: pickerMaxHeight
configs.doc: The maximum height of the Ext.picker.Time dropdown.

configs.name: selectOnTab
configs.doc: Whether the Tab key should select the currently highlighted item.

configs.name: submitFormat
configs.doc: The date format string which will be submitted to the server. The format must be valid according to Ext.Date.parse (defaults to format).

configs.name: triggerCls
configs.doc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the triggerBaseCls by default and triggerCls will be appended if specified. Defaults to 'x-form-time-trigger' for the Time field trigger.

Ext.form.field.Trigger.doc: Provides a convenient wrapper for TextFields that adds a clickable trigger button (looks like a combobox by default).

configs.name: editable
configs.doc: false to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field; the field can only have its value set via an action invoked by the trigger.

configs.name: hideTrigger
configs.doc: true to hide the trigger element and display only the base text field

configs.name: readOnly
configs.doc: true to prevent the user from changing the field, and hides the trigger. Supercedes the editable and hideTrigger options if the value is true.

configs.name: repeatTriggerClick
configs.doc: true to attach a click repeater to the trigger.

configs.name: selectOnFocus
configs.doc: true to select any existing text in the field immediately on focus. Only applies when editable = true

configs.name: triggerBaseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class that is always added to the trigger button. The triggerCls will be appended in addition to this class.

configs.name: triggerCls
configs.doc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the triggerBaseCls by default and triggerCls will be appended if specified.

configs.name: triggerWrapCls
configs.doc: The CSS class that is added to the div wrapping the trigger button(s).

Ext.form.field.VTypes.doc: This is a singleton object which contains a set of commonly used field validation functions and provides a mechanism for creating reusable custom field validations. The following field validation functions are provided out of the box:

Ext.form.FieldAncestor.doc: A mixin for Ext.container.Container components that are likely to have form fields in their items subtree. Adds the following capabilities:

configs.name: fieldDefaults
configs.doc: If specified, the properties in this object are used as default config values for each Ext.form.Labelable instance (e.g. Ext.form.field.Base or Ext.form.FieldContainer) that is added as a descendant of this container. Corresponding values specified in an individual field's own configuration, or from the defaults config of its parent container, will take precedence. See the documentation for Ext.form.Labelable to see what config options may be specified in the fieldDefaults.

events.name: fielderrorchange
events.doc: Fires when the active error message is changed for any one of the Ext.form.Labelable instances within this container.

events.name: fieldvaliditychange
events.doc: Fires when the validity state of any one of the Ext.form.field.Field instances within this container changes.

Ext.form.FieldContainer.doc: FieldContainer is a derivation of Container that implements the Labelable mixin. This allows it to be configured so that it is rendered with a field label and optional error message around its sub-items.

configs.name: combineErrors
configs.doc: If set to true, the field container will automatically combine and display the validation errors from all the fields it contains as a single error on the container, according to the configured msgTarget. Defaults to false.

configs.name: combineLabels
configs.doc: If set to true, and there is no defined fieldLabel, the field container will automatically generate its label by combining the labels of all the fields it contains. Defaults to false.

configs.name: labelConnector
configs.doc: The string to use when joining the labels of individual sub-fields, when combineLabels is set to true. Defaults to ', '.

Ext.form.FieldSet.doc: A container for grouping sets of fields, rendered as a HTML fieldset element. The title config will be rendered as the fieldset's legend.

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class applied to the fieldset.

configs.name: checkboxName
configs.doc: The name to assign to the fieldset's checkbox if checkboxToggle = true (defaults to '[fieldset id]-checkbox').

configs.name: checkboxToggle
configs.doc: Set to true to render a checkbox into the fieldset frame just in front of the legend to expand/collapse the fieldset when the checkbox is toggled.. This checkbox will be included in form submits using the checkboxName.

configs.name: collapsed
configs.doc: Set to true to render the fieldset as collapsed by default. If checkboxToggle is specified, the checkbox will also be unchecked by default.

configs.name: collapsible
configs.doc: Set to true to make the fieldset collapsible and have the expand/collapse toggle button automatically rendered into the legend element, false to keep the fieldset statically sized with no collapse button. Another option is to configure checkboxToggle. Use the collapsed config to collapse the fieldset by default.

configs.name: layout
configs.doc: The Ext.container.Container.layout for the fieldset's immediate child items.

configs.name: title
configs.doc: A title to be displayed in the fieldset's legend. May contain HTML markup.

Ext.form.Label.doc: Produces a standalone <label /> element which can be inserted into a form and be associated with a field in that form using the forId property.

configs.name: forId
configs.doc: The id of the input element to which this label will be bound via the standard HTML 'for' attribute. If not specified, the attribute will not be added to the label. In most cases you will be associating the label with a Ext.form.field.Base component, so you should make sure this matches the inputId of that field.

configs.name: html
configs.doc: An HTML fragment that will be used as the label's innerHTML. Note that if text is specified it will take precedence and this value will be ignored.

configs.name: text
configs.doc: The plain text to display within the label. If you need to include HTML tags within the label's innerHTML, use the html config instead.

Ext.form.Labelable.doc: A mixin which allows a component to be configured and decorated with a label and/or error message as is common for form fields. This is used by e.g. Ext.form.field.Base and Ext.form.FieldContainer to let them be managed by the Field layout.

configs.name: activeError
configs.doc: If specified, then the component will be displayed with this value as its active error when first rendered. Use setActiveError or unsetActiveError to change it after component creation.

configs.name: activeErrorsTpl
configs.doc: The template used to format the Array of error messages passed to setActiveErrors into a single HTML string. By default this renders each message as an item in an unordered list.
configs.default:
[,
    class=last>{.}
, ]

configs.name: autoFitErrors
configs.doc: Whether to adjust the component's body area to make room for 'side' or 'under' error messages.

configs.name: baseBodyCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to be applied to the body content element.

configs.name: clearCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to be applied to the special clearing div rendered directly after the field contents wrapper to provide field clearing.

configs.name: errorMsgCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to be applied to the error message element.

configs.name: fieldBodyCls
configs.doc: An extra CSS class to be applied to the body content element in addition to fieldBodyCls.
