configs.name: fieldLabel
configs.doc: The label for the field. It gets appended with the labelSeparator, and its position and sizing is determined by the labelAlign, labelWidth, and labelPad configs.

configs.name: formItemCls
configs.doc: A CSS class to be applied to the outermost element to denote that it is participating in the form field layout.

configs.name: hideEmptyLabel
configs.doc: When set to true, the label element (fieldLabel and labelSeparator) will be automatically hidden if the fieldLabel is empty. Setting this to false will cause the empty label element to be rendered and space to be reserved for it; this is useful if you want a field without a label to line up with other labeled fields in the same form.

configs.name: hideLabel
configs.doc: Set to true to completely hide the label element (fieldLabel and labelSeparator). Also see hideEmptyLabel, which controls whether space will be reserved for an empty fieldLabel.

configs.name: invalidCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to use when marking the component invalid.

configs.name: labelAlign
configs.doc: Controls the position and alignment of the fieldLabel.

configs.name: labelCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to be applied to the label element. This (single) CSS class is used to formulate the renderSelector and drives the field layout where it is concatenated with a hyphen ('-') and labelAlign. To add additional classes, use labelClsExtra.

configs.name: labelClsExtra
configs.doc: An optional string of one or more additional CSS classes to add to the label element. Defaults to empty.

configs.name: labelPad
configs.doc: The amount of space in pixels between the fieldLabel and the input field.

configs.name: labelSeparator
configs.doc: Character(s) to be inserted at the end of the label text.

configs.name: labelStyle
configs.doc: A CSS style specification string to apply directly to this field's label.

configs.name: labelWidth
configs.doc: The width of the fieldLabel in pixels. Only applicable if the labelAlign is set to left or right.

configs.name: labelableRenderTpl
configs.doc: The rendering template for the field decorations. Component classes using this mixin should include logic to use this as their renderTpl, and implement the getSubTplMarkup method to generate the field body content.
configs.default:
[, class={labelCls}, style={labelStyle}>, {fieldLabel}{labelSeparator}, , ,
{subTplMarkup}
,
,
, {compiled: true, disableFormats: true}]

configs.name: msgTarget
configs.doc: The location where the error message text should display.

configs.name: preventMark
configs.doc: true to disable displaying any error message set on this object.

events.name: errorchange
events.doc: Fires when the active error message is changed via setActiveError.

Ext.form.Panel.doc: FormPanel provides a standard container for forms.

configs.name: layout
configs.doc: The Ext.container.Container.layout for the form panel's immediate child items. Defaults to 'anchor'.

configs.name: pollForChanges
configs.doc: If set to true, sets up an interval task (using the pollInterval) in which the panel's fields are repeatedly checked for changes in their values. This is in addition to the normal detection each field does on its own input element, and is not needed in most cases. It does, however, provide a means to absolutely guarantee detection of all changes including some edge cases in some browsers which do not fire native events. Defaults to false.

configs.name: pollInterval
configs.doc: Interval in milliseconds at which the form's fields are checked for value changes. Only used if the pollForChanges option is set to true. Defaults to 500 milliseconds.

Ext.form.RadioGroup.doc: A field container which has a specialized layout for arranging Ext.form.field.Radio controls into columns, and provides convenience Ext.form.field.Field methods for getting, setting, and validating the group of radio buttons as a whole.

configs.name: allowBlank
configs.doc: True to allow every item in the group to be blank. If allowBlank = false and no items are selected at validation time, blankText will be used as the error text.

configs.name: blankText
configs.doc: Error text to display if the allowBlank validation fails
configs.default: You must select one item in this group

configs.name: items
configs.doc: An Array of Radios or Radio config objects to arrange in the group.

Ext.form.RadioManager.doc: Private utility class for managing all Ext.form.field.Radio fields grouped by name.

Ext.Function.doc: A collection of useful static methods to deal with function callbacks

Ext.fx.Anim.doc: This class manages animation for a specific target. The animation allows animation of various properties on the target, such as size, position, color and others.

configs.name: alternate
configs.doc: Used in conjunction with iterations to reverse the animation each time an iteration completes. Defaults to false.

configs.name: delay
configs.doc: Time to delay before starting the animation. Defaults to 0.

configs.name: duration
configs.doc: Time in milliseconds for a single animation to last. Defaults to 250. If the iterations property is specified, then each animate will take the same duration for each iteration.

configs.name: dynamic
configs.doc: Currently only for Component Animation: Only set a component's outer element size bypassing layouts. Set to true to do full layouts for every frame of the animation. Defaults to false.

configs.name: easing
configs.doc: This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration.

configs.name: from
configs.doc: An object containing property/value pairs for the beginning of the animation. If not specified, the current state of the Ext.fx.target will be used.

configs.name: iterations
configs.doc: Number of times to execute the animation. Defaults to 1.

configs.name: keyframes
configs.doc: Animation keyframes follow the CSS3 Animation configuration pattern. 'from' is always considered '0%' and 'to' is considered '100%'.Every keyframe declaration must have a keyframe rule for 0% and 100%, possibly defined using from or to. A keyframe declaration without these keyframe selectors is invalid and will not be available for animation. The keyframe declaration for a keyframe rule consists of properties and values. Properties that are unable to be animated are ignored in these rules, with the exception of 'easing' which can be changed at each keyframe.

configs.name: reverse
configs.doc: Run the animation from the end to the beginning Defaults to false.

configs.name: target
configs.doc: The Ext.fx.target.Target to apply the animation to. This should only be specified when creating an Ext.fx.Anim directly. The target does not need to be a Ext.fx.target.Target instance, it can be the underlying object. For example, you can pass a Component, Element or Sprite as the target and the Anim will create the appropriate Ext.fx.target.Target object automatically.

configs.name: to
configs.doc: An object containing property/value pairs for the end of the animation.

events.name: afteranimate
events.doc: Fires when the animation is complete.

events.name: beforeanimate
events.doc: Fires before the animation starts. A handler can return false to cancel the animation.

events.name: lastframe
events.doc: Fires when the animation's last frame has been set.

Ext.fx.Animator.doc: This class is used to run keyframe based animations, which follows the CSS3 based animation structure. Keyframe animations differ from typical from/to animations in that they offer the ability to specify values at various points throughout the animation.

configs.name: delay
configs.doc: Time to delay before starting the animation. Defaults to 0.

configs.name: duration
configs.doc: Time in milliseconds for the animation to last. Defaults to 250.

configs.name: dynamic
configs.doc: Currently only for Component Animation: Only set a component's outer element size bypassing layouts. Set to true to do full layouts for every frame of the animation. Defaults to false.

configs.name: easing
configs.doc: This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration.

configs.name: iterations
configs.doc: Number of times to execute the animation. Defaults to 1.

configs.name: keyframes
configs.doc: Animation keyframes follow the CSS3 Animation configuration pattern.

configs.name: target
configs.doc: The Ext.fx.target to apply the animation to. If not specified during initialization, this can be passed to the applyAnimator method to apply the same animation to many targets.

events.name: afteranimate
events.doc: Fires when the animation is complete.

events.name: beforeanimate
events.doc: Fires before the animation starts. A handler can return false to cancel the animation.

events.name: keyframe
events.doc: Fires at each keyframe.

Ext.fx.Easing.doc: This class contains a series of function definitions used to modify values during an animation. They describe how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration. The following options are available:

Ext.fx.Manager.doc: Animation Manager which keeps track of all current animations and manages them on a frame by frame basis.

configs.name: forceJS
configs.doc: Turn off to not use CSS3 transitions when they are available

configs.name: interval
configs.doc: Default interval in miliseconds to calculate each frame. Defaults to 16ms (~60fps)

Ext.fx.Queue.doc: Animation Queue mixin to handle chaining and queueing by target.

Ext.fx.target.Component.doc: This class represents a animation target for a Ext.Component. In general this class will not be created directly, the Ext.Component will be passed to the animation and and the appropriate target will be created.

Ext.fx.target.CompositeElement.doc: This class represents a animation target for a Ext.CompositeElement. It allows each Ext.Element in the group to be animated as a whole. In general this class will not be created directly, the Ext.CompositeElement will be passed to the animation and and the appropriate target will be created.

Ext.fx.target.CompositeElementCSS.doc: This class represents a animation target for a Ext.CompositeElement, where the constituent elements support CSS based animation. It allows each Ext.Element in the group to be animated as a whole. In general this class will not be created directly, the Ext.CompositeElement will be passed to the animation and the appropriate target will be created.

Ext.fx.target.CompositeSprite.doc: This class represents a animation target for a Ext.draw.CompositeSprite. It allows each Ext.draw.Sprite in the group to be animated as a whole. In general this class will not be created directly, the Ext.draw.CompositeSprite will be passed to the animation and and the appropriate target will be created.

Ext.fx.target.Element.doc: This class represents a animation target for an Ext.Element. In general this class will not be created directly, the Ext.Element will be passed to the animation and and the appropriate target will be created.

Ext.fx.target.ElementCSS.doc: This class represents a animation target for an Ext.Element that supports CSS based animation. In general this class will not be created directly, the Ext.Element will be passed to the animation and the appropriate target will be created.

Ext.fx.target.Sprite.doc: This class represents a animation target for a Ext.draw.Sprite. In general this class will not be created directly, the Ext.draw.Sprite will be passed to the animation and and the appropriate target will be created.

Ext.fx.target.Target.doc: This class specifies a generic target for an animation.

Ext.grid.column.Action.doc: A Grid header type which renders an icon, or a series of icons in a grid cell, and offers a scoped click handler for each icon.

configs.name: altText
configs.doc: The alt text to use for the image element.

configs.name: icon
configs.doc: The URL of an image to display as the clickable element in the column. Defaults to Ext.BLANK_IMAGE_URL.

configs.name: iconCls
configs.doc: A CSS class to apply to the icon image. To determine the class dynamically, configure the Column with a getClass function.

configs.name: items
configs.doc: An Array which may contain multiple icon definitions

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler and getClass fuctions are executed. Defaults to this Column.

configs.name: stopSelection
configs.doc: Prevent grid row selection upon mousedown.

configs.name: tooltip
configs.doc: A tooltip message to be displayed on hover. Ext.tip.QuickTipManager must have been initialized.

Ext.grid.column.Boolean.doc: A Column definition class which renders boolean data fields. See the xtype config option of Ext.grid.column.Column for more details.

configs.name: falseText
configs.doc: The string returned by the renderer when the column value is falsey (but not undefined).

configs.name: trueText
configs.doc: The string returned by the renderer when the column value is not falsey.

configs.name: undefinedText
configs.doc: The string returned by the renderer when the column value is undefined.

Ext.grid.column.Column.doc: This class specifies the definition for a column inside a Ext.grid.Panel. It encompasses both the grid header configuration as well as displaying data within the grid itself.

configs.name: align
configs.doc: Sets the alignment of the header and rendered columns. Defaults to 'left'.

configs.name: columns
configs.doc: An optional array of sub-column definitions. This column becomes a group, and houses the columns defined in the columns config.

configs.name: dataIndex
configs.doc: The name of the field in the grid's Ext.data.Store's Ext.data.Model definition from which to draw the column's value. Required.

configs.name: draggable
configs.doc: False to disable drag-drop reordering of this column. Defaults to true.

configs.name: editor
configs.doc: An optional xtype or config object for a Field to use for editing. Only applicable if the grid is using an Editing plugin.

configs.name: field
configs.doc: Alias for editor.

configs.name: fixed
groupable
configs.doc: If the grid uses a Ext.grid.feature.Grouping, this option may be used to disable the header menu item to group by the column selected. By default, the header menu group option is enabled. Set to false to disable (but still show) the group option in the header menu for the column.

configs.name: hideable
configs.doc: False to prevent the user from hiding this column. Defaults to true.

configs.name: menuDisabled
configs.doc: True to disable the column header menu containing sort/hide options. Defaults to false.

configs.name: resizable
configs.doc: Set to false to prevent the column from being resizable. Defaults to true

configs.name: sortable
configs.doc: False to disable sorting of this column. Whether local/remote sorting is used is specified in Ext.data.Store.remoteSort. Defaults to true.

configs.name: tdCls
configs.doc: A CSS class names to apply to the table cells for this column.

configs.name: text
configs.doc: The header text to be used as innerHTML (html tags are accepted) to display in the Grid. Note: to have a clickable header with no text displayed you can use the default of   aka  .

Ext.grid.column.Date.doc: A Column definition class which renders a passed date according to the default locale, or a configured format.

configs.name: format
configs.doc: A formatting string as used by Ext.Date.format to format a Date for this Column. This defaults to the default date from Ext.Date.defaultFormat which itself my be overridden in a locale file.

Ext.grid.column.Number.doc: A Column definition class which renders a numeric data field according to a format string.

configs.name: format
configs.doc: A formatting string as used by Ext.util.Format.number to format a numeric value for this Column.

Ext.grid.column.Template.doc: A Column definition class which renders a value by processing a Model's data using a configured XTemplate.

configs.name: tpl
configs.doc: An XTemplate, or an XTemplate definition string to use to process a Model's data to produce a column's rendered value.

Ext.grid.ColumnLayout.doc: This class is used only by the grid's HeaderContainer docked child.

Ext.grid.feature.AbstractSummary.doc: A small abstract class that contains the shared behaviour for any summary calculations to be used in the grid.

configs.name: showSummaryRow
configs.doc: True to show the summary row. Defaults to true.

Ext.grid.feature.Feature.doc: A feature is a type of plugin that is specific to the Ext.grid.Panel. It provides several hooks that allows the developer to inject additional functionality at certain points throughout the grid creation cycle. This class provides the base template methods that are available to the developer, it should be extended.

Ext.grid.feature.Grouping.doc: This feature allows to display the grid rows aggregated into groups as specified by the Ext.data.Store.groupers specified on the Store. The group will show the title for the group name and then the appropriate records for the group underneath.

configs.name: depthToIndent
configs.doc: Number of pixels to indent per grouping level

configs.name: enableGroupingMenu
configs.doc: true to enable the grouping control in the header menu

configs.name: enableNoGroups
configs.doc: true to allow the user to turn off grouping

configs.name: groupByText
configs.doc: Text displayed in the grid header menu for grouping by header.

configs.name: groupHeaderTpl
configs.doc: Template snippet, this cannot be an actual template. {name} will be replaced with the current group. Defaults to 'Group: {name}'

configs.name: hideGroupedHeader
configs.doc: true to hide the header that is currently grouped.

configs.name: showGroupsText
configs.doc: Text displayed in the grid header for enabling/disabling grouping.

configs.name: startCollapsed
configs.doc: true to start all groups collapsed

events.name: groupclick
groupcollapse
groupcontextmenu
groupdblclick
groupexpand

Ext.grid.feature.GroupingSummary.doc: This feature adds an aggregate summary row at the bottom of each group that is provided by the Ext.grid.feature.Grouping feature. There are two aspects to the summary:

configs.name: remoteRoot
configs.doc: The name of the property which contains the Array of summary objects. It allows to use server-side calculated summaries.

Ext.grid.feature.RowBody.doc: The rowbody feature enhances the grid's markup to have an additional tr -> td -> div which spans the entire width of the original row.

Ext.grid.feature.Summary.doc: This feature is used to place a summary row at the bottom of the grid. If using a grouping, see Ext.grid.feature.GroupingSummary. There are 2 aspects to calculating the summaries, calculation and rendering.

Ext.grid.header.Container.doc: Container which holds headers and is docked at the top or bottom of a TablePanel. The HeaderContainer drives resizing/moving/hiding of columns within the TableView. As headers are hidden, moved or resized the headercontainer is responsible for triggering changes within the view.

configs.name: defaultWidth
configs.doc: Width of the header if no width or flex is specified. Defaults to 100.

configs.name: sortable
configs.doc: Provides the default sortable state for all Headers within this HeaderContainer. Also turns on or off the menus in the HeaderContainer. Note that the menu is shared across every header and therefore turning it off will remove the menu items for every header.

configs.name: weight
configs.doc: HeaderContainer overrides the default weight of 0 for all docked items to 100. This is so that it has more priority over things like toolbars.

events.name: columnhide
columnmove
columnresize
columnshow
headerclick
headertriggerclick
menucreate
events.doc: Fired immediately after the column header menu is created.

events.name: sortchange

Ext.grid.Lockable.doc: Lockable is a private mixin which injects lockable behavior into any TablePanel subclass such as GridPanel or TreePanel. TablePanel will automatically inject the Ext.grid.Lockable mixin in when one of the these conditions are met:

configs.name: lockedViewConfig
configs.doc: A view configuration to be applied to the locked side of the grid. Any conflicting configurations between lockedViewConfig and viewConfig will be overwritten by the lockedViewConfig.

configs.name: normalViewConfig
configs.doc: A view configuration to be applied to the normal/unlocked side of the grid. Any conflicting configurations between normalViewConfig and viewConfig will be overwritten by the normalViewConfig.

configs.name: subGridXType
configs.doc: The xtype of the subgrid to specify. If this is not specified lockable will determine the subgrid xtype to create by the following rule. Use the superclasses xtype if the superclass is NOT tablepanel, otherwise use the xtype itself.

configs.name: syncRowHeight
configs.doc: Synchronize rowHeight between the normal and locked grid view. This is turned on by default. If your grid is guaranteed to have rows of all the same height, you should set this to false to optimize performance.

events.name: lockcolumn
events.doc: Fires when a column is locked.

events.name: unlockcolumn
events.doc: Fires when a column is unlocked.

configs.name: percentageFromEdge
configs.doc: This is a number above 0 and less than 1 which specifies at what percentage to begin fetching the next page. For example if the pageSize is 100 and the percentageFromEdge is the default of 0.35, the paging scroller will prefetch pages when scrolling up between records 0 and 34 and when scrolling down between records 65 and 99.

configs.name: scrollToLoadBuffer
configs.doc: This is the time in milliseconds to buffer load requests when scrolling the PagingScrollbar.

Ext.grid.Panel.doc: Grids are an excellent way of showing large amounts of tabular data on the client side. Essentially a supercharged <table>, GridPanel makes it easy to fetch, sort and filter large amounts of data.

configs.name: columnLines
configs.doc: Adds column line styling

Ext.grid.plugin.CellEditing.doc: The Ext.grid.plugin.CellEditing plugin injects editing at a cell level for a Grid. Only a single cell will be editable at a time. The field that will be used for the editor is defined at the editor. The editor can be a field instance or a field configuration.

events.name: beforeedit
events.doc: Fires before cell editing is triggered. Return false from event handler to stop the editing.

events.name: edit
events.doc: Fires after a cell is edited.

events.name: validateedit
events.doc: Fires after a cell is edited, but before the value is set in the record. Return false from event handler to cancel the change.

Ext.grid.plugin.DragDrop.doc: This plugin provides drag and/or drop functionality for a GridView.

configs.name: ddGroup
configs.doc: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then both the DragZones and DropZone used by this plugin will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group.

configs.name: dragGroup
configs.doc: The ddGroup to which the DragZone will belong.

configs.name: dropGroup
configs.doc: The ddGroup to which the DropZone will belong.

configs.name: enableDrag
configs.doc: False to disallow dragging items from the View.

configs.name: enableDrop
configs.doc: False to disallow the View from accepting drop gestures.

events.name: beforedrop
events.params: node(HTMLElement) data(Object) overModel(Ext.data.Model) dropPosition(String) dropFunction(Function) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: This event is fired through the GridView. Add listeners to the GridView object

events.name: drop
events.doc: This event is fired through the GridView. Add listeners to the GridView object Fired when a drop operation has been completed and the data has been moved or copied.

Ext.grid.plugin.Editing.doc: This class provides an abstract grid editing plugin on selected columns. The editable columns are specified by providing an editor in the column configuration.

configs.name: clicksToEdit
configs.doc: The number of clicks on a grid required to display the editor.

Ext.grid.plugin.HeaderResizer.doc: Plugin to add header resizing functionality to a HeaderContainer. Always resizing header to the left of the splitter you are resizing.

configs.name: dynamic
configs.doc: Set to true to resize on the fly rather than using a proxy marker. Defaults to false.

Ext.grid.plugin.RowEditing.doc: The Ext.grid.plugin.RowEditing plugin injects editing at a row level for a Grid. When editing begins, a small floating dialog will be shown for the appropriate row. Each editable column will show a field for editing.

configs.name: autoCancel
configs.doc: True to automatically cancel any pending changes when the row editor begins editing a new row. False to force the user to explicitly cancel the pending changes. Defaults to true.

configs.name: clicksToMoveEditor
configs.doc: The number of clicks to move the row editor to a new row while it is visible and actively editing another row. This will default to the same value as clicksToEdit.

configs.name: errorSummary
configs.doc: True to show a tooltip that summarizes all validation errors present in the row editor. Set to false to prevent the tooltip from showing. Defaults to true.

events.name: beforeedit
events.doc: Fires before row editing is triggered.

events.name: canceledit
events.doc: Fires when the user has started editing a row but then cancelled the edit

events.name: edit
events.doc: Fires after a row is edited.

events.name: validateedit
events.doc: Fires after a cell is edited, but before the value is set in the record. Return false to cancel the change. The edit event object has the following properties

Ext.grid.property.Grid.doc: A specialized grid implementation intended to mimic the traditional property grid as typically seen in development IDEs. Each row in the grid represents a property of some object, and the data is stored as a set of name/value pairs in Properties.

configs.name: customEditors
configs.doc: An object containing name/value pairs of custom editor type definitions that allow the grid to support additional types of editable fields. By default, the grid supports strongly-typed editing of strings, dates, numbers and booleans using built-in form editors, but any custom type can be supported and associated with a custom input control by specifying a custom editor. The name of the editor type should correspond with the name of the property that will use the editor.

configs.name: customRenderers
configs.doc: An object containing name/value pairs of custom renderer type definitions that allow the grid to support custom rendering of fields. By default, the grid supports strongly-typed rendering of strings, dates, numbers and booleans using built-in form editors, but any custom type can be supported and associated with the type of the value. The name of the renderer type should correspond with the name of the property that it will render.

configs.name: nameColumnWidth
configs.doc: Optional. Specify the width for the name column. The value column will take any remaining space. Defaults to 115.

configs.name: nameField
configs.doc: Optional. The name of the field from the property store to use as the property field name. Defaults to 'name' This may be useful if you do not configure the property Grid from an object, but use your own store configuration.

configs.name: propertyNames
configs.doc: An object containing custom property name/display name pairs. If specified, the display name will be shown in the name column instead of the property name.

configs.name: source
configs.doc: A data object to use as the data source of the grid (see setSource for details).

configs.name: valueField
configs.doc: Optional. The name of the field from the property store to use as the value field name. Defaults to 'value' This may be useful if you do not configure the property Grid from an object, but use your own store configuration.

events.name: beforepropertychange
events.doc: Fires before a property value changes. Handlers can return false to cancel the property change (this will internally call Ext.data.Model.reject on the property's record).

events.name: propertychange
events.doc: Fires after a property value has changed.

Ext.grid.property.HeaderContainer.doc: A custom HeaderContainer for the Ext.grid.property.Grid. Generally it should not need to be used directly.

Ext.grid.property.Property.doc: A specific Ext.data.Model type that represents a name/value pair and is made to work with the Ext.grid.property.Grid. Typically, Properties do not need to be created directly as they can be created implicitly by simply using the appropriate data configs either via the Ext.grid.property.Grid.source config property or by calling Ext.grid.property.Grid.setSource. However, if the need arises, these records can also be created explicitly as shown below. Example usage:

Ext.grid.property.Store.doc: A custom Ext.data.Store for the Ext.grid.property.Grid. This class handles the mapping between the custom data source objects supported by the grid and the Ext.grid.property.Property format used by the Ext.data.Store base class.

Ext.grid.RowNumberer.doc: This is a utility class that can be passed into a Ext.grid.column.Column as a column config that provides an automatic row numbering column.

configs.name: text
configs.doc: Any valid text or HTML fragment to display in the header cell for the row number column.

configs.name: width
configs.doc: The default width in pixels of the row number column.

Ext.grid.Scroller.doc: Docked in an Ext.grid.Panel, controls virtualized scrolling and synchronization across different sections.

Ext.grid.View.doc: The grid View class provides extra Ext.grid.Panel specific functionality to the Ext.view.Table. In general, this class is not instanced directly, instead a viewConfig option is passed to the grid:

configs.name: stripeRows
configs.doc: true to stripe the rows. Default is true.

Ext.Img.doc: Simple helper class for easily creating image components. This simply renders an image tag to the DOM with the configured src.

configs.name: src
configs.doc: The image src

Ext.is.doc: Determines information about the current platform the application is running on.

Ext.JSON.doc: Modified version of Douglas Crockford's JSON.js that doesn't mess with the Object prototype http://www.json.org/js.html

Ext.Layer.doc: An extended Ext.Element object that supports a shadow and shim, constrain to viewport and automatic maintaining of shadow/shim positions.

configs.name: cls
configs.doc: CSS class to add to the element

configs.name: constrain
configs.doc: False to disable constrain to viewport.

configs.name: dh
configs.doc: DomHelper object config to create element with.

configs.name: hideMode
configs.doc:
A String which specifies how this Layer will be hidden. Values may be

  • 'display' : The Component will be hidden using the display: none style.
  • 'visibility' : The Component will be hidden using the visibility: hidden style.
  • 'offsets' : The Component will be hidden by absolutely positioning it out of the visible area of the document. This is useful when a hidden Component must maintain measurable dimensions. Hiding using display results in a Component having zero dimensions.

configs.name: shadow
configs.doc: True to automatically create an Ext.Shadow, or a string indicating the shadow's display Ext.Shadow.mode. False to disable the shadow.

configs.name: shadowOffset
configs.doc: Number of pixels to offset the shadow

configs.name: shim
configs.doc: False to disable the iframe shim in browsers which need one.

configs.name: useDisplay
configs.doc: Defaults to use css offsets to hide the Layer. Specify true to use css style 'display:none;' to hide the Layer.

configs.name: visibilityCls
configs.doc: The CSS class name to add in order to hide this Layer if this layer is configured with hideMode: 'asclass'

configs.name: zindex
configs.doc: Starting z-index.

Ext.layout.component.AbstractDock.doc: This ComponentLayout handles docking for Panels. It takes care of panels that are part of a ContainerLayout that sets this Panel's size and Panels that are part of an AutoContainerLayout in which this panel get his height based of the CSS or or its content.

Ext.layout.component.Auto.doc: The AutoLayout is the default layout manager delegated by Ext.Component to render any child Elements when no layout is configured.

Ext.layout.component.Body.doc: Component layout for components which maintain an inner body element which must be resized to synchronize with the Component size.

Ext.layout.component.BoundList.doc: Component layout for Ext.view.BoundList. Handles constraining the height to the configured maxHeight.

Ext.layout.component.Component.doc: This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout configuration property. See Ext.Component.componentLayout for additional details.

Ext.layout.component.field.Field.doc: Layout class for components with field labeling, handling the sizing and alignment of the form control, label, and error message treatment.

Ext.layout.component.field.File.doc: Layout class for Ext.form.field.File fields. Adjusts the input field size to accommodate the file picker trigger button.

Ext.layout.component.field.HtmlEditor.doc: Layout class for Ext.form.field.HtmlEditor fields. Sizes the toolbar, textarea, and iframe elements.

Ext.layout.component.field.Text.doc: Layout class for Ext.form.field.Text fields. Handles sizing the input field.

Ext.layout.component.field.TextArea.doc: Layout class for Ext.form.field.TextArea fields. Handles sizing the textarea field.

Ext.layout.component.field.Trigger.doc: Layout class for Ext.form.field.Trigger fields. Adjusts the input field size to accommodate the trigger button(s).

Ext.layout.container.Absolute.doc: This is a layout that inherits the anchoring of Ext.layout.container.Anchor and adds the ability for x/y positioning using the standard x and y component config options.

configs.name: deferredRender
configs.doc: True to render each contained item at the time it becomes active, false to render all contained items as soon as the layout is rendered. If there is a significant amount of content or a lot of heavy controls being rendered into panels that are not displayed by default, setting this to true might improve performance.

configs.name: bindToOwnerCtComponent
configs.doc: Flag to notify the ownerCt Component on afterLayout of a change

configs.name: bindToOwnerCtContainer
configs.doc: Flag to notify the ownerCt Container on afterLayout of a change

configs.name: itemCls
configs.doc: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to the container. This can be useful for adding customized styles to the container or any of its children using standard CSS rules. See Ext.Component.componentCls also.

Ext.layout.container.Accordion.doc: This is a layout that manages multiple Panels in an expandable accordion style such that only one Panel can be expanded at any given time. Each Panel has built-in support for expanding and collapsing.

configs.name: activeOnTop
configs.doc: Only valid when multi is false and animate is false.

configs.name: animate
configs.doc: True to slide the contained panels open and closed during expand/collapse using animation, false to open and close directly with no animation. Note: The layout performs animated collapsing and expanding, not the child Panels.

configs.name: autoWidth
configs.doc: Child Panels have their width actively managed to fit within the accordion's width.

configs.name: collapseFirst
configs.doc: True to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the contained Panels' title bars, false to render it last.

configs.name: fill
configs.doc: True to adjust the active item's height to fill the available space in the container, false to use the item's current height, or auto height if not explicitly set.

configs.name: hideCollapseTool
configs.doc: True to hide the contained Panels' collapse/expand toggle buttons, false to display them. When set to true, titleCollapse is automatically set to true.

configs.name: multi
configs.doc: Set to true to enable multiple accordion items to be open at once.

configs.name: titleCollapse
configs.doc: True to allow expand/collapse of each contained panel by clicking anywhere on the title bar, false to allow expand/collapse only when the toggle tool button is clicked. When set to false, hideCollapseTool should be false also.

Ext.layout.container.Anchor.doc: This is a layout that enables anchoring of contained elements relative to the container's dimensions. If the container is resized, all anchored items are automatically rerendered according to their anchor rules.

configs.name: anchor
configs.doc: This configuation option is to be applied to child items of a container managed by this layout (ie. configured with layout:'anchor').

configs.name: defaultAnchor
configs.doc: Default anchor for all child container items applied if no anchor or specific width is set on the child item. Defaults to '100%'.

Ext.layout.container.Auto.doc: The AutoLayout is the default layout manager delegated by Ext.container.Container to render any child Components when no layout is configured into a Container. AutoLayout provides only a passthrough of any layout calls to any child containers.

Ext.layout.container.Border.doc: This is a multi-pane, application-oriented UI layout style that supports multiple nested panels, automatic bars between regions and built-in expanding and collapsing of regions.

Ext.layout.container.Box.doc: Base Class for HBoxLayout and VBoxLayout Classes. Generally it should not need to be used directly.

configs.name: animate
configs.doc: If truthy, child Component are animated into position whenever the Container is layed out. If this option is numeric, it is used as the animation duration in milliseconds.

configs.name: clearInnerCtOnLayout
defaultMargins
configs.doc: If the individual contained items do not have a margins property specified or margin specified via CSS, the default margins from this property will be applied to each item.

configs.name: flex
configs.doc: This configuration option is to be applied to child items of the container managed by this layout. Each child item with a flex property will be flexed horizontally according to each item's relative flex value compared to the sum of all items with a flex value specified. Any child items that have either a flex = 0 or flex = undefined will not be 'flexed' (the initial size will not be changed).

configs.name: pack
configs.doc: Controls how the child items of the container are packed together.

configs.name: padding
configs.doc: Sets the padding to be applied to all child items managed by this layout.

configs.name: shrinkToFit
configs.doc: True (the default) to allow fixed size components to shrink (limited to their minimum size) to avoid overflow. False to preserve fixed sizes even if they cause overflow.

configs.name: afterCtCls
configs.doc: CSS class added to the afterCt element. This is the element that holds any special items such as scrollers, which must always be present at the rightmost edge of the Container

Ext.layout.container.boxOverflow.None.doc: Base class for Box Layout overflow handlers. These specialized classes are invoked when a Box Layout (either an HBox or a VBox) has child items that are either too wide (for HBox) or too tall (for VBox) for its container.

configs.name: afterCtCls
configs.doc: CSS class added to the afterCt element. This is the element that holds any special items such as scrollers, which must always be present at the rightmost edge of the Container

configs.name: afterScrollerCls
configs.doc: CSS class added to the right scroller element if enableScroll is used

configs.name: animateScroll
configs.doc: True to animate the scrolling of items within the layout (ignored if enableScroll is false)

configs.name: beforeCtCls
configs.doc: CSS class added to the beforeCt element. This is the element that holds any special items such as scrollers, which must always be present at the leftmost edge of the Container

configs.name: beforeScrollerCls
configs.doc: CSS class added to the left scroller element if enableScroll is used

configs.name: scrollDuration
configs.doc: Number of milliseconds that each scroll animation lasts

configs.name: scrollIncrement
configs.doc: The number of pixels to scroll by on scroller click

configs.name: scrollRepeatInterval
configs.doc: Number of milliseconds between each scroll while a scroller button is held down

configs.name: scrollerCls
configs.doc: CSS class added to both scroller elements if enableScroll is used

configs.name: wheelIncrement
configs.doc: The number of pixels to increment on mouse wheel scrolling.

events.name: scroll

Ext.layout.container.Card.doc: This layout manages multiple child Components, each fitted to the Container, where only a single child Component can be visible at any given time. This layout style is most commonly used for wizards, tab implementations, etc. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout:'card' Ext.container.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword.

Ext.layout.container.CheckboxGroup.doc: This layout implements the column arrangement for Ext.form.CheckboxGroup and Ext.form.RadioGroup. It groups the component's sub-items into columns based on the component's columns and Ext.form.CheckboxGroup.vertical config properties.

Ext.layout.container.Column.doc: This is the layout style of choice for creating structural layouts in a multi-column format where the width of each column can be specified as a percentage or fixed width, but the height is allowed to vary based on the content. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout:'column' Ext.container.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword.

Ext.layout.container.Container.doc: This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout configuration property. See Ext.container.Container.layout for additional details.

Ext.layout.container.Fit.doc: This is a base class for layouts that contain a single item that automatically expands to fill the layout's container. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout: 'fit' Ext.container.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword.

configs.name: defaultMargins
configs.doc: If the individual contained items do not have a margins property specified or margin specified via CSS, the default margins from this property will be applied to each item.

Ext.layout.container.HBox.doc: A layout that arranges items horizontally across a Container. This layout optionally divides available horizontal space between child items containing a numeric flex configuration.

configs.name: align
configs.doc: Controls how the child items of the container are aligned.

Ext.layout.container.Table.doc: This layout allows you to easily render content into an HTML table. The total number of columns can be specified, and rowspan and colspan can be used to create complex layouts within the table. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout: {type: 'table'} Ext.container.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword.

configs.name: columns
configs.doc: The total number of columns to create in the table for this layout. If not specified, all Components added to this layout will be rendered into a single row using one column per Component.

configs.name: tableAttrs
configs.doc: An object containing properties which are added to the DomHelper specification used to create the layout's <table> element.

configs.name: tdAttrs
configs.doc: An object containing properties which are added to the DomHelper specification used to create the layout's elements.

configs.name: trAttrs
configs.doc: An object containing properties which are added to the DomHelper specification used to create the layout's elements.

Ext.layout.container.VBox.doc: A layout that arranges items vertically down a Container. This layout optionally divides available vertical space between child items containing a numeric flex configuration.

configs.name: align
configs.doc: Controls how the child items of the container are aligned.

Ext.layout.Layout.doc: Base Layout class - extended by ComponentLayout and ContainerLayout

Ext.Loader.doc: Ext.Loader is the heart of the new dynamic dependency loading capability in Ext JS 4+. It is most commonly used via the Ext.require shorthand. Ext.Loader supports both asynchronous and synchronous loading approaches, and leverage their advantages for the best development flow. We'll discuss about the pros and cons of each approach:

configs.name: disableCaching
configs.doc: Appends current timestamp to script files to prevent caching.

configs.name: disableCachingParam
configs.doc: The get parameter name for the cache buster's timestamp.

configs.name: enabled
configs.doc: Whether or not to enable the dynamic dependency loading feature.

configs.name: paths
configs.doc: The mapping from namespaces to file paths

Ext.LoadMask.doc: A modal, floating Component which may be shown above a specified Element, or a specified Component while loading data. When shown, the configured owning Element or Component will be covered with a modality mask, and the LoadMask's msg will be displayed centered, accompanied by a spinner image.

configs.name: msg
configs.doc: The text to display in a centered loading message box.

configs.name: msgCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to apply to the loading message element.

configs.name: store
configs.doc: Optional Store to which the mask is bound. The mask is displayed when a load request is issued, and hidden on either load success, or load fail.

configs.name: useMsg
configs.doc: Whether or not to use a loading message class or simply mask the bound element.

Ext.menu.CheckItem.doc: A menu item that contains a togglable checkbox by default, but that can also be a part of a radio group.

configs.name: checkedCls
configs.doc: The CSS class used by cls to show the checked state. Defaults to Ext.baseCSSPrefix + 'menu-item-checked'.

configs.name: groupCls
configs.doc: The CSS class applied to this item's icon image to denote being a part of a radio group. Defaults to Ext.baseCSSClass + 'menu-group-icon'. Any specified iconCls overrides this.

configs.name: hideOnClick
configs.doc: Whether to not to hide the owning menu when this item is clicked. Defaults to false for checkbox items, and to true for radio group items.

configs.name: uncheckedCls
configs.doc: The CSS class used by cls to show the unchecked state. Defaults to Ext.baseCSSPrefix + 'menu-item-unchecked'.

events.name: beforecheckchange
events.doc: Fires before a change event. Return false to cancel.

events.name: checkchange
events.doc: Fires after a change event.

configs.name: hideOnClick
configs.doc: False to continue showing the menu after a color is selected.

configs.name: pickerId
configs.doc: An id to assign to the underlying color picker.

events.name: select
events.doc: Fires when a color is selected

configs.name: hideOnClick
configs.doc: False to continue showing the menu after a date is selected.

configs.name: pickerId
configs.doc: An id to assign to the underlying date picker.

events.name: select
events.doc: Fires when a date is selected

Ext.menu.Item.doc: A base class for all menu items that require menu-related functionality such as click handling, sub-menus, icons, etc.

configs.name: activeCls
configs.doc: The CSS class added to the menu item when the item is activated (focused/mouseover). Defaults to Ext.baseCSSPrefix + 'menu-item-active'.

configs.name: canActivate
configs.doc: Whether or not this menu item can be activated when focused/mouseovered. Defaults to true.

configs.name: clickHideDelay
configs.doc: The delay in milliseconds to wait before hiding the menu after clicking the menu item. This only has an effect when hideOnClick: true. Defaults to 1.

configs.name: destroyMenu
configs.doc: Whether or not to destroy any associated sub-menu when this item is destroyed. Defaults to true.

configs.name: disabledCls
configs.doc: The CSS class added to the menu item when the item is disabled. Defaults to Ext.baseCSSPrefix + 'menu-item-disabled'.

configs.name: hideOnClick
configs.doc: Whether to not to hide the owning menu when this item is clicked. Defaults to true.

configs.name: href
configs.doc: The href attribute to use for the underlying anchor link. Defaults to #.

configs.name: hrefTarget
configs.doc: The target attribute to use for the underlying anchor link. Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: icon
configs.doc: The path to an icon to display in this item. Defaults to Ext.BLANK_IMAGE_URL.

configs.name: iconCls
configs.doc: A CSS class that specifies a background-image to use as the icon for this item. Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: menuAlign
configs.doc: The default Ext.Element.getAlignToXY anchor position value for this item's sub-menu relative to this item's position. Defaults to 'tl-tr?'.

configs.name: menuExpandDelay
configs.doc: The delay in milliseconds before this item's sub-menu expands after this item is moused over. Defaults to 200.

configs.name: menuHideDelay
configs.doc: The delay in milliseconds before this item's sub-menu hides after this item is moused out. Defaults to 200.

configs.name: plain
configs.doc: Whether or not this item is plain text/html with no icon or visual activation. Defaults to false.

configs.name: text
configs.doc: The text/html to display in this item. Defaults to undefined.

events.name: activate
events.doc: Fires when this item is activated

events.name: click
events.doc: Fires when this item is clicked

events.name: deactivate
events.doc: Fires when this tiem is deactivated

Ext.menu.Manager.doc: Provides a common registry of all menus on a page.

Ext.menu.Menu.doc: A menu object. This is the container to which you may add menu items.

configs.name: allowOtherMenus
configs.doc: True to allow multiple menus to be displayed at the same time.

configs.name: defaultAlign
configs.doc: The default Ext.Element#getAlignToXY anchor position value for this menu relative to its element of origin.

configs.name: floating
configs.doc: A Menu configured as floating: true (the default) will be rendered as an absolutely positioned, floating Component. If configured as floating: false, the Menu may be used as a child item of another Container.

configs.name: hidden
configs.doc: True to initially render the Menu as hidden, requiring to be shown manually.

configs.name: ignoreParentClicks
configs.doc: True to ignore clicks on any item in this menu that is a parent item (displays a submenu) so that the submenu is not dismissed when clicking the parent item.

configs.name: minWidth
configs.doc: The minimum width of the Menu.

configs.name: plain
configs.doc: True to remove the incised line down the left side of the menu and to not indent general Component items.

configs.name: showSeparator
configs.doc: True to show the icon separator.

events.name: click
events.doc: Fires when this menu is clicked

events.name: mouseenter
events.doc: Fires when the mouse enters this menu

events.name: mouseleave
events.doc: Fires when the mouse leaves this menu

events.name: mouseover
events.doc: Fires when the mouse is hovering over this menu

Ext.menu.Separator.doc: Adds a separator bar to a menu, used to divide logical groups of menu items. Generally you will add one of these by using - in your call to add() or in your items config rather than creating one directly.

configs.name: separatorCls
configs.doc: The CSS class used by the separator item to show the incised line. Defaults to Ext.baseCSSPrefix + 'menu-item-separator'.

Ext.ModelManager.doc: The ModelManager keeps track of all Ext.data.Model types defined in your application.

Ext.Number.doc: A collection of useful static methods to deal with numbers

Ext.Object.doc: A collection of useful static methods to deal with objects.

Ext.panel.AbstractPanel.doc: A base class which provides methods common to Panel classes across the Sencha product range.

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class to apply to this panel's element.

configs.name: bodyBorder
configs.doc: A shortcut to add or remove the border on the body of a panel. This only applies to a panel which has the frame configuration set to true.

configs.name: bodyCls
configs.doc: A CSS class, space-delimited string of classes, or array of classes to be applied to the panel's body element.

configs.name: bodyPadding
configs.doc: A shortcut for setting a padding style on the body element. The value can either be a number to be applied to all sides, or a normal css string describing padding.

configs.name: bodyStyle
configs.doc: Custom CSS styles to be applied to the panel's body element, which can be supplied as a valid CSS style string, an object containing style property name/value pairs or a function that returns such a string or object.

configs.name: defaultDockWeights
configs.doc: This object holds the default weights applied to dockedItems that have no weight. These start with a weight of 1, to allow negative weights to insert before top items and are odd numbers so that even weights can be used to get between different dock orders.

configs.name: dockedItems
configs.doc: A component or series of components to be added as docked items to this panel. The docked items can be docked to either the top, right, left or bottom of a panel.

events.name: bodyresize
events.doc: Fires after the Panel has been resized.

Ext.panel.Header.doc: Simple header class which is used for on Ext.panel.Panel and Ext.window.Window

configs.name: iconCls
configs.doc: CSS class for icon in header. Used for displaying an icon to the left of a title.

configs.name: title
configs.doc: The title text to display

Ext.panel.Panel.doc: Panel is a container that has specific functionality and structural components that make it the perfect building block for application-oriented user interfaces.

configs.name: animCollapse
configs.doc: true to animate the transition when the panel is collapsed, false to skip the animation (defaults to true if the Ext.fx.Anim class is available, otherwise false). May also be specified as the animation duration in milliseconds.

configs.name: bbar
configs.doc: Convenience config. Short for 'Bottom Bar'.

configs.name: buttonAlign
configs.doc: The alignment of any buttons added to this panel. Valid values are 'right', 'left' and 'center' (defaults to 'right' for buttons/fbar, 'left' for other toolbar types).

configs.name: buttons
configs.doc: Convenience config used for adding buttons docked to the bottom of the panel. This is a synonym for the fbar config.

configs.name: closable
configs.doc: True to display the 'close' tool button and allow the user to close the window, false to hide the button and disallow closing the window.

configs.name: closeAction
configs.doc: The action to take when the close header tool is clicked.

configs.name: collapseDirection
configs.doc: The direction to collapse the Panel when the toggle button is clicked.

configs.name: collapseFirst
configs.doc: true to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the panel's title bar, false to render it last.

configs.name: collapseMode
configs.doc: Important: this config is only effective for collapsible Panels which are direct child items of a border layout.

configs.name: collapsed
configs.doc: true to render the panel collapsed, false to render it expanded.

configs.name: collapsedCls
configs.doc: A CSS class to add to the panel's element after it has been collapsed.

configs.name: collapsible
configs.doc: True to make the panel collapsible and have an expand/collapse toggle Tool added into the header tool button area. False to keep the panel sized either statically, or by an owning layout manager, with no toggle Tool.

configs.name: dockedItems
configs.doc: A component or series of components to be added as docked items to this panel. The docked items can be docked to either the top, right, left or bottom of a panel. This is typically used for things like toolbars or tab bars.

configs.name: fbar
configs.doc: Convenience config used for adding items to the bottom of the panel. Short for Footer Bar.

configs.name: floatable
configs.doc: Important: This config is only effective for collapsible Panels which are direct child items of a border layout.

configs.name: frame
configs.doc: True to apply a frame to the panel.

configs.name: frameHeader
configs.doc: True to apply a frame to the panel panels header (if 'frame' is true).

configs.name: headerPosition
configs.doc: Specify as 'top', 'bottom', 'left' or 'right'.

configs.name: hideCollapseTool
configs.doc: true to hide the expand/collapse toggle button when collapsible == true, false to display it.

configs.name: iconCls
configs.doc: CSS class for icon in header. Used for displaying an icon to the left of a title.

configs.name: lbar
configs.doc: Convenience config. Short for 'Left Bar' (left-docked, vertical toolbar).

configs.name: minButtonWidth
configs.doc: Minimum width of all footer toolbar buttons in pixels. If set, this will be used as the default value for the Ext.button.Button.minWidth config of each Button added to the footer toolbar via the fbar or buttons configurations. It will be ignored for buttons that have a minWidth configured some other way, e.g. in their own config object or via the defaults of their parent container.

configs.name: overlapHeader
configs.doc: True to overlap the header in a panel over the framing of the panel itself. This is needed when frame:true (and is done automatically for you). Otherwise it is undefined. If you manually add rounded corners to a panel header which does not have frame:true, this will need to be set to true.

configs.name: placeholder
configs.doc: Important: This config is only effective for collapsible Panels which are direct child items of a border layout when not using the 'header' collapseMode.

configs.name: preventHeader
configs.doc: Prevent a Header from being created and shown.

configs.name: rbar
configs.doc: Convenience config. Short for 'Right Bar' (right-docked, vertical toolbar).

configs.name: tbar
configs.doc: Convenience config. Short for 'Top Bar'.

configs.name: title
configs.doc: The title text to be used to display in the panel header. When a title is specified the Ext.panel.Header will automatically be created and displayed unless preventHeader is set to true.

configs.name: titleCollapse
configs.doc: true to allow expanding and collapsing the panel (when collapsible = true) by clicking anywhere in the header bar, false) to allow it only by clicking to tool butto).

configs.name: tools
configs.doc: An array of Ext.panel.Tool configs/instances to be added to the header tool area. The tools are stored as child components of the header container. They can be accessed using down and {query}, as well as the other component methods. The toggle tool is automatically created if collapsible is set to true.

events.name: beforeclose
events.doc: Fires before the user closes the panel. Return false from any listener to stop the close event being fired

events.name: beforecollapse
events.doc: Fires before this panel is collapsed. Return false to prevent the collapse.

events.name: beforeexpand
events.doc: Fires before this panel is expanded. Return false to prevent the expand.

events.name: collapse
events.doc: Fires after this Panel hass collapsed.

events.name: expand
events.doc: Fires after this Panel has expanded.

events.name: iconchange
events.doc: Fires after the Panel iconCls has been set or changed.

events.name: titlechange
events.doc: Fires after the Panel title has been set or changed.

Ext.panel.Proxy.doc: A custom drag proxy implementation specific to Ext.panel.Panels. This class is primarily used internally for the Panel's drag drop implementation, and should never need to be created directly.

configs.name: insertProxy
configs.doc: True to insert a placeholder proxy element while dragging the panel, false to drag with no proxy. Most Panels are not absolute positioned and therefore we need to reserve this space.

Ext.panel.Table.doc: TablePanel is the basis of both TreePanel and GridPanel.

configs.name: columns
configs.doc: An array of column definition objects which define all columns that appear in this grid. Each column definition provides the header text for the column, and a definition of where the data for that column comes from.

configs.name: deferRowRender
configs.doc: Defaults to true to enable deferred row rendering.

configs.name: enableColumnHide
configs.doc: False to disable column hiding within this grid.

configs.name: enableColumnMove
configs.doc: False to disable column dragging within this grid.

configs.name: enableColumnResize
configs.doc: False to disable column resizing within this grid.

configs.name: enableLocking
configs.doc: True to enable locking support for this grid. Alternatively, locking will also be automatically enabled if any of the columns in the column configuration contain the locked config option.

configs.name: features
configs.doc: An array of grid Features to be added to this grid. See Ext.grid.feature.Feature for usage.

configs.name: forceFit
configs.doc: True to force the columns to fit into the available width. Headers are first sized according to configuration, whether that be a specific width, or flex. Then they are all proportionally changed in width so that the entire content width is used.

configs.name: hideHeaders
configs.doc: True to hide column headers.

configs.name: multiSelect
configs.doc: True to enable 'MULTI' selection mode on selection model. See Ext.selection.Model.mode.

configs.name: scroll
configs.doc: Scrollers configuration. Valid values are 'both', 'horizontal' or 'vertical'. True implies 'both'. False implies 'none'.

configs.name: scrollDelta
configs.doc: Number of pixels to scroll when scrolling with mousewheel.

configs.name: selModel
configs.doc: A selection model instance or config object. In latter case the selType config option determines to which type of selection model this config is applied.

configs.name: selType
configs.doc: An xtype of selection model to use. Defaults to 'rowmodel'. This is used to create selection model if just a config object or nothing at all given in selModel config.

configs.name: simpleSelect
configs.doc: True to enable 'SIMPLE' selection mode on selection model. See Ext.selection.Model.mode.

configs.name: sortableColumns
configs.doc: False to disable column sorting via clicking the header and via the Sorting menu items.

configs.name: store
configs.doc: The Store the grid should use as its data source.

configs.name: view
configs.doc: The Ext.view.Table used by the grid. Use viewConfig to just supply some config options to view (instead of creating an entire View instance).

configs.name: viewConfig
configs.doc: A config object that will be applied to the grid's UI view. Any of the config options available for Ext.view.Table can be specified here. This option is ignored if view is specified.

configs.name: viewType
configs.doc: An xtype of view to use. This is automatically set to 'gridview' by Grid and to 'treeview' by Tree.

events.name: beforecontainerclick
events.doc: Fires before the click event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainercontextmenu
events.doc: Fires before the contextmenu event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainerdblclick
events.doc: Fires before the dblclick event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainermousedown
events.doc: Fires before the mousedown event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainermouseout
events.doc: Fires before the mouseout event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainermouseover
events.doc: Fires before the mouseover event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainermouseup
events.doc: Fires before the mouseup event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforedeselect
events.doc: Fired before a record is deselected. If any listener returns false, the deselection is cancelled.

events.name: beforeitemclick
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the click event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemcontextmenu
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the contextmenu event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemdblclick
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the dblclick event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemmousedown
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the mousedown event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemmouseenter
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the mouseenter event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemmouseleave
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the mouseleave event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemmouseup
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the mouseup event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeselect
events.doc: Fired before a record is selected. If any listener returns false, the selection is cancelled.

events.name: columnhide
columnmove
columnresize
columnshow
containerclick
events.doc: Fires when the container is clicked.

events.name: containercontextmenu
events.doc: Fires when the container is right clicked.

events.name: containerdblclick
events.doc: Fires when the container is double clicked.

events.name: containermouseout
events.doc: Fires when you move the mouse out of the container.

events.name: containermouseover
events.doc: Fires when you move the mouse over the container.

events.name: containermouseup
events.doc: Fires when there is a mouse up on the container

events.name: deselect
events.doc: Fired after a record is deselected

events.name: itemclick
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when an item is clicked.

events.name: itemcontextmenu
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when an item is right clicked.

events.name: itemdblclick
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when an item is double clicked.

events.name: itemmousedown
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when there is a mouse down on an item

events.name: itemmouseenter
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when the mouse enters an item.

events.name: itemmouseleave
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when the mouse leaves an item.

events.name: itemmouseup
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when there is a mouse up on an item

events.name: reconfigure
events.doc: Fires after a reconfigure.

events.name: scrollerhide
events.doc: Fires when a scroller is hidden.

events.name: scrollershow
events.doc: Fires when a scroller is shown.

events.name: select
events.doc: Fired after a record is selected

events.name: selectionchange
events.doc: Fired after a selection change has occurred

events.name: sortchange
viewready
events.doc: Fires when the grid view is available (use this for selecting a default row).

Ext.panel.Tool.doc: This class is used to display small visual icons in the header of a panel. There are a set of 25 icons that can be specified by using the type config. The handler config can be used to provide a function that will respond to any click events.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope to execute the handler function. Defaults to the tool.

configs.name: stopEvent
configs.doc: Specify as false to allow click event to propagate.

configs.name: tooltip
configs.doc: The tooltip for the tool - can be a string to be used as innerHTML (html tags are accepted) or QuickTips config object

configs.name: tooltipType
configs.doc: The type of tooltip to use. Either 'qtip' (default) for QuickTips or 'title' for title attribute.

configs.name: type
configs.doc: The type of tool to render.

events.name: click
events.doc: Fires when the tool is clicked

Ext.picker.Color.doc: Color picker provides a simple color palette for choosing colors. The picker can be rendered to any container. The available default to a standard 40-color palette; this can be customized with the colors config.

configs.name: allowReselect
configs.doc: If set to true then reselecting a color that is already selected fires the select event

configs.name: clickEvent
configs.doc: The DOM event that will cause a color to be selected. This can be any valid event name (dblclick, contextmenu).

configs.name: componentCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to apply to the containing element.

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function will be called. Defaults to this Color picker instance.

configs.name: selectedCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to apply to the selected element

configs.name: value
configs.doc: The initial color to highlight (should be a valid 6-digit color hex code without the # symbol). Note that the hex codes are case-sensitive.

events.name: select
events.doc: Fires when a color is selected

Ext.picker.Date.doc: A date picker. This class is used by the Ext.form.field.Date field to allow browsing and selection of valid dates in a popup next to the field, but may also be used with other components.

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class to apply to this components element.

configs.name: dayNames
configs.doc: An array of textual day names which can be overriden for localization support (defaults to Ext.Date.dayNames)

configs.name: disableAnim
configs.doc: True to disable animations when showing the month picker.

configs.name: disabledCellCls
configs.doc: The class to apply to disabled cells.

configs.name: disabledDates
configs.doc: An array of 'dates' to disable, as strings. These strings will be used to build a dynamic regular expression so they are very powerful.

configs.name: disabledDatesRE
configs.doc: JavaScript regular expression used to disable a pattern of dates. The disabledDates config will generate this regex internally, but if you specify disabledDatesRE it will take precedence over the disabledDates value.

configs.name: disabledDatesText
configs.doc: The tooltip text to display when the date falls on a disabled date.

configs.name: disabledDays
configs.doc: An array of days to disable, 0-based. For example, [0, 6] disables Sunday and Saturday.

configs.name: disabledDaysText
configs.doc: The tooltip to display when the date falls on a disabled day.

configs.name: focusOnShow
configs.doc: True to automatically focus the picker on show.

configs.name: format
configs.doc: The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support. The format must be valid according to Ext.Date.parse (defaults to Ext.Date.defaultFormat).

configs.name: keyNavConfig
configs.doc: Specifies optional custom key event handlers for the Ext.util.KeyNav attached to this date picker. Must conform to the config format recognized by the Ext.util.KeyNav constructor. Handlers specified in this object will replace default handlers of the same name.

configs.name: longDayFormat
configs.doc: The format for displaying a date in a longer format.

configs.name: maxDate
configs.doc: Maximum allowable date (JavaScript date object)

configs.name: maxText
configs.doc: The error text to display if the maxDate validation fails.
configs.default: This date is after the maximum date

configs.name: minDate
configs.doc: Minimum allowable date (JavaScript date object)

configs.name: minText
configs.doc: The error text to display if the minDate validation fails.
configs.default: This date is before the minimum date

configs.name: monthNames
configs.doc: An array of textual month names which can be overriden for localization support (defaults to Ext.Date.monthNames)

configs.name: monthYearText
configs.doc: The header month selector tooltip
configs.default: Choose a month (Control+Up/Down to move years)

configs.name: nextText
configs.doc: The next month navigation button tooltip

configs.name: prevText
configs.doc: The previous month navigation button tooltip

configs.name: scope
configs.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function will be called. Defaults to this DatePicker instance.

configs.name: selectedCls
configs.doc: The class to apply to the selected cell.

configs.name: showToday
configs.doc: False to hide the footer area containing the Today button and disable the keyboard handler for spacebar that selects the current date.

configs.name: startDay
configs.doc: Day index at which the week should begin, 0-based (defaults to Sunday)

configs.name: todayText
configs.doc: The text to display on the button that selects the current date

configs.name: todayTip
configs.doc: A string used to format the message for displaying in a tooltip over the button that selects the current date. The {0} token in string is replaced by today's date.

events.name: select
events.doc: Fires when a date is selected

Ext.picker.Month.doc: A month picker component. This class is used by the Date picker class to allow browsing and selection of year/months combinations.

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class to apply to the picker element. Defaults to 'x-monthpicker'

configs.name: cancelText
configs.doc: The text to display on the cancel button.

configs.name: okText
configs.doc: The text to display on the ok button.

configs.name: selectedCls
configs.doc: The class to be added to selected items in the picker. Defaults to 'x-monthpicker-selected'

configs.name: showButtons
configs.doc: True to show ok and cancel buttons below the picker.

configs.name: value
configs.doc: The default value to set. See setValue

events.name: cancelclick
events.doc: Fires when the cancel button is pressed.

events.name: monthclick
events.doc: Fires when a month is clicked.

events.name: monthdblclick
events.doc: Fires when a month is clicked.

events.name: okclick
events.doc: Fires when the ok button is pressed.

events.name: select
events.doc: Fires when a month/year is selected.

events.name: yearclick
events.doc: Fires when a year is clicked.

events.name: yeardblclick
events.doc: Fires when a year is clicked.

Ext.picker.Time.doc: A time picker which provides a list of times from which to choose. This is used by the Ext.form.field.Time class to allow browsing and selection of valid times, but could also be used with other components.

configs.name: format
configs.doc: The default time format string which can be overriden for localization support. The format must be valid according to Ext.Date.parse (defaults to 'g:i A', e.g., '3:15 PM'). For 24-hour time format try 'H:i' instead.

configs.name: increment
configs.doc: The number of minutes between each time value in the list.

configs.name: maxValue
configs.doc: The maximum time to be shown in the list of times. This must be a Date object (only the time fields will be used); no parsing of String values will be done.

configs.name: minValue
configs.doc: The minimum time to be shown in the list of times. This must be a Date object (only the time fields will be used); no parsing of String values will be done.

Ext.PluginManager.doc: Provides a registry of available Plugin classes indexed by a mnemonic code known as the Plugin's ptype.

Ext.ProgressBar.doc: An updateable progress bar component. The progress bar supports two different modes: manual and automatic.

configs.name: animate
configs.doc: True to animate the progress bar during transitions

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class to apply to the progress bar's wrapper element.

configs.name: id
configs.doc: The progress bar element's id (defaults to an auto-generated id)

configs.name: text
configs.doc: The text shown in the progress bar

configs.name: textEl
configs.doc: The element to render the progress text to (defaults to the progress bar's internal text element)

configs.name: value
configs.doc: A floating point value between 0 and 1 (e.g., .5)

events.name: update
events.doc: Fires after each update interval

Ext.resizer.Handle.doc: Provides a handle for 9-point resizing of Elements or Components.

Ext.resizer.Resizer.doc: Applies drag handles to an element or component to make it resizable. The drag handles are inserted into the element (or component's element) and positioned absolute.

configs.name: constrainTo
configs.doc: An element, or a Region into which the resize operation must be constrained.

configs.name: dynamic
configs.doc: Specify as true to update the target (Element or Component) dynamically during dragging. This is true by default, but the Component class passes false when it is configured as Ext.Component.resizable.

configs.name: handles
configs.doc: String consisting of the resize handles to display. Defaults to 's e se' for Elements and fixed position Components. Defaults to 8 point resizing for floating Components (such as Windows). Specify either 'all' or any of 'n s e w ne nw se sw'.

configs.name: height
configs.doc: Optional. The height to set target to in pixels

configs.name: heightIncrement
configs.doc: The increment to snap the height resize in pixels.

configs.name: maxHeight
configs.doc: The maximum height for the element

configs.name: maxWidth
configs.doc: The maximum width for the element

configs.name: minHeight
configs.doc: The minimum height for the element

configs.name: minWidth
