configs.doc: The minimum width for the element

configs.name: pinned
configs.doc: True to ensure that the resize handles are always visible, false indicates resizing by cursor changes only

configs.name: preserveRatio
configs.doc: True to preserve the original ratio between height and width during resize

configs.name: target
configs.doc: The Element or Component to resize.

configs.name: transparent
configs.doc: True for transparent handles. This is only applied at config time.

configs.name: width
configs.doc: Optional. The width to set the target to in pixels

configs.name: widthIncrement
configs.doc: The increment to snap the width resize in pixels.

events.name: beforeresize
events.doc: Fired before resize is allowed. Return false to cancel resize.

events.name: resize
events.doc: Fired after a resize.

events.name: resizedrag
events.doc: Fires during resizing. Return false to cancel resize.

Ext.resizer.Splitter.doc: This class functions between siblings of a VBox or HBox layout to resize both immediate siblings.

configs.name: collapseOnDblClick
configs.doc: true to enable dblclick to toggle expand and collapse on the collapseTarget Panel.

configs.name: collapseTarget
configs.doc: A string describing the relative position of the immediate sibling Panel to collapse. May be 'prev' or 'next' (Defaults to 'next')

configs.name: collapsedCls
configs.doc: A class to add to the splitter when it is collapsed. See collapsible.

configs.name: collapsible
configs.doc: true to show a mini-collapse tool in the Splitter to toggle expand and collapse on the collapseTarget Panel. Defaults to the collapsible setting of the Panel.

configs.name: defaultSplitMax
configs.doc: Provides a default maximum width or height for the two components that the splitter is between.

configs.name: defaultSplitMin
configs.doc: Provides a default minimum width or height for the two components that the splitter is between.

configs.name: performCollapse
configs.doc: Set to false to prevent this Splitter's mini-collapse tool from managing the collapse state of the collapseTarget.

configs.name: enableKeyNav
configs.doc: Turns on/off keyboard navigation within the grid.

configs.name: preventWrap
configs.doc: Set this configuration to true to prevent wrapping around of selection as a user navigates to the first or last column.

events.name: deselect
events.doc: Fired after a cell is deselected

events.name: select
events.doc: Fired after a cell is selected

Ext.selection.CheckboxModel.doc: A selection model that renders a column of checkboxes that can be toggled to select or deselect rows. The default mode for this selection model is MULTI.

configs.name: checkOnly
configs.doc: true if rows can only be selected by clicking on the checkbox column.

configs.name: injectCheckbox
configs.doc: Instructs the SelectionModel whether or not to inject the checkbox header automatically or not. (Note: By not placing the checkbox in manually, the grid view will need to be rendered 2x on initial render.) Supported values are a Number index, false and the strings 'first' and 'last'.

configs.name: mode
configs.doc: Modes of selection. Valid values are SINGLE, SIMPLE, and MULTI. Defaults to 'MULTI'

Ext.selection.Model.doc: Tracks what records are currently selected in a databound component.

configs.name: allowDeselect
configs.doc: Allow users to deselect a record in a DataView, List or Grid. Only applicable when the mode is 'SINGLE'.

configs.name: mode
configs.doc: Mode of selection.

events.name: selectionchange
events.doc: Fired after a selection change has occurred

configs.name: enableKeyNav
configs.doc: Turns on/off keyboard navigation within the grid.

configs.name: ignoreRightMouseSelection
configs.doc: True to ignore selections that are made when using the right mouse button if there are records that are already selected. If no records are selected, selection will continue as normal

events.name: beforedeselect
events.doc: Fired before a record is deselected. If any listener returns false, the deselection is cancelled.

events.name: beforeselect
events.doc: Fired before a record is selected. If any listener returns false, the selection is cancelled.

events.name: deselect
events.doc: Fired after a record is deselected

events.name: select
events.doc: Fired after a record is selected

Ext.selection.TreeModel.doc: Adds custom behavior for left/right keyboard navigation for use with a tree. Depends on the view having an expand and collapse method which accepts a record.

Ext.Shadow.doc: Simple class that can provide a shadow effect for any element. Note that the element MUST be absolutely positioned, and the shadow does not provide any shimming. This should be used only in simple cases -- for more advanced functionality that can also provide the same shadow effect, see the Ext.Layer class.

configs.name: mode
configs.doc:
The shadow display mode. Supports the following options:

  • sides : Shadow displays on both sides and bottom only
  • frame : Shadow displays equally on all four sides
  • drop : Traditional bottom-right drop shadow

configs.name: offset
configs.doc: The number of pixels to offset the shadow from the element

Ext.ShadowPool.doc: Private utility class that manages the internal Shadow cache

Ext.slider.Multi.doc: Slider which supports vertical or horizontal orientation, keyboard adjustments, configurable snapping, axis clicking and animation. Can be added as an item to any container.

configs.name: animate
configs.doc: Turn on or off animation.

configs.name: clickToChange
configs.doc: Determines whether or not clicking on the Slider axis will change the slider.

configs.name: constrainThumbs
configs.doc: True to disallow thumbs from overlapping one another.

configs.name: decimalPrecision
configs.doc: The number of decimal places to which to round the Slider's value.

configs.name: increment
configs.doc: How many units to change the slider when adjusting by drag and drop. Use this option to enable 'snapping'.

configs.name: keyIncrement
configs.doc: How many units to change the Slider when adjusting with keyboard navigation. If the increment config is larger, it will be used instead.

configs.name: maxValue
configs.doc: The maximum value for the Slider.

configs.name: minValue
configs.doc: The minimum value for the Slider.

configs.name: useTips
configs.doc: True to use an Ext.slider.Tip to display tips for the value.

configs.name: value
configs.doc: A value with which to initialize the slider. Defaults to minValue. Setting this will only result in the creation of a single slider thumb; if you want multiple thumbs then use the values config instead.

configs.name: values
configs.doc: Array of Number values with which to initalize the slider. A separate slider thumb will be created for each value in this array. This will take precedence over the single value config.

configs.name: vertical
configs.doc: Orient the Slider vertically rather than horizontally.

events.name: beforechange
events.doc: Fires before the slider value is changed. By returning false from an event handler, you can cancel the event and prevent the slider from changing.

events.name: change
events.doc: Fires when the slider value is changed.

events.name: changecomplete
events.doc: Fires when the slider value is changed by the user and any drag operations have completed.

events.name: drag
events.doc: Fires continuously during the drag operation while the mouse is moving.

events.name: dragend
events.doc: Fires after the drag operation has completed.

events.name: dragstart
events.doc: Fires after a drag operation has started.

Ext.slider.Single.doc: Slider which supports vertical or horizontal orientation, keyboard adjustments, configurable snapping, axis clicking and animation. Can be added as an item to any container.

Ext.slider.Thumb.doc: Represents a single thumb element on a Slider. This would not usually be created manually and would instead be created internally by an Multi slider.

configs.name: constrain
configs.doc: True to constrain the thumb so that it cannot overlap its siblings

configs.name: slider
configs.doc: The Slider to render to.

Ext.slider.Tip.doc: Simple plugin for using an Ext.tip.Tip with a slider to show the slider value. In general this class is not created directly, instead pass the Ext.slider.Multi.useTips and Ext.slider.Multi.tipText configuration options to the slider directly.

Ext.state.CookieProvider.doc: A Provider implementation which saves and retrieves state via cookies. The CookieProvider supports the usual cookie options, such as:

configs.name: domain
configs.doc: The domain to save the cookie for. Note that you cannot specify a different domain than your page is on, but you can specify a sub-domain, or simply the domain itself like 'sencha.com' to include all sub-domains if you need to access cookies across different sub-domains. Defaults to null which uses the same domain the page is running on including the 'www' like 'www.sencha.com'.

configs.name: expires
configs.doc: The cookie expiration date. Defaults to 7 days from now.

configs.name: path
configs.doc: The path for which the cookie is active. Defaults to root '/' which makes it active for all pages in the site.

configs.name: secure
configs.doc: True if the site is using SSL

Ext.state.LocalStorageProvider.doc: A Provider implementation which saves and retrieves state via the HTML5 localStorage object. If the browser does not support local storage, an exception will be thrown upon instantiating this class.

Ext.state.Manager.doc: This is the global state manager. By default all components that are state aware check this class for state information if you don't pass them a custom state provider. In order for this class to be useful, it must be initialized with a provider when your application initializes. Example usage:

Ext.state.Provider.doc: Abstract base class for state provider implementations. The provider is responsible for setting values and extracting values to/from the underlying storage source. The storage source can vary and the details should be implemented in a subclass. For example a provider could use a server side database or the browser localstorage where supported.

configs.name: prefix
configs.doc: A string to prefix to items stored in the underlying state store. Defaults to 'ext-'

events.name: statechange
events.doc: Fires when a state change occurs.

Ext.state.Stateful.doc: A mixin for being able to save the state of an object to an underlying Ext.state.Provider.

configs.name: saveDelay
configs.doc: A buffer to be applied if many state events are fired within a short period.

configs.name: stateEvents
configs.doc: An array of events that, when fired, should trigger this object to save its state. Defaults to none. stateEvents may be any type of event supported by this object, including browser or custom events (e.g., ['click', 'customerchange']).

configs.name: stateId
configs.doc: The unique id for this object to use for state management purposes.

configs.name: stateful
configs.doc: A flag which causes the object to attempt to restore the state of internal properties from a saved state on startup.

events.name: beforestaterestore
events.doc: Fires before the state of the object is restored. Return false from an event handler to stop the restore.

events.name: beforestatesave
events.doc: Fires before the state of the object is saved to the configured state provider. Return false to stop the save.

events.name: staterestore
events.doc: Fires after the state of the object is restored.

events.name: statesave
events.doc: Fires after the state of the object is saved to the configured state provider.

Ext.String.doc: A collection of useful static methods to deal with strings

Ext.supports.doc: Determines information about features are supported in the current environment

Ext.tab.Bar.doc: TabBar is used internally by a TabPanel and typically should not need to be created manually. The tab bar automatically removes the default title provided by Ext.panel.Header

configs.name: maxTabWidth
configs.doc: The maximum width for a tab in this tab Bar. Defaults to the tab Panel's maxTabWidth value.

configs.name: minTabWidth
configs.doc: The minimum width for a tab in this tab Bar. Defaults to the tab Panel's minTabWidth value.

configs.name: plain
configs.doc: True to not show the full background on the tabbar

events.name: change
events.doc: Fired when the currently-active tab has changed

Ext.tab.Panel.doc: A basic tab container. TabPanels can be used exactly like a standard Ext.panel.Panel for layout purposes, but also have special support for containing child Components (items) that are displayed as separate tabs.

configs.name: activeItem
configs.doc: Doesn't apply for TabPanel, use activeTab instead.

configs.name: activeTab
configs.doc: The tab to activate initially. Either an ID, index or the tab component itself.

configs.name: deferredRender
configs.doc: True by default to defer the rendering of child items to the browsers DOM until a tab is activated. False will render all contained items as soon as the layout is rendered. If there is a significant amount of content or a lot of heavy controls being rendered into panels that are not displayed by default, setting this to true might improve performance.

configs.name: itemCls
configs.doc: The class added to each child item of this TabPanel.

configs.name: layout
configs.doc: Optional configuration object for the internal card layout. If present, this is passed straight through to the layout's constructor

configs.name: maxTabWidth
configs.doc: The maximum width for each tab.

configs.name: minTabWidth
configs.doc: The minimum width for a tab in the tabBar.

configs.name: plain
configs.doc: True to not show the full background on the TabBar.

configs.name: removePanelHeader
configs.doc: True to instruct each Panel added to the TabContainer to not render its header element. This is to ensure that the title of the panel does not appear twice.

configs.name: tabBar
configs.doc: Optional configuration object for the internal Ext.tab.Bar. If present, this is passed straight through to the TabBar's constructor

configs.name: tabPosition
configs.doc: The position where the tab strip should be rendered. Can be top or bottom.

events.name: beforetabchange
events.doc: Fires before a tab change (activated by setActiveTab). Return false in any listener to cancel the tabchange

events.name: tabchange
events.doc: Fires when a new tab has been activated (activated by setActiveTab).

Ext.tab.Tab.doc: Represents a single Tab in a TabPanel. A Tab is simply a slightly customized Button, styled to look like a tab. Tabs are optionally closable, and can also be disabled. Typically you will not need to create Tabs manually as the framework does so automatically when you use a TabPanel

configs.name: activeCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to be applied to a Tab when it is active. Providing your own CSS for this class enables you to customize the active state.

configs.name: closable
configs.doc: True to make the Tab start closable (the close icon will be visible).

configs.name: closableCls
configs.doc: The CSS class which is added to the tab when it is closable

configs.name: closeText
configs.doc: The accessible text label for the close button link; only used when closable = true.

configs.name: disabledCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to be applied to a Tab when it is disabled.

events.name: activate
events.doc: Fired when the tab is activated.

events.name: beforeclose
events.doc: Fires if the user clicks on the Tab's close button, but before the close event is fired. Return false from any listener to stop the close event being fired

events.name: close
events.doc: Fires to indicate that the tab is to be closed, usually because the user has clicked the close button.

events.name: deactivate
events.doc: Fired when the tab is deactivated.

Ext.TaskManager.doc: A static Ext.util.TaskRunner instance that can be used to start and stop arbitrary tasks. See Ext.util.TaskRunner for supported methods and task config properties.

Ext.Template.doc: Represents an HTML fragment template. Templates may be precompiled for greater performance.

configs.name: compiled
configs.doc: True to immediately compile the template. Defaults to false.

configs.name: disableFormats
configs.doc: True to disable format functions in the template. If the template doesn't contain format functions, setting disableFormats to true will reduce apply time. Defaults to false.

Ext.tip.QuickTip.doc: A specialized tooltip class for tooltips that can be specified in markup and automatically managed by the global Ext.tip.QuickTipManager instance. See the QuickTipManager documentation for additional usage details and examples.

configs.name: interceptTitles
configs.doc: True to automatically use the element's DOM title value if available.

configs.name: target
configs.doc: The target HTMLElement, Ext.Element or id to associate with this Quicktip (defaults to the document).

Ext.tip.QuickTipManager.doc: Provides attractive and customizable tooltips for any element. The QuickTips singleton is used to configure and manage tooltips globally for multiple elements in a generic manner. To create individual tooltips with maximum customizability, you should consider either Ext.tip.Tip or Ext.tip.ToolTip.

Ext.tip.Tip.doc: This is the base class for Ext.tip.QuickTip and Ext.tip.ToolTip that provides the basic layout and positioning that all tip-based classes require. This class can be used directly for simple, statically-positioned tips that are displayed programmatically, or it can be extended to provide custom tip implementations.

configs.name: closable
configs.doc: True to render a close tool button into the tooltip header.

configs.name: closeAction
configs.doc: The action to take when the close header tool is clicked

configs.name: constrainPosition
configs.doc: If true, then the tooltip will be automatically constrained to stay within the browser viewport.

configs.name: defaultAlign
configs.doc: Experimental. The default Ext.Element.alignTo anchor position value for this tip relative to its element of origin.

configs.name: maxWidth
configs.doc: The maximum width of the tip in pixels. The maximum supported value is 500.

configs.name: minWidth
configs.doc: The minimum width of the tip in pixels.

configs.name: shadow
configs.doc: True or sides for the default effect, frame for 4-way shadow, and drop for bottom-right shadow.

configs.name: width
configs.doc: Width in pixels of the tip (defaults to auto). Width will be ignored if it exceeds the bounds of minWidth or maxWidth. The maximum supported value is 500.

Ext.tip.ToolTip.doc: ToolTip is a Ext.tip.Tip implementation that handles the common case of displaying a tooltip when hovering over a certain element or elements on the page. It allows fine-grained control over the tooltip's alignment relative to the target element or mouse, and the timing of when it is automatically shown and hidden.

configs.name: anchor
configs.doc: If specified, indicates that the tip should be anchored to a particular side of the target element or mouse pointer (top, right, bottom, or left), with an arrow pointing back at the target or mouse pointer. If constrainPosition is enabled, this will be used as a preferred value only and may be flipped as needed.

configs.name: anchorOffset
configs.doc: A numeric pixel value used to offset the default position of the anchor arrow. When the anchor position is on the top or bottom of the tooltip, anchorOffset will be used as a horizontal offset. Likewise, when the anchor position is on the left or right side, anchorOffset will be used as a vertical offset.

configs.name: anchorToTarget
configs.doc: True to anchor the tooltip to the target element, false to anchor it relative to the mouse coordinates. When anchorToTarget is true, use defaultAlign to control tooltip alignment to the target element. When anchorToTarget is false, use anchor instead to control alignment.

configs.name: autoHide
configs.doc: True to automatically hide the tooltip after the mouse exits the target element or after the dismissDelay has expired if set. If closable = true a close tool button will be rendered into the tooltip header.

configs.name: delegate
configs.doc: A DomQuery selector which allows selection of individual elements within the target element to trigger showing and hiding the ToolTip as the mouse moves within the target.

configs.name: dismissDelay
configs.doc: Delay in milliseconds before the tooltip automatically hides. To disable automatic hiding, set dismissDelay = 0.

configs.name: hideDelay
configs.doc: Delay in milliseconds after the mouse exits the target element but before the tooltip actually hides. Set to 0 for the tooltip to hide immediately.

configs.name: mouseOffset
configs.doc: An XY offset from the mouse position where the tooltip should be shown.

configs.name: showDelay
configs.doc: Delay in milliseconds before the tooltip displays after the mouse enters the target element.

configs.name: target
configs.doc: The target element or string id to monitor for mouseover events to trigger showing this ToolTip.

configs.name: trackMouse
configs.doc: True to have the tooltip follow the mouse as it moves over the target element.

Ext.toolbar.Fill.doc: A non-rendering placeholder item which instructs the Toolbar's Layout to begin using the right-justified button container.

Ext.toolbar.Item.doc: The base class that other non-interacting Toolbar Item classes should extend in order to get some basic common toolbar item functionality.

configs.name: overflowText
configs.doc: Text to be used for the menu if the item is overflowed.

Ext.toolbar.Paging.doc: As the number of records increases, the time required for the browser to render them increases. Paging is used to reduce the amount of data exchanged with the client.

configs.name: afterPageText
configs.doc: Customizable piece of the default paging text. Note that this string is formatted using {0} as a token that is replaced by the number of total pages. This token should be preserved when overriding this string if showing the total page count is desired.

configs.name: beforePageText
configs.doc: The text displayed before the input item.

configs.name: displayInfo
configs.doc: true to display the displayMsg

configs.name: displayMsg
configs.doc: The paging status message to display. Note that this string is formatted using the braced numbers {0}-{2} as tokens that are replaced by the values for start, end and total respectively. These tokens should be preserved when overriding this string if showing those values is desired.

configs.name: emptyMsg
configs.doc: The message to display when no records are found.

configs.name: firstText
configs.doc: The quicktip text displayed for the first page button. Note: quick tips must be initialized for the quicktip to show.

configs.name: inputItemWidth
configs.doc: The width in pixels of the input field used to display and change the current page number.

configs.name: lastText
configs.doc: The quicktip text displayed for the last page button. Note: quick tips must be initialized for the quicktip to show.

configs.name: nextText
configs.doc: The quicktip text displayed for the next page button. Note: quick tips must be initialized for the quicktip to show.

configs.name: prependButtons
configs.doc: true to insert any configured items before the paging buttons.

configs.name: prevText
configs.doc: The quicktip text displayed for the previous page button. Note: quick tips must be initialized for the quicktip to show.

configs.name: refreshText
configs.doc: The quicktip text displayed for the Refresh button. Note: quick tips must be initialized for the quicktip to show.

configs.name: store
configs.doc: The Ext.data.Store the paging toolbar should use as its data source.

events.name: beforechange
events.doc: Fires just before the active page is changed. Return false to prevent the active page from being changed.

events.name: change
events.doc: Fires after the active page has been changed.

Ext.toolbar.Separator.doc: A simple class that adds a vertical separator bar between toolbar items (css class: 'x-toolbar-separator').

Ext.toolbar.Spacer.doc: A simple element that adds extra horizontal space between items in a toolbar. By default a 2px wide space is added via CSS specification:

Ext.toolbar.TextItem.doc: A simple class that renders text directly into a toolbar.

configs.name: text
configs.doc: The text to be used as innerHTML (html tags are accepted)

Ext.toolbar.Toolbar.doc: Basic Toolbar class. Although the defaultType for Toolbar is button, Toolbar elements (child items for the Toolbar container) may be virtually any type of Component.

configs.name: enableOverflow
configs.doc: Configure true to make the toolbar provide a button which activates a dropdown Menu to show items which overflow the Toolbar's width.

configs.name: layout
configs.doc: This class assigns a default layout (layout: 'hbox'). Developers may override this configuration option if another layout is required (the constructor must be passed a configuration object in this case instead of an array). See Ext.container.Container.layout for additional information.

configs.name: menuTriggerCls
configs.doc: Configure the icon class of the overflow button.

configs.name: vertical
configs.doc: Set to true to make the toolbar vertical. The layout will become a vbox.

events.name: overflowchange
events.doc: Fires after the overflow state has changed.

Ext.tree.Column.doc: Provides indentation and folder structure markup for a Tree taking into account depth and position within the tree hierarchy.

Ext.tree.Panel.doc: The TreePanel provides tree-structured UI representation of tree-structured data. A TreePanel must be bound to a Ext.data.TreeStore. TreePanel's support multiple columns through the columns configuration.

configs.name: animate
configs.doc: True to enable animated expand/collapse. Defaults to the value of Ext.enableFx.

configs.name: displayField
configs.doc: The field inside the model that will be used as the node's text.

configs.name: folderSort
configs.doc: True to automatically prepend a leaf sorter to the store. Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: hideHeaders
configs.doc: True to hide the headers. Defaults to undefined.

configs.name: lines
configs.doc: False to disable tree lines.

configs.name: root
configs.doc: Allows you to not specify a store on this TreePanel. This is useful for creating a simple tree with preloaded data without having to specify a TreeStore and Model. A store and model will be created and root will be passed to that store.

configs.name: rootVisible
configs.doc: False to hide the root node.

configs.name: singleExpand
configs.doc: True if only 1 node per branch may be expanded.

configs.name: useArrows
configs.doc: True to use Vista-style arrows in the tree.

events.name: beforeitemappend
events.doc: Fires before a new child is appended, return false to cancel the append.

events.name: beforeitemcollapse
events.doc: Fires before this node is collapsed.

events.name: beforeitemexpand
events.doc: Fires before this node is expanded.

events.name: beforeiteminsert
events.doc: Fires before a new child is inserted, return false to cancel the insert.

events.name: beforeitemmove
events.doc: Fires before this node is moved to a new location in the tree. Return false to cancel the move.

events.name: beforeitemremove
events.doc: Fires before a child is removed, return false to cancel the remove.

events.name: beforeload
events.doc: Fires before a request is made for a new data object. If the beforeload handler returns false the load action will be canceled.

events.name: checkchange
events.doc: Fires when a node with a checkbox's checked property changes

events.name: itemappend
events.doc: Fires when a new child node is appended

events.name: itemcollapse
events.doc: Fires when this node is collapsed.

events.name: itemexpand
events.doc: Fires when this node is expanded.

events.name: iteminsert
events.doc: Fires when a new child node is inserted.

events.name: itemmove
events.doc: Fires when this node is moved to a new location in the tree

events.name: itemremove
events.doc: Fires when a child node is removed

events.name: load
events.doc: Fires whenever records have been prefetched

Ext.tree.plugin.TreeViewDragDrop.doc: This plugin provides drag and/or drop functionality for a TreeView.

configs.name: allowContainerDrop
configs.doc: True if drops on the tree container (outside of a specific tree node) are allowed.

configs.name: allowParentInsert
configs.doc: Allow inserting a dragged node between an expanded parent node and its first child that will become a sibling of the parent when dropped.

configs.name: appendOnly
configs.doc: True if the tree should only allow append drops (use for trees which are sorted).

configs.name: ddGroup
configs.doc: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then both the DragZones and DropZone used by this plugin will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group.

configs.name: dragGroup
configs.doc: The ddGroup to which the DragZone will belong.

configs.name: dropGroup
configs.doc: The ddGroup to which the DropZone will belong.

configs.name: enableDrag
configs.doc: Set to false to disallow dragging items from the View.

configs.name: enableDrop
configs.doc: Set to false to disallow the View from accepting drop gestures.

configs.name: expandDelay
configs.doc: The delay in milliseconds to wait before expanding a target tree node while dragging a droppable node over the target.

configs.name: nodeHighlightColor
configs.doc: The color to use when visually highlighting the dragged or dropped node (default value is light blue). The color must be a 6 digit hex value, without a preceding '#'. See also nodeHighlightOnDrop and nodeHighlightOnRepair.

configs.name: nodeHighlightOnDrop
configs.doc: Whether or not to highlight any nodes after they are successfully dropped on their target. Defaults to the value of Ext.enableFx. See also nodeHighlightColor and nodeHighlightOnRepair.

configs.name: nodeHighlightOnRepair
configs.doc: Whether or not to highlight any nodes after they are repaired from an unsuccessful drag/drop. Defaults to the value of Ext.enableFx. See also nodeHighlightColor and nodeHighlightOnDrop.

events.name: beforedrop
events.params: node(HTMLElement) data(Object) overModel(Ext.data.Model) dropPosition(String) dropFunction(Function) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: This event is fired through the TreeView. Add listeners to the TreeView object

events.name: drop
events.doc: This event is fired through the TreeView. Add listeners to the TreeView object Fired when a drop operation has been completed and the data has been moved or copied.

configs.name: animate
configs.doc: True to enable animated expand/collapse (defaults to the value of Ext.enableFx)

configs.name: rootVisible
configs.doc: False to hide the root node.

configs.name: allowContainerDrop
configs.doc: True if drops on the tree container (outside of a specific tree node) are allowed.

configs.name: allowParentInsert
configs.doc: Allow inserting a dragged node between an expanded parent node and its first child that will become a sibling of the parent when dropped.

configs.name: appendOnly
configs.doc: True if the tree should only allow append drops (use for trees which are sorted).

configs.name: expandDelay
configs.doc: The delay in milliseconds to wait before expanding a target tree node while dragging a droppable node over the target.

configs.name: allowFunctions
configs.doc: Specify true if the addAll function should add function references to the collection. Defaults to false.

events.name: add
events.doc: Fires when an item is added to the collection.

events.name: clear
events.doc: Fires when the collection is cleared.

events.name: remove
events.doc: Fires when an item is removed from the collection.

events.name: replace
events.doc: Fires when an item is replaced in the collection.

Ext.util.ClickRepeater.doc: A wrapper class which can be applied to any element. Fires a click event while the mouse is pressed. The interval between firings may be specified in the config but defaults to 20 milliseconds.

configs.name: accelerate
configs.doc: True if autorepeating should start slowly and accelerate. interval and delay are ignored.

configs.name: delay
configs.doc: The initial delay before the repeating event begins firing. Similar to an autorepeat key delay.

configs.name: el
configs.doc: The element to act as a button.

configs.name: interval
configs.doc: The interval between firings of the click event. Default 20 ms.

configs.name: pressedCls
configs.doc: A CSS class name to be applied to the element while pressed.

configs.name: preventDefault
configs.doc: True to prevent the default click event

configs.name: stopDefault
configs.doc: True to stop the default click event

events.name: click
events.doc: Fires on a specified interval during the time the element is pressed.

events.name: mousedown
events.doc: Fires when the mouse button is depressed.

events.name: mouseup
events.doc: Fires when the mouse key is released.

Ext.util.ComponentDragger.doc: A subclass of Ext.dd.DragTracker which handles dragging any Component.

configs.name: constrain
configs.doc: Specify as true to constrain the Component to within the bounds of the constrainTo region.

configs.name: constrainDelegate
configs.doc: Specify as true to constrain the drag handles within the constrainTo region.

configs.name: delegate
configs.doc:
Optional.

A DomQuery selector which identifies child elements within the Component's encapsulating Element which are the drag handles. This limits dragging to only begin when the matching elements are mousedowned.

Ext.util.Cookies.doc: Utility class for setting/reading values from browser cookies. Values can be written using the set method. Values can be read using the get method. A cookie can be invalidated on the client machine using the clear method.

Ext.util.DelayedTask.doc: The DelayedTask class provides a convenient way to buffer the execution of a method, performing setTimeout where a new timeout cancels the old timeout. When called, the task will wait the specified time period before executing. If durng that time period, the task is called again, the original call will be cancelled. This continues so that the function is only called a single time for each iteration.

Ext.util.Filter.doc: Filters are always used in the context of MixedCollections, though Stores frequently create them when filtering and searching on their records.

configs.name: anyMatch
configs.doc: True to allow any match - no regex start/end line anchors will be added.

configs.name: caseSensitive
configs.doc: True to make the regex case sensitive (adds 'i' switch to regex).

configs.name: exactMatch
configs.doc: True to force exact match (^ and $ characters added to the regex). Ignored if anyMatch is true.

configs.name: property
configs.doc: The property to filter on. Required unless a filterFn is passed

configs.name: root
configs.doc: Optional root property. This is mostly useful when filtering a Store, in which case we set the root to 'data' to make the filter pull the property out of the data object of each item

Ext.util.Floating.doc: A mixin to add floating capability to a Component.

configs.name: focusOnToFront
configs.doc: Specifies whether the floated component should be automatically focused when it is brought to the front.

configs.name: shadow
configs.doc: Specifies whether the floating component should be given a shadow. Set to true to automatically create an Ext.Shadow, or a string indicating the shadow's display Ext.Shadow.mode. Set to false to disable the shadow.

Ext.util.Format.doc: This class is a centralized place for formatting functions. It includes functions to format various different types of data, such as text, dates and numeric values.

Ext.util.Grouper.doc: Represents a single grouper that can be applied to a Store. The grouper works in the same fashion as the Ext.util.Sorter.

Ext.util.HashMap.doc:
Represents a collection of a set of key and value pairs. Each key in the HashMap must be unique, the same key cannot exist twice. Access to items is provided via the key only. Sample usage: 

var map = new Ext.util.HashMap();
map.add('key1', 1);
map.add('key2', 2);
map.add('key3', 3);

map.each(function(key, value, length){
    console.log(key, value, length);
});

events.name: add
events.doc: Fires when a new item is added to the hash

events.name: clear
events.doc: Fires when the hash is cleared.

events.name: remove
events.doc: Fires when an item is removed from the hash.

events.name: replace
events.doc: Fires when an item is replaced in the hash.

Ext.util.History.doc: History management component that allows you to register arbitrary tokens that signify application history state on navigation actions. You can then handle the history change event in order to reset your application UI to the appropriate state when the user navigates forward or backward through the browser history stack.

events.name: change
events.doc: Fires when navigation back or forwards within the local page's history occurs.

events.name: ready
events.doc: Fires when the Ext.util.History singleton has been initialized and is ready for use.

Ext.util.Inflector.doc: General purpose inflector class that pluralizes, singularizes and ordinalizes words. Sample usage:

Ext.util.KeyMap.doc:
Handles mapping keys to actions for an element. One key map can be used for multiple actions. The constructor accepts the same config object as defined by addBinding. If you bind a callback function to a KeyMap, anytime the KeyMap handles an expected key combination it will call the function with this signature (if the match is a multi-key combination the callback will still be called only once): (String key, Ext.EventObject e) A KeyMap can also handle a string representation of keys. By default KeyMap starts enabled.
Usage:

Ext.util.KeyNav.doc: Provides a convenient wrapper for normalized keyboard navigation. KeyNav allows you to bind navigation keys to function calls that will get called when the keys are pressed, providing an easy way to implement custom navigation schemes for any UI component.

configs.name: defaultEventAction
configs.doc: The method to call on the Ext.EventObject after this KeyNav intercepts a key. Valid values are Ext.EventObject.stopEvent, Ext.EventObject.preventDefault and Ext.EventObject.stopPropagation.

configs.name: disabled
configs.doc: True to disable this KeyNav instance.

configs.name: forceKeyDown
configs.doc: Handle the keydown event instead of keypress. KeyNav automatically does this for IE since IE does not propagate special keys on keypress, but setting this to true will force other browsers to also handle keydown instead of keypress.

Ext.util.Memento.doc: This class manages a set of captured properties from an object. These captured properties can later be restored to an object.

Ext.util.MixedCollection.doc: Represents a collection of a set of key and value pairs

Ext.util.Observable.doc: Base class that provides a common interface for publishing events. Subclasses are expected to to have a property events with all the events defined, and, optionally, a property listeners with configured listeners defined.

configs.name: listeners
configs.doc: A config object containing one or more event handlers to be added to this object during initialization. This should be a valid listeners config object as specified in the addListener example for attaching multiple handlers at once.

Ext.util.Point.doc: Represents a 2D point with x and y properties, useful for comparison and instantiation from an event:

Ext.util.Region.doc: This class represents a rectangular region in X,Y space, and performs geometric transformations or tests upon the region.

Ext.util.Sortable.doc: A mixin which allows a data component to be sorted. This is used by e.g. Ext.data.Store and Ext.data.TreeStore.

Ext.util.Sorter.doc: Represents a single sorter that can be applied to a Store. The sorter is used to compare two values against each other for the purpose of ordering them. Ordering is achieved by specifying either:

configs.name: direction
configs.doc: The direction to sort by.

configs.name: property
configs.doc: The property to sort by. Required unless sorterFn is provided. The property is extracted from the object directly and compared for sorting using the built in comparison operators.

configs.name: root
configs.doc: Optional root property. This is mostly useful when sorting a Store, in which case we set the root to 'data' to make the filter pull the property out of the data object of each item

Ext.util.TaskRunner.doc: Provides the ability to execute one or more arbitrary tasks in a multithreaded manner. Generally, you can use the singleton Ext.TaskManager instead, but if needed, you can create separate instances of TaskRunner. Any number of separate tasks can be started at any time and will run independently of each other. Example usage:

Ext.util.TextMetrics.doc: Provides precise pixel measurements for blocks of text so that you can determine exactly how high and wide, in pixels, a given block of text will be. Note that when measuring text, it should be plain text and should not contain any HTML, otherwise it may not be measured correctly.

Ext.Version.doc: A utility class that wrap around a string version number and provide convenient method to perform comparison. See also: compare. Example:

Ext.view.AbstractView.doc: This is an abstract superclass and should not be used directly. Please see Ext.view.View.

configs.name: blockRefresh
configs.doc: Set this to true to ignore datachanged events on the bound store. This is useful if you wish to provide custom transition animations via a plugin

configs.name: deferEmptyText
configs.doc: True to defer emptyText being applied until the store's first load.

configs.name: deferInitialRefresh
configs.doc: Defaults to true to defer the initial refresh of the view.

configs.name: disableSelection
configs.doc: True to disable selection within the DataView. This configuration will lock the selection model that the DataView uses.

configs.name: emptyText
configs.doc: The text to display in the view when there is no data to display. Note that when using local data the emptyText will not be displayed unless you set the deferEmptyText option to false.

configs.name: itemCls
configs.doc: Specifies the class to be assigned to each element in the view when used in conjunction with the itemTpl configuration.

configs.name: itemSelector
configs.doc: This is a required setting. A simple CSS selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child) that will be used to determine what nodes this DataView will be working with. The itemSelector is used to map DOM nodes to records. As such, there should only be one root level element that matches the selector for each record.

configs.name: itemTpl
configs.doc: The inner portion of the item template to be rendered. Follows an XTemplate structure and will be placed inside of a tpl.

configs.name: loadMask
configs.doc: False to disable a load mask from displaying will the view is loading. This can also be a Ext.LoadMask configuration object.

configs.name: loadingCls
configs.doc: The CSS class to apply to the loading message element. Defaults to Ext.LoadMask.prototype.msgCls x-mask-loading.

configs.name: loadingHeight
configs.doc: If specified, gives an explicit height for the data view when it is showing the loadingText, if that is specified. This is useful to prevent the view's height from collapsing to zero when the loading mask is applied and there are no other contents in the data view.

configs.name: loadingText
configs.doc: A string to display during data load operations. If specified, this text will be displayed in a loading div and the view's contents will be cleared while loading, otherwise the view's contents will continue to display normally until the new data is loaded and the contents are replaced.

configs.name: loadingUseMsg
configs.doc: Whether or not to use the loading message.

configs.name: multiSelect
configs.doc: True to allow selection of more than one item at a time, false to allow selection of only a single item at a time or no selection at all, depending on the value of singleSelect.

configs.name: overItemCls
configs.doc: A CSS class to apply to each item in the view on mouseover. Ensure trackOver is set to true to make use of this.

configs.name: selectedItemCls
configs.doc: A CSS class to apply to each selected item in the view.

configs.name: simpleSelect
configs.doc: True to enable multiselection by clicking on multiple items without requiring the user to hold Shift or Ctrl, false to force the user to hold Ctrl or Shift to select more than on item.

configs.name: singleSelect
configs.doc: True to allow selection of exactly one item at a time, false to allow no selection at all. Note that if multiSelect = true, this value will be ignored.

configs.name: store
configs.doc: The Ext.data.Store to bind this DataView to.

configs.name: tpl
configs.doc: The HTML fragment or an array of fragments that will make up the template used by this DataView. This should be specified in the same format expected by the constructor of Ext.XTemplate.

configs.name: trackOver
configs.doc: True to enable mouseenter and mouseleave events

events.name: beforerefresh
events.doc: Fires before the view is refreshed

events.name: itemadd
events.doc: Fires when the nodes associated with an recordset have been added to the underlying store

events.name: itemremove
events.doc: Fires when the node associated with an individual record is removed

events.name: itemupdate
events.doc: Fires when the node associated with an individual record is updated

events.name: refresh
events.doc: Fires when the view is refreshed

events.name: viewready
events.doc: Fires when the View's item elements representing Store items has been rendered. If the deferInitialRefresh flag was set (and it is true by default), this will be after initial render, and no items will be available for selection until this event fires.

configs.name: pageSize
configs.doc: If greater than 0, a Ext.toolbar.Paging is displayed at the bottom of the list and store queries will execute with page start and limit parameters. Defaults to 0.

Ext.view.BoundListKeyNav.doc: A specialized Ext.util.KeyNav implementation for navigating a Ext.view.BoundList using the keyboard. The up, down, pageup, pagedown, home, and end keys move the active highlight through the list. The enter key invokes the selection model's select action using the highlighted item.

configs.name: boundList
configs.doc: The Ext.view.BoundList instance for which key navigation will be managed.

Ext.view.Table.doc: This class encapsulates the user interface for a tabular data set. It acts as a centralized manager for controlling the various interface elements of the view. This includes handling events, such as row and cell level based DOM events. It also reacts to events from the underlying Ext.selection.Model to provide visual feedback to the user.

Ext.view.TableChunker.doc: Produces optimized XTemplates for chunks of tables to be used in grids, trees and other table based widgets.

Ext.view.View.doc: A mechanism for displaying data using custom layout templates and formatting.

events.name: beforecontainerclick
events.doc: Fires before the click event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainercontextmenu
events.doc: Fires before the contextmenu event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainerdblclick
events.doc: Fires before the dblclick event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainerkeydown
events.doc: Fires before the keydown event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainermousedown
events.doc: Fires before the mousedown event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainermouseout
events.doc: Fires before the mouseout event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainermouseover
events.doc: Fires before the mouseover event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecontainermouseup
events.doc: Fires before the mouseup event on the container is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemclick
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the click event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemcontextmenu
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the contextmenu event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemdblclick
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the dblclick event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemkeydown
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the keydown event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemmousedown
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the mousedown event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemmouseenter
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the mouseenter event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemmouseleave
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the mouseleave event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeitemmouseup
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires before the mouseup event on an item is processed. Returns false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforeselect
events.doc: Fires before a selection is made. If any handlers return false, the selection is cancelled.

events.name: containerclick
events.doc: Fires when the container is clicked.

events.name: containercontextmenu
events.doc: Fires when the container is right clicked.

events.name: containerdblclick
events.doc: Fires when the container is double clicked.

events.name: containerkeydown
events.doc: Fires when a key is pressed while the container is focused, and no item is currently selected.

events.name: containermouseout
events.doc: Fires when you move the mouse out of the container.

events.name: containermouseover
events.doc: Fires when you move the mouse over the container.

events.name: containermouseup
events.doc: Fires when there is a mouse up on the container

events.name: itemclick
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when an item is clicked.

events.name: itemcontextmenu
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when an item is right clicked.

events.name: itemdblclick
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when an item is double clicked.

events.name: itemkeydown
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when a key is pressed while an item is currently selected.

events.name: itemmousedown
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when there is a mouse down on an item

events.name: itemmouseenter
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when the mouse enters an item.

events.name: itemmouseleave
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when the mouse leaves an item.

events.name: itemmouseup
events.params: this(Ext.view.View) record(Ext.data.Model) item(HTMLElement) index(Number) e(Ext.EventObject) eOpts(Object)
events.doc: Fires when there is a mouse up on an item

events.name: selectionchange
events.doc: Fires when the selected nodes change. Relayed event from the underlying selection model.

Ext.window.MessageBox.doc: Utility class for generating different styles of message boxes. The singleton instance, Ext.MessageBox alias Ext.Msg can also be used.

Ext.window.Window.doc: A specialized panel intended for use as an application window. Windows are floated, resizable, and draggable by default. Windows can be maximized to fill the viewport, restored to their prior size, and can be minimized.

configs.name: animateTarget
configs.doc: Id or element from which the window should animate while opening.

configs.name: baseCls
configs.doc: The base CSS class to apply to this panel's element.

configs.name: closable
configs.doc: True to display the 'close' tool button and allow the user to close the window, false to hide the button and disallow closing the window.

configs.name: collapsed
configs.doc: True to render the window collapsed, false to render it expanded. Note that if expandOnShow is true (the default) it will override the collapsed config and the window will always be expanded when shown.

configs.name: constrain
configs.doc: True to constrain the window within its containing element, false to allow it to fall outside of its containing element. By default the window will be rendered to document.body. To render and constrain the window within another element specify renderTo. Optionally the header only can be constrained using constrainHeader.

configs.name: constrainHeader
configs.doc: True to constrain the window header within its containing element (allowing the window body to fall outside of its containing element) or false to allow the header to fall outside its containing element. Optionally the entire window can be constrained using constrain.

configs.name: defaultFocus
configs.doc: Specifies a Component to receive focus when this Window is focused.

configs.name: draggable
configs.doc: True to allow the window to be dragged by the header bar, false to disable dragging. Note that by default the window will be centered in the viewport, so if dragging is disabled the window may need to be positioned programmatically after render (e.g., myWindow.setPosition(100, 100);).

configs.name: expandOnShow
configs.doc: True to always expand the window when it is displayed, false to keep it in its current state (which may be collapsed) when displayed.

configs.name: hidden
configs.doc: Render this Window hidden. If true, the hide method will be called internally.

configs.name: maximizable
configs.doc: True to display the 'maximize' tool button and allow the user to maximize the window, false to hide the button and disallow maximizing the window. Note that when a window is maximized, the tool button will automatically change to a 'restore' button with the appropriate behavior already built-in that will restore the window to its previous size.

configs.name: maximized
configs.doc: True to initially display the window in a maximized state.

configs.name: minimizable
configs.doc: True to display the 'minimize' tool button and allow the user to minimize the window, false to hide the button and disallow minimizing the window. Note that this button provides no implementation -- the behavior of minimizing a window is implementation-specific, so the minimize event must be handled and a custom minimize behavior implemented for this option to be useful.

configs.name: modal
configs.doc: True to make the window modal and mask everything behind it when displayed, false to display it without restricting access to other UI elements.

configs.name: plain
configs.doc: True to render the window body with a transparent background so that it will blend into the framing elements, false to add a lighter background color to visually highlight the body element and separate it more distinctly from the surrounding frame.

configs.name: resizable
configs.doc: Specify as true to allow user resizing at each edge and corner of the window, false to disable resizing.

configs.name: x
configs.doc: The X position of the left edge of the window on initial showing. Defaults to centering the Window within the width of the Window's container Element (The Element that the Window is rendered to).

configs.name: y
configs.doc: The Y position of the top edge of the window on initial showing. Defaults to centering the Window within the height of the Window's container Element (The Element that the Window is rendered to).

events.name: activate
events.doc: Fires after the window has been visually activated via setActive.

events.name: deactivate
events.doc: Fires after the window has been visually deactivated via setActive.

events.name: maximize
events.doc: Fires after the window has been maximized.

events.name: minimize
events.doc: Fires after the window has been minimized.

events.name: resize
events.doc: Fires after the window has been resized.

events.name: restore
events.doc: Fires after the window has been restored to its original size after being maximized.

Ext.WindowManager.doc: The default global floating Component group that is available automatically.

Ext.XTemplate.doc: A template class that supports advanced functionality like:

configs.name: codeRe
configs.doc: The regular expression used to match code variables. Default: matches {[expression]}.

configs.name: compiled
configs.doc: Only applies to Ext.Template, XTemplates are compiled automatically.

Ext.ZIndexManager.doc: A class that manages a group of Ext.Component.floating Components and provides z-order management, and Component activation behavior, including masking below the active (topmost) Component.
